Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is the cinematic magic and the sense of joyous fun that makes "Star Wars" a very special film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A boy's adventure yarn in the most traditional, unabashedly entertaining sense.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Oh, the astronomical audiences; oh, the mundane story; oh, the over-cute little robots (one fat, one thin); oh, the vapid actors, the galactic shootouts; oh, the brilliant technology and oh, the boredom of it all.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars is, indeed, a movie that dares to be different, not only in setting, but in theme at a time when imagination has surrendered to realism in motion pictures. If you don't enjoy Star Wars, you are not as young at heart as you think you are.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It's a "fun movie", as they say. Meaning that it doesn't mean anything, it's a superior, pop plaything to play with, to be innocently enjoyed and thrown away like a four-dollar comic book.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: I haven't had as much fun at a movie in years. With its technical wizardry, high-velocity storytelling and spirited good humor, Star Wars dazzles the child in us.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: For two hours and one minute it takes you on a "heavenly" romp. Don't miss it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A hell of a drug, the kind of movie that seems almost purposely designed to convince all but the most jaded members of its audience of the expressive power of the medium.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It's a near timeless milestone in cinema that lives up to its legacy as a simple, exciting, and fun science fiction fantasy.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars is nothing short of pure unadulterated entertainment, something that has been sorely lacking in a great majority of recent films.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Tender loving care abounds in the production... The casting is great, with the inexperienced giving it a naivety that is essential to the story, and the veterans a rock-solid identification with evil (Cushing) and good (Guinness).

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: An epic intergalactic masterpiece.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: ...a stirring introduction to such legendary figures as Luke Skywalker, Han Solo, and Princess Leia.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It must be nice to be able to spend $8-million to fulfil your childhood fantasies. George Lucas has that much money because of the tremendous success of his last movie, American Graffiti, and he spent it both wisely and well on Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Filmmakers have tried for decades, but they can't make a better space saga. It's the perfect stand-alone science fiction film that's only rivaled by its darker sequel.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: George Lucas, who brought us those memorable kids in American Graffiti, is back with Star Wars -- a film that would captivate the Mel's Drive-In crowd as well as enchant the kid in all of us.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It's a throwback to that more innocent kind of film, where you know who's good and who's bad, where you boo the villain and cheer the hero...The movie makes fun of those clichés, but director George Lucas must love them too, because he makes them work.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars is not a film to be written about, it's an experience. It's that rare experience for both adults and kids that shortchanges neither. Go -- and enjoy.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The special effects and technical achievement are the greatest ever. Lucas and company have created an unusual and diverse universe and put it before our eyes.Not once is there a feeling of unnaturalness or fakery.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The film was made with obvious relish by everyone involved, and it guarantees a mindlessly happy two hours to all who take the time to see it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Proves anew that ticket-buyers young and old in this jaded era will still respond to a strong and simple story about good versus evil with the good guys winning.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Lucas's ingenuity is reaffirmed by Darth Vader's every asthmatic exhalation, by Princess Leia's cinnamon-bun chignons.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: If anybody wondered where Lucas has been since the release nearly four years ago of American Graffiti, the answer is at hand. Star Wars... is the most exciting picture to be released this year -- exciting as theater and exciting as cinema.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A gigantic, lavish, brilliantly executive old-time movie comic strip.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: [Star Wars] will undoubtedly emerge as one of the true classics in the genre of science fiction/fantasy films. In any event, it will be thrilling audiences of all ages for a long time to come.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is the best such film since 2001, and in certain respects it is one of the most exciting ever made.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is competently if not brilliantly mounted, moderately exciting and charmingly capable of poking fun at itself... It's a lot less patronising than most Disney films and toweringly better than the other blockbusters around at the moment.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Enormous and exhilarating fun for those who are prepared to settle down in their seats and let it all wash over them.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: George Lucas's science fiction adventure is an exhilarating update of Flash Gordon, very much in the same half-jokey, half-earnest mood, but backed by special effects that, for once, really work and are intelligently integrated with the story.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Heavy SF readers will recognize each character, every situation by its stock number and almost feel the affection Lucas has for them. There is not the tiniest sniff of cynicism anywhere in this film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The view of outer space is a marvelous one, awe-inspiring in its beauty, and the artists and designers who did the work... deserve as many plaudits as can be thought up.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A mind-blowing spectacle that sends the audience off onto the wondrously strange world of fantasy and satisfies just about everyone's adolescent craving for a corny old-fashioned adventure movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Endlessly imitated but never rivalled, this opening instalment of George Lucas's original space trilogy dresses up the timeless tale of good versus evil with ground-breaking special effects and a dazzling array of intergalactic characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Some of Lucas' scriptwriting is clever, a hip updating of the stilted language of the old Flash Gordon serials. Also, the film is dotted with weird-looking creatures who might have stepped out of the pages of a Marvel comic book.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: There's no breather in the picture, no lyricism; the only attempt at beauty is in the double sunset.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: George Lucas, who made American Graffiti, has put together a sci-fi film that draws on any number of associations. Star Wars is both amazing and familiar.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: All in all, it is an outrageously successful, what will be called a "classic," compilation of nonsense, largely derived but thoroughly reconditioned.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Sci-fi action classic perfect for sharing with older kids.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars will do very nicely for those lucky enough to be children or unlucky enough never to have grown up.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Like it or not, Star Wars is a seminal movie that began a whole cycle of sci-fi works and also launched the careers of many actors and craftsmen.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: First of a sci-fi phenomenon, #4 in the series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: This friendliness is the key emotion in this clean, clever, entertaining movie by a gifted and developing artist. It's a feeling that crackles in the sensational special effects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is a sweeping epic with classical themes lifted from the teachings of Joseph Campbell, but it maintains strong central characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: After Star Wars, movies not only spawned profitable kids' toys; they merged with kids' toys, and basically became toys themselves.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It has shaped our imaginations, our inner worlds. The series may be over at last, but the Force will be with us always.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A grand and glorious film that may well be the smash hit of 1977, and certainly is the best movie of the year so far.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: On the basic level of simple entertainment it succeeds as well as any film ever has.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: So, is this the best film of all time? Certainly not. But it definitely is one of the most enduring, and it's hard not to be seduced.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A magnificent film. George Lucas set out to make the biggest possible adventure fantasy out of his memories of serials and older action epics, and he succeeded brilliantly.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars is enchanting in the most literal sense of the word. It's pure comic strip fantasy, to be enjoyed even more by nostalgic adults than by wide-eyed youngsters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Easily the best movie in town this summer and perhaps destined to be the best of 1977.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Has distinct limitations, but the current return to a cinema of spectacle and wonder is wholly encouraging.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Puts most recent 'epic' blockbuster mediocrities to shame.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: One of those few films that you can expect to find in almost anyone's collection.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Lucas' trilogy earned its place in eternity not for its mechanical precision, but for its intangible qualities of inspiration and wonder.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: ...the key to the movie's success is its creation of a family of characters we can love and believe in.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The movie, modeled after old-fashioned Westerns and Joseph Campbell's writings about mythology, also has a sweet innocence.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The special effects wizardry seen in Star Wars is put in aid of a pure 1930s space opera pulp story . . .

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Those of us who were old enough to catch the film as kids the first time around may even find an unexpected lump in their throats as the nostalgia gates bust wide open and Vader gets his, once again, on that giant, silver screen.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: What's fascinating from a cinematic point of view is the magnificently derivative nature of the film. It's an enormous summary of characters, styles, and plot points that surveys 40 years of film history.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Gloriously directed by George Lucas, this mind-bending space fantasy incorporates Flash Gordon, 2001, Planet of the Apes and 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea and tops them with enough ingenious special effects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Like many people from my generation, Star Wars is not just a favorite film, but an almost spiritual experience from childhood.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It works, because it is now what it was then: a triumph of the imagination.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: I can't deny that this is one of the most important and influential movies ever made, and there is more fun stuff in this film than in most.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: a lot of fun, but not a movie that particularly rewards repeated watchings... once every 20 years or so isn't too often.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is, all in all, hard to think of a place or an age group that would not respond to the enthusiastic inventiveness with which Lucas has enshrined his early loves.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: This film was a cultural turning point and continues to be.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Despite being over-hyped, over-marketed, and fairly flawed, Star Wars remains one of the most memorable and glorious fantasies ever made.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: a communal experience, best seen on the big screen with a large group of enthusiastic people

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: [Star Wars] is the most elaborate, most expensive, most beautiful movie serial ever made.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Like some indefatigable King of the Hill, it stands alone and triumphant, regardless of the many imitators that assail its position.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: If you want to see the movie that made mild diversion for ten-year-old boys the model of commercial filmmaking, ruling out nuanced characterization and emotions that last longer than 20 seconds, this is where to look.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Lucas fills his screen with loving touches... Seeing the film the first time, I was swept away, and have remained swept ever since.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A dynamic entertainment, efficiently and exuberantly setting up its mythic tale of heroes and villains, rebels and rogues, princesses and monsters, good and evil.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Backgrounds in some sequences are now more populated than they were, and it's fun to see all the creatures that make up the "wretched hive of scum and villainy" that Alec Guinness' Obi-Wan Kenobi describes.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The spirit of Buck Rogers lives on as writer-director George Lucas continues to pay homage to that gentleman of the 25th Century in a wow of a sci-fi film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: George Lucas has made the kind of sci-fi adventure movie you dream about finding.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: That '70s schmaltz is innocent and pure--and seemed better untainted by modernization.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars remains a cinematic benchmark and a greater fantasy than its countless imitators of the past 20 years.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It speaks to the child in all of us!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Watching Star Wars again with full knowledge of all that will happen lends some new meaning.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A classic American tale!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A grandiose and violent epic with a simple and whimsical heart.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: This is the phenomenon that saved 20th Century Fox.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: With its naive romanticism, its simple fable of youthful innocence triumphing over evil, its look back at classic narrative mythology, Star Wars is an exhilarating ride into cinematic fantasy, unlike anything that the cinema has made since.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: There isn't an adventure film to match it in terms of archetypal characters, gripping plot and fantastic film "world".

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: I was and still am fascinated by the hinted at but never fully developed chemistry between Luke and Princess Leia.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars (1977), (aka Star Wars - Episode IV: A New Hope) is one of the most popular, profitable, entertaining, and successful science fiction/action - adventure films

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Twenty years later, George Lucas' loved saga of the war between good and evil in a distant galaxy returns in digitally enhanced and augmented form.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A combination of past and future, Western and space odyssey, myth and dream world, Star Wars may be the most enduring piece of escapism ever put on film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: All in all, this movie is a classic.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: The wild ride that helped change the face of modern moviegoing, and is every bit as entertaining today as it was 20 years ago.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A pop-culture landmark!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It's easy to see why Star Wars held such an appeal to the kids and adults of the late 1970s.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Compelling backstory, exciting action and pleasantly archetypal characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: George Lucas's legendary 1977 science-fiction epic still packs an entertaining punch.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Darth Vader and his James Earl Jones voice is a bad egg no matter how much we know about his screwy upbringing.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: A thrilling experience.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is almost as if Lucas took recognizable characters from myth and legend and then emptied them of meaning so as not to distract his audience from his spectacular sets, monsters and special effects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It's all very impressive, though I think I'd probably appreciate it a little more if I hadn't literally grown up on Star Wars and its sequels.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: This special edition re-release really drives home the differences between seeing a movie in the theater and seeing it on video.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: If it was candy for the eyes and the heart, it was heroin to the central nervous system.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: About the dialogue there's nothing to be said. In fact the dialogue itself can hardly be said: it sticks in the actors' mouths like peanut butter.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Star Wars is a junkyard of cinematic gimcracks not unlike the Jawas' heap of purloined, discarded, barely functioning droids.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: It is my contention that the original Star Wars is, on its own, a good film and the best of its series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: As much as it changed the people who watched movies, however, it changed the people who made movies even more.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: [An] essential part of contemporary culture.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE IV - A NEW HOPE
Critic Review: Watching this movie will help you relive your childhood, or help make new memories with your own kids.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: This is a respectable sequel to Star Wars but not as good.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Topping the most successful act in show business history is an impossibility, of course. But that's the challenge facing everyone who worked on "The Empire Strikes Back." They have succeeded to an altogether remarkable extent.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The best 'Star Wars' film, an exciting and thrilling adventure, but also a sober and complex picture.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Has any movie sequel ever so thoroughly surpassed impossible expectations as The Empire Strikes Back?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: ...an erratically-paced yet consistently entertaining installment in a not-quite-great sci-fi series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire Strikes Back is no bland derivative. It has all the freshness and exuberance of an original. A marvellous space fantasy full of dazzling spectacle, exciting adventure, strange creatures and the mythic clash between good and evil.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire Strikes Back is the ultimate in fantasies, a visual wonder and a movie that should be recommended highly if only because it makes you feel good.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Despite a couple of drawbacks, the Empire Strikes Back is an immense amount of fun -- big and splashy and breathtaking in its display of cinematic genius by a huge group of marvelously talented people.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: To answer the big question first: Yes, The Empire Strikes Back is just as enjoyable as Star Wars. In fact, this is one sequel that defies tradition by being better than the original on several counts -- most of them technical, but a few dramatic.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Another richly imaginative, engrossing and spectacular motion picture from the redoubtable George Lucas.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire may not top Star Wars, but it certainly makes one look forward to whatever new surprises George Lucas and his band of cinematic wizards can conjure up for us.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It is technically even more proficient [than Star Wars], has virtually the same ingredients and bursts forth into a world that still seems ripe for its special blend of nostalgically simple story-telling and complicated technology.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It is hard to place one's affections anywhere in a world which is ruled by buttons and dials, computers and bleeps, and people whose conversation is... technical, inaudible or dull.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The younger actors are now more confident.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: A spectacular piece of work that carries the new "Star Wars" tradition forward.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: See it and prepare to be captivated by the most spellbinding sci-fi film of them all.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Director Irvin Kershner's imaginative supervision of George Lucas's brainchild gives this second part of the first Star Wars trilogy a truly epic dimension, adding a mature, philosophical aspect to the nonstop barrage of brilliant special effects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It's darker than the original, and perhaps less well structured, but it combines gorgeous visuals and surprisingly deep human emotions.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It's not up to the original.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The best of the original series, but the most intense, too.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Continues to set the standards for sequels to this day...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: In many ways the new film is a better film than Star Wars, visually more exciting, more artful and meticulous in detail.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Despite ... an unresolved storyline that paves the way for its dismal sequel, Empire remains in many ways the best (indeed the last good) Star Wars film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: A more mature instalment than its predecessor, loaded with spectacular special effects and efficiently written, this may well be the pinnacle of the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire Strikes Back is a worthy sequel to Star Wars, equal in both technical mastery and characterization, suffering only from the familiarity with the effects generated in the original and imitated too much by others.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Each section of the film has a stand-out sequence that inspires hyperbole like 'best ever.'

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Irvin Kershner directed the actors this time around, and without the benefit of Lucas's personal affection they seem stiffer, more clenched.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The most imaginative and emotionally connectable "Star Wars" film and, with the exception of "Revenge of the Sith," also the darkest.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The second act is very strong, cutting back and forth between Luke training with Yoda and Han, Leia, Chewie and C-3P0 fighting the Empire. And it's paced leisurely enough that you get to know the characters a little bit.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: An extended ricochet from one incendiary set-piece battle to another which still finds time to attend to plot, pace and character.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The best of the films.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Sci-fi cinema at its best.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Everything you loved about A New Hope and more.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The backbone of the Star Wars saga… takes the story and themes of the first film into deeper waters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: ...the deepest, darkest, most mature, and most thoughtful entry in the series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire Strikes Back is a total delight.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The best Star Wars movie, ever!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The film spends more time on its characters and unlike the previous film they aren't as busy with all kinds of swashbuckling adventures.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: A darker, richer, and more elaborate film than the original.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The most interesting of the series

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: To see The Empire Strikes Back again on the big screen is a real treat and it brings to mind that cliché they don't make 'em like this anymore.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Easily the best of the Star Wars saga, sad but thrilling.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It was incredible to see what is arguably the best of the Star Wars films, on the big screen again.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: In Empire, creator George Lucas' childlike epic ventures into complex territory that gives the story a touch of psychological heft its siblings lack.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: It's the best film of the series, and one of the greatest sci-fi flicks ever made.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK

Critic Review: Scattered and less focused, the second of the Star Wars trilogy to be re-released in the Special Edition format remains a deep pleasure to behold.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The Empire Strikes Back is a technological triumph, a cornucopia of intergalactic tchotchkes.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Technical virtuosity and entertainment ingenuity.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: Sophisticated!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: One of the great space operas of all time!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The sequel that rose above the high standards set by its glorious predecessor.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE V - THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK
Critic Review: The storytelling is the series' best, with a zingy balance of drama, humor, and Deep Thoughts.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: "Return of the Jedi," the final act of George Lucas' first "Star Wars" trilogy, is the best one yet.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: It's not a total disappointment, but compared to its two predecessors, it's definitely a minor film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: It's largely captivating at gigantic SFX and VFX spectacle; it's good at family movie and it's trivial at adult movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: 'Jedi' takes a little longer to get going, but once it does, the Star Wars finale ends on a satisfying and rewarding note for fans who watch it for the first of 50th time.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: ...a capper to a solid trilogy that's nevertheless not quite the flawless work its reputation would seem to indicate.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: There are all sorts of hints in the latest escapade (notionally directed by Richard Marquand) that we are meant to be taking it seriously.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: It's everything it ought to be -- glorious, exhilarating, exciting, absorbing, technically wondrous. But there also is something bittersweet in the knowledge that, with Jedi, we are bidding a fond farewell to all of the characters we got to know so well.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The characters and dialogue get lost somewhere between the bug-eyed monsters and the exploding spaceships, but it is all so much fun it probably really does not matter a whole lot.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The film has special effects so incredible that it will become the standard by which future efforts are measured, and it leaves the audience cheering and happy.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: With this last of the central Star Wars cycle, there is the sense of the closing of a circle, of leaving behind real friends. It is accomplished with a weight and a new maturity that seem entirely fitting, yet the movie has lost none of its sense of fun.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Lucas has once again recycled the B movies of his youth: jungle movies, gangster movies, pirate movies, you name it. He culls bits from them that still have oomph and mounts them with a Sesame-Street zap.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Highly entertaining.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Though the 1983 film's effects seem almost quaint by today's awesome standards, Jedi has something the newer movies don't: characters we care about, not to mention a plot that involves both them and us.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Unfortunately, it conveys the sense that the machinery has already started to wear down, and the inventiveness to wear thin.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The trilogy is superior entertainment that, have assimilated its sources, has itself become the real thing, making movie history.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: ...when Luke and Darth Vader face off before the drooling Emperor, the franchise comes to its rightful fruition.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The appeal, perhaps, will be strongest to the young.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: For all its faults and goofy plot holes, "Return of the Jedi" is a solid finisher.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The Force was always with it, and time, though not entirely kind, still affirms that most important truth.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Though slow to pick up the pace and saddled with an anticlimatic sequence at the finish, Jedi is nonetheless reasonably fast paced for its 133-minute length, a visual treat throughout.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: With every Jedi disappointment comes a new appreciation: for the genius of John Williams' music; for all that father-son stuff that once felt so mushy and now, with maturity, feels elemental; for Han's ironic-hero stance.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: This installment is deemed by some fans to be the best of the first Star Wars trilogy in technical accomplishment and narrative involvment, but other critics disagree.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Ewok-filled finale less Force-ful than previous.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The space battles are well-staged and various loose narrative threads are pulled together neatly.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: With its feints at horror and pathos, the third Star Wars film is the most Disney-esque in its emotional outline, yet that outline is buried beneath an obnoxiously hyped-up pace that reduces the emotions to rubble.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The third Star Wars film, and the sixth in the series, begins with a bang as our heroes try to wrap up the threads left hanging at the end of The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: In scope and ambition, Jediresembles nothing so much as the next level of a computer game, with a new environment, new gadgets and new creatures.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: First-class entertainment.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Along with some equally captivating special effects and a heavy dose of action, Return of the Jedi is still a solid combination of everything you love about the first two movies.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Among the cinema's most iconic villains — the Wicked Witch of the West; Hannibal Lecter; Nosferatu… — Vader's story arc stands strikingly alone in its climax.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: ...Lucas's first serious decline into juvenilia for the Star Wars saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Scores with its imaginative sweep, colorful characters, and ambitious mythology

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Critic Review: Before this portion of the Star Wars saga is history, let us take time to praise the principal performers.

Critic Review: Chewbacca doesn't have enough dialogue.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Return of the Jedi is pure, swashbuckling adventure in the Errol Flynn Hollywood tradition.

Critic Review: Slower, longer and less powerful than Episodes IV and V, Return of the Jedi closes this extraordinary trilogy more with a whimper than a bang,

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Delightfully imaginative!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: People ask me what they should go see in the theaters right now, and I always point them to the Star Wars trilogy.

Critic Review: Jedi may not be George Lucas's crown jewel, but his trilogy as a whole is as good as film fantasy gets.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Darth Vader is one of the most magnificent villains in movie history.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: One dynamo of a climax!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: The film reaches a density of emotion in its last 20 minutes that the cycle itself -- and few other movies -- can approach.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Jedi is downright repetitive!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Let's not pretend we're watching art!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: Jedi still has its grand moments.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VI - RETURN OF THE JEDI
Critic Review: A good piece of cinema. It is far from perfection, and far from the heights reached by its two predecessors, but it still can entertain the audience -- not just the children who would enjoy Ewoks.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: From the point of view of the series as a whole, the new movie is pure backstory. And in spite of all the zipping and zapping, its own plot barely advances an inch.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Exceptional fight choreography coupled with one of the best songs in Star Wars' history certainly isn't enough to save [it], but next time someone makes the ill-advised choice to check it out, you at least have [a] great sequence to look forward to.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: From the ridiculous title, with those two M's gummily stuck together in the middle, to the uniformly atrocious performances, from the incomprehensible plot to the sluggish pacing, The Phantom Menace is an unsalvageable disaster.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace" is the weakest movie in the series, but that does not mean it's an absolute disaster.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: As a standalone film, The Phantom Menace probably won't appeal to kids raised on rapid editing and epic explosions, nor does it work as an introduction to the Star Wars universe.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It is not remotely devoid of value. It's just that none of this value comes from plot, character, or capacity to provide entertainment.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The saga begins with this relentlessly erratic installment...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Everything in Phantom Menace exists in a bright noisy vacuum.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The movie is fun, for the most part, and several scenes are as good or better than anything Lucas created in the original films. The human characters, however, are not nearly as interesting as those in the earlier episodes.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: What if it had been good? What if it had been a movie?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: 'The Phantom Menace' is definitely the major reason most fans, even prequel apologists like myself, don't watch the Star Wars saga in chronological order.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Do kids really want to follow a plot about intergalactic trade embargoes?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: If there's anything really disappointing about Episode I, it's not being able to line up for Episode 2 tomorrow.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: In his new work, Lucas often forgets his story to linger on sets. Perhaps more accurately, this is a film about sets and mythologies that come out of the cheesiest sci-fi tradition.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The visual effects in The Phantom Menace are so good that you find yourself not caring very much about Qui-Gon's prophetic murmurings.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: As each magnificently choreographed set piece unfolds in The Phantom Menace, there's little doubt that George Lucas knows how to create populist entertainment at its best.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Forget the overworked plot... Marvel instead at the state-of-the-art technical wizardry and fizzing action that's just enough to keep nostalgic wistfulness at bay.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Neeson and McGregor seem so focused on hitting their marks for the blue screen, that they barely make eye contact, let alone generate any genuine emotion.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: None of the human actors here make much of an impression.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: What I can't comprehend is why the political details had to be so tedious and abstract. Will the kids of our nation and the world truly be titillated by trade wars and the spectacle of a do-nothing Senate?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Look, I wanted to love The Phantom Menace, too. I was an adolescent boy and would enjoy being one again for a couple of hours. But the movie has a way of deflating all but the most delusional of hopes.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Mr. Lucas is not without a certain technocratic sagacity, but I don't think he's communicating even with the young as astutely as he once did.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Character and personality take a back seat on this ride.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: This is just another 3D cash grab by George Lucas. If you didn't like the film before, you won't like the film now.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The Force may not be strong in this episode, but it's there.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Anyone hoping the 3D would make-up for the film's many shortcomings, will probably continue to feel cheated by the first Star Wars prequel.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: We don't want to remember it's pretty bad. Then we do.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Has a film director ever induced such terrible performances from such great actors? Liam Neeson - wooden, Ewan McGregor - monotone and the Oscar winning Natalie Portman - a speaking alarm clock!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It hardly needs to be said that the 3D conversion here is nothing more than proficient, that it adds nothing and actually takes away some of the clarity and vividness of the film's varied colour palette.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Darth Maul is back, this time waving his wand in 3D. "Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace" was poorly received by critics when it debuted, so does it fare any better with its new up-conversion? Not really. Paul Chambers, CNN.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: This is really only for the hardcore fans and kids.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It's a nifty enough film that's entertaining but not comparable to the original 'Star Wars.'

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It's cinematic junk food, the pernicious effect of which had already set in long before this film came out.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The Phantom Menace is, at best and worst, a mediocre film-a boring adventure undermined by anemic political theatrics and the rusty artistic tastes of its maker.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The 3D conversion on this film is one of the best I've ever seen... and that's what makes it worth paying some extra money to see it again in the theater.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: "Star Wars: Episode 1 -- The Phantom Menace" got dismissive reviews in 1999, and it deserves the same today. But you probably know that.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: You realize how much humor Harrison Ford brought to things; without him, at times the movie itself feels frozen in Carbonite.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The Phantom Menace, in any number of dimensions, is an exercise in disappointment, a film filled with enough callbacks to the first trilogy to remind you about what you loved about them without adding much of note in all the new material.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Naturally, if you already despise everything George Lucas touches, well, these aren't the droids you're looking for. It's more of a 3D party for fans and admirers, playing to the convinced with a conversion.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: You may never experience this or any Star Wars movie as a cinematic experience ever again. Especially not in theater.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The 3D conversion isn't going to change your opinion on the movie or give you a whole new moviegoing experience, but it's not bad either.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Oh George, why?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The special effects are something to see in 3D, but don't listen too closely to the screenplay or try to work out who is who.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: A pop-culture calamity, a soulless, passionless film whose only real effect was to smudge the happy memories of the three originals.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: For the most part, the sludgy re-processing of the original leaves everything looking as if it was lensed through a wet, worn sock. Only one sequence -- the epic pod race on the planet Tatooine -- goes close to making any worthwhile use of the 3D format

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The only plus point is introducing newbies to the big-screen Star Wars experience -- if the 3D price is right for you.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Still unsure of the basic mechanics of the plot, drags in places and that Binks chap wasn't just a bad dream, but when it soars, it soars.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The added visual depth does little to disguise quite how flat everything in between is.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: I will say this: the time and money they spent working on this post-conversion is evident in the final result. It is technically very impressive.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The Phantom Menace's fleeting pleasures aren't even table scraps to my inner child.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The under-utilised 3D adds little to this prequel, which only serves as a sore reminder of the brilliance of the original films.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It's difficult to discern precisely where this all went wrong, and even more difficult to speculate about possible improvements.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Kid-centric but violent prequel lacks energy of originals.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Honestly, I had a decent time.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE

Critic Review: Charmless, sexless, passionless and robot-humoured, it's preposterously uninvolving.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE

Critic Review: Lucas has protected his multibillion-dollar franchise by making a film targeted at children. It gives them exactly what they want--eye candy that moves at light speed.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: What's important to remember is that the better moments don't merely balance out the weaker ones - they topple them.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: I must take issue with the intense backlash from other critics against the film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Film franchises come and go all the time in Hollywood, particularly in science-fiction circles, but the Force is still strong in this one.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: This time, the Force wasn't with him.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Not only is it a fanciful phenomenon but it's also the most eye-popping spectacular special-effects picture ever made as George Lucas integrates the fantasy of computer imagery with reality.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Not a great film, but it is magical and majestic.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: The result is an adventure that feels...well, Forced.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Is it fun? For the most part, yes. Is it a life-changing experience? Only if you reach puberty, give birth or die while watching it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: Flawed as it is, The Phantom Menace captured my imagination and I enjoyed it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It works as an action flick, visually eye-popping and often paralyzingly exciting; it also works as an elicitor of memories, a piece of exquisite nostalgia.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: It's a frenetic visual feast indeed; there's nothing quite like it in the galaxy.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: By purporting to be yet-another-episode in a larger saga it has franchised itself, a thought that is sure to get the critical bile rising

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE I - THE PHANTOM MENACE
Critic Review: I could still have enjoyed it if only there were actors or characters strong enough to stand out against this computer enhanced backdrop.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: ... for me, it is definitely an improvement over the childish and irregular first episode.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: So what else works, besides [Ewan] McGregor's performance? Darn little, even compared to The Phantom Menace.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: His characters, as is now his norm, are plastic puppets, even in the confectionary love scenes. Most of their dialogue is so doughy that it could be spooned into comic-strip balloons. Lucas simply has no interest in these people.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: As perpetually uneven as its underwhelming predecessor...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The film is touching, spectacular and surprisingly coherent. It also has something the others lacked entirely: old-fashioned charm. This time, The Force is with us.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The technical wizardry of the action scenes are ultimately more important than the story and reason enough for nonbelievers to see and enjoy the movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Easily the most polarizing Star Wars film -- all but 5% of the fan base loathes Phantom Menace -- Attack of the Clones remains the most underrated entry in the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones is indeed a pleasant surprise. It's fine.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: All in all, no one gets anything to do here.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack Of The Clones lacks the light heart of the "old" trilogy but this deliberate throwback to matinee movie serials is still fun.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: On points, this beats the underwhelming Episode I: more action, less politics and better gags.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's the sheer scale of the storytelling that makes this episode superior to its immediate predecessor, and then of course there's the look of the movie. The production design is superb, with a real sense of cinematic wonder.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Allowing for some dull moments, this movie has considerable visual style.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The latest entry in George Lucas' transgalactic saga of the moral rise and fall of Anakin Skywalker and the deterioration of democracy into despotism has an electric visual majesty and boasts Lucas' best direction since American Graffiti.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones is the best Star Wars installment since The Empire Strikes Back, hurtling along so quickly that you hardly notice the many moments when the story fails to make sense -- even on its own fantastical terms.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Lucas' obsession with digital technology has obliterated the saga's last remnants of human purpose and turned his once mesmerizing space opera into a pure, dehumanized cartoon.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: In lieu of a proper climax, Attack Of The Clones ends with a tantalizing cliffhanger for the next episode, but Lucas' lumbering series is presenting fewer and fewer reasons to tune in.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Better than Phantom, but still inferior to Episodes IV, V and VI.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's the last 20 minutes that save the film from too much visual information (though it is state-of-the-art awesome) and too much exposition (without the humor that made episodes IV-VI three of the best films ever made).

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: George Lucas puts away childish things and gets down to business with Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones, the movie Jedi disciples waited 16 years to see and got Episode I instead.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's frustrating to watch a movie which has been so painstakingly crafted and is so extraordinarily designed and yet in which the storytelling is so sloppy, as if lost in the prosthetic and mechanical clutter on the screen.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's still a rush to sit in a packed theater (equipped with THX, naturally) when that first blast of John Williams' fanfare sounds. Then you have to endure the rest of the movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: You can't blame actors, particularly young ones, when the words put in their mouths are almost unspeakable and the direction seems to suck them dry of energy or spontaneity.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Sit back and enjoy fantastic, imaginative visuals.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It starts off briskly with some fantastic special effects and a great high-speed chase but then founders on the shores of bad script writing.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Though, lacking in plotline it makes up for in action and entertainment.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Lucas does not always recognize his limitations. This tends to make films of mixed quality. Still, there is always enough that is excellent to make them worth seeing.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones emerges looking as bad as if not worse than its 1999 predecessor, thanks to the lame romantic subplot, which is so badly written, directed and performed that it surpasses Jar-Jar Binks as the all-time low point in the series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Makes The Phantom Menace seem like one long clearing of the throat before Lucas could begin to tell the real story.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: This time the exposition is so thick that everyone except acolytes may tune out.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The special effects are remarkable, yet somehow numbing, and the film only partly lives up to the promise in the title of Lucas's company, Industrial Light and Magic.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: While it lacks the quality of Empire's script and performances, Clones is the most visually enthralling of the series so far.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It is certainly better than the childish Phantom Menace and the final 45 minutes of straight action beat the editing nightmare at the end of the last film.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Christensen is a winning mix of sultry and sulky as the now older Anakin, while McGregor is finally beginning to relax as the mentor who understandably refuses to treat his moody pupil like a grown-up.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The magic has definitely been recaptured.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: As convincing a job as they, Christensen, and Lee do, they all end up being upstaged by the jaw-dropping skills of a CGI creation: Yoda (again voiced by Frank Oz), who finally gets a chance to show exactly why he has such a legendary reputation.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The muppet steals what's otherwise an underwhelming show.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Clones is far from perfect, but when it clicks, it revives the old spirit that made a generation become so obsessed with all things Star Wars in the first place.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's impossible...to dismiss a film with this much stuff: exotic production design, imaginative characters, and a wide variety of digital jedi fu.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It would be easy to say that this film is fantastic and blows away the others, but unfortunately I cannot.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Superior to Episode I -- The Phantom Menace, with its annoying Jar Jar Binks and its dull, galaxy-hopping story line.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Enjoy this film they will.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Alternately excites and bores.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: I'll call it nearly good, based mostly on one hell of a last half-hour.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's no Empire Strikes Back but then you won't have to worry about Jar Jar too much either.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: How I wish I could say something other than ho-hum.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: You will most likely end up sitting through this latest installment - even if the series has become a shadow of its former self

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: My God, how wonderful it would be if it just even pretended to not be so commercialized.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The Star Wars franchise continues to slip into obscurity with another underwhelming entry.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: When George Lucas learns to make his audience feel the way he does about creating his worlds and the living things that populate them, he just might be more at one with a larger creative force as well. The new films are good, but they're still clones.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Lucas has delivered new worlds, characters, and creatures but has left in little of the humor that sparkled throughout the original Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: At least it's better than Return of the Jedi. If that sounds like faint praise... then line up and find out for yourself.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: I feel ambivalent about it and I'm still going to pay to see it again. It's just that important to our collective dorkitude.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Yes, it's better than The Phantom Menace. Think for a minute about how little that means.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Star Wars fans, prepare to weep with joy.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It has all the moves; it never quite catches the rhythm.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: ...open your eyes and ears and disengage your mind...it's a splendid film, and enjoying it for its sheer beauty is much more fun than having to think about it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's the breakdown of genre influences that expresses Clones' melodrama in grandiose, exciting terms.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: If Phantom Menace resulted in mindless boredom, then Attack of the Clones at least offers mindless entertainment.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The Force is indeed with George Lucas.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: A tale full of sound and fury, sucking the life out of cinema.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The second half of this film is almost a different movie. Everything about it is better. Everything.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The least of the Star Wars series, but that is pretty damn good.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Star Wars fans will be in heaven.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: ...less irritating than its immediate predecessor - but it may be going too far to say it's a better movie. It may be going too far to say it's a movie at all

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Basically, it's pretty but dumb.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Lucas returns the series to its roots, delivering a cartoon-like adventure that uses special effects to enhance rather than replace storytelling.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Meant for Star Wars fans. It is there to give them a good time.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: While it's not quite what the first three were, it's on the right track. This one definitely is an improvement from `Episode 1'.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: If you fell asleep within the first fifteen minutes or so of this movie, and only woke up before the last forty minutes or so, the truth is that you wouldn't miss much.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The film is probably worth seeing for the sheer spectacle of it all, for the sake of obtaining valuable information, and for finding more closure on a story that has always been missing several pieces.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: This is the film Star Wars fans have been waiting for since 1980.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's still got enough magic to coast on sheer goodwill.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: As bright as a light saber, George Lucas strikes back with stunning imagery and the best ending yet to his popular series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The battling Yoda looks ludicrous, like Kermit the Frog in a Matrix fight scene.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: less Jar Jar, no discussion of taxes and trade blockades, and more Jedis, violence, and sex appeal

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Lucas has never been able to conjure another Han Solo, a character who could, with simply a wink, remind us that this was just an overgrown Saturday afternoon serial.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: In the end, what I appreciated most was the unpredictability of it all.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Clones largely brings everything together, deepening the arc of the entire story ... and restoring the mythological grandeur that helped establish the series in the first place.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: What Lucas needs to wrap up this franchise properly is a return to the fundamentals: less overplotted hooey, more thick blue liquid.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Action Good! Love Bad!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones is light years ahead of its predecessor and a return to the fun Saturday matinee feel that the original films possessed. There's a bunch of surprises, and a good mix of action, laughs, romance, and suspense.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Mostly it flatlines.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Ewan McGregor neither sings, dances nor takes off his clothes in Star Wars: Episode 2. There are millions of dollars worth of often breathtaking special effects and about $1.75 worth of dialogue.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: My precious new Star Wars movie is a lumbering, wheezy drag...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: If you ignore the cheesy dialog and the political mumbo-jumbo, the power of the force has returned to the franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: This might be the most visually stunning motion picture I have ever seen.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Episode II has a stronger storyline than Episode I, but suffers from weak performances and poor romantic chemistry.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: "Attack of the Clones" is a substantial improvement over "Episode I," with more action, less downtime, a potent dose of Jedi master Yoda and -- best of all -- only a couple of brief appearances by the idiotic amphibian Jar Jar Binks.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Two hours of nonsense and fifteen minutes that may sell a couple more bags of Yoda-endorsed Sour Cream and Onion Ruffles.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Preposterous love story aside, Clones is really not that bad.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Why does Lucas even bother planting the seeds if he refuses to let them sprout?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The good news? Star Wars: Episode II -- Attack of the Clones is eons better than Star Wars: Episode I -- The Phantom Menace. The bad news? It's still not very good.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Falls to new depths of narrative incoherence, torturous banality, and acting incompetence.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Stunning Visuals Overcome Stunted Emotion

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Ewan McGregor simply oozes wisdom and integrity as Obi-Wan Kenobi.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's good, but before you get all trendy on me and skip a week of work to stand in line, I should really tell you that Attack of the Clones is (gasp!) not worth waiting in endless lines for.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's an ambitious film, and as with all ambitious films, it has some problems. But on the whole, you're gonna like this movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Just watching the little fuzzy guy doing stuff that would put Cirque du Soleil to shame was a blast in and of itself.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: If Attack of the Clones struggles harder than its predecessors, its triumphs still shine through.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: A riot of sterility, with planetscape after stunning planetscape swallowing up its characters and their petty concerns.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the mildly engaging plot.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: As [Lucas] gained expensive digital wizardry, he... lost something more important: the power of myth, the draw of character, the appeal of a simple, riveting story.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The magic of the original films cannot be recaptured, but this is a marvelous ride nonetheless.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Abounds in A-budget variations of Saturday-matinee B-movie excitement.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: With Clones, the series takes a giant leap forward, even if it hasn't managed to get back where it was two decades ago.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Delivers the requisite goods, but no more, to fans of the spectacularly popular sci-fi saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Isn't it sad that these movies no longer sweep us away, but force us to sit making mental checklists of what George Lucas has done right and what he has done wrong?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: As one of the millions of so-called fan-geeks out there, Episode II was all I hoped it would be.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: "Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones" is the most stunningly beautiful, visually dazzling and fiercely action-packed of all the "Star Wars" films.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Well, it's better than The Phantom Menace. But George Lucas' latest chapter suffers from onerous self-importance.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: George Lucas, unwilling to relinquish control over this universe he created, is solely to blame for this celluloid garbage.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The diverging plot lines and the rich, expansive and incredibly beautiful scenery and planets -- not to mention the constant action -- almost make up for Lucas' deficiency with the spoken word.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones, while rallying in its final third, is as talky and long-winded as the bickering Jedi Council.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: A commendable example of the sort of movie we once loved and then outgrew.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: There's an amazing gladiator-like confrontation in a coliseum followed by a rip-roaring battle scene between the Jedi warriors and the army of clones.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The richness of its world -- the production design is marvelous, especially in the spaceships and interiors -- is fantastic to behold.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: THX Digital sound and some great visual fury...signifying nothing.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The script is weak, the dialogue is flat, the acting is stiff, and most of all, the all-important love story that's supposed to give the film its emotional core just doesn't work.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: By far the best movie to be released so far in 2002.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Attack of the Clones will likely be remembered as cluttered with inconsequential character and plot details and excessive special effects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The film is not as bad as the mainstream critics are making it out to be. Unfortunately, it's not as good as the hardcore fan critics are saying, either.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Despite some weaknesses, Attack of the Clones redeems the franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The scale of the enterprise is thrilling; it's too bad the movie is so muddled on so many different levels.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Now THIS is a Star Wars movie. Attack of the Clones has much more rooted into the Star Wars universe as we know it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The Phantom Menace and Attack of the Clones have reduced the franchise to, well, a franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Hold on to your No-Doz: Another Star Wars is here.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: This is a special effects extravaganza.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Beautifully majestic...often awe-inspiring...five times better than Episode I.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Fans have a fix, audiences have an adventure, and Lucas has another blockbuster; what's not to love?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It plays like an infomercial plugging the newest in digital filmmaking.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: You might check your watch a couple of times during the long, long set-up, but that last act will have you riveted to your seat!

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It's just fun, pure and simple.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: May qualify as the third-best episode yet -- behind The Empire Strikes Back and Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: An entertainment so in love with its overinflated mythology that it no longer recognizes the needs of moviegoers for real characters and compelling plots.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: I'm all over the action in the movie, and the last half hour alone is literally worth the price of admission.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: A solid summer movie worth its admission price.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: A better movie than the clumsy Phantom Menace.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: It at least delivers the goods, full of the requisite explosions, duels, sci-fi landscapes and action set-pieces that the average moviegoer expects.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Back are the old-fashioned movie-serial thrills, breathtaking action sequences, elaborate mythology and vivid imagination that made his original Star Wars trilogy such a success back in the 1970s and '80s.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: This film is too busy hitting all of its assigned marks to take on any life of its own.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: With Clones, it is abundantly clear that the Force just isn't with [Lucas] any longer.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: The old charm is mostly left behind, a twinkle in Princess Leia's eyes, while Lucas clones films with industrial fervor.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
Critic Review: Unlike the first Star Wars, made for a general audience in search of a good time, Attack of the Clones is pitched to a cult audience.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE II - ATTACK OF THE CLONES
