Critic Review: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' is exactly the movie you want it to be.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: An exhilarating ride, filled with archetypal characters with plausible psychologies, melodramatic confrontations fueled by soaring emotions, and performances that can be described as good, period, rather than "good, for 'Star Wars.'"

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It gives us what we want. And what we want is more of the same.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Harrison Ford and Peter Mayhew, playing Han Solo and Chewbacca, are flat out terrific delivering one-liners, slap-stick, and heart, which transcends mere nostalgia.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars has come roaring and soaring back with a fabulous, bountiful, richly rewarding payoff for anyone who's been waiting, patiently or otherwise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A Star Wars film by fans and for fans.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Abrams understands viewers don't tune into soap operas for pretty pictures: they watch for story and characters, which explains why the filmmakers pushed so hard to keep plot details under lock and key.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: An Episode IV for a new generation is only as good as the reminder to the old of why they fell in love with these movies to begin with.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This is the beginning of something. It's a farewell to the old guard and a welcome to the new. As such it's hard to begrudge the film its plethora of callbacks, repeated plot line and heavy exposition.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Thrilling, exciting and dazzling with a heartbeat underneath. Star Wars: The Force Awakens delivers everything you want in a Star Wars movie. It's worth waiting in line for, and lives up to the hype.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: For me, there's nothing to be done during Star Wars films but wait for the occasional bit of comic relief.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A triumphant return to form for the franchise - the best of the films since The Empire Strikes Back...It's also a rousing introduction to new characters who will likely carry this world forward through two more planned episodes and assorted spinoffs.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: ...baldly trades on its predecessors, but with enough artfulness and genuine affection to count as its own unique experience.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Director JJ Abrams has delivered the Episode 4 fans were looking for in 1999.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: What's really surprising too is just how emotional it all is. More than just nostalgia, The Force Awakens earns its tears. Star Wars is back in a big way: as C-3PO might say, thank the maker.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Slick and stylish, the evolution of the world of "Star Wars" is fully realized with sumptuous sets, vigorous and energetic cinematography, and impeccable sound work.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Granted, director J.J. Abrams leans a little heavily on the nostalgia, but given all he had to accomplish in this massive franchise reboot, can you blame him?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Ridley and Boyega make a sizeable impact amidst the cacophonous sound and merchandising fury, capturing the vulnerability and anguish of conflicted characters haunted by murky pasts.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Fans will get goosebumps right from the start as the scrolling summary to bring us up to date - without a single mention of tariffs or bureaucratic squabbles.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Perhaps another director will pick up the elements that Abrams left scattered about, imbue them with some... any kind of subtext, to give us some real poetry.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: I enjoyed the seventh Star Wars film more than any since The Empire Strikes Back and much more than - yes, reader, I was there, for this newspaper, reviewing it - the now 38-year-old saga start-up.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: If the original created dreams, the latest creates nightmares.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: Episode VII -- The Force Awakens marks the Star Warsiest movie since Return of the Jedi, a fun and fantastic blend of old memories and new blood, old enemies and new friends, old actors and really old actors.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: [Abrams ] has made an adoring copy of Star Wars, seeking to correct its perceived flaws, without understanding that nothing about that movie's context or meaning or enormous cultural impact can be duplicated.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: What Abrams has done is find and return the ingredient crucial to the original three films in the franchise that was sorely lacking in the second round: fun.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Against the odds we've ended up with the first authentic Star Wars film since 1983. Now who'd have seen that coming?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It is a warm and shrewd reminder of what we loved about the films in the first place; if only it wasn't quite so deferential.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This is the film we're looking for. "The Force Awakens" understands what "Star Wars" fans love and delivers it lavishly.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens isn't just one the finest movies of 2015, it's the best movie of the year, full stop.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Not for nothing, but John Williams' score is absolutely perfect as usual, and it makes every one of [the action] scenes come to life all the more.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Go see The Force Awakens with an open mind, and without expectations of the same lightning being captured again in the same bottle. It is, at the end of the day, a movie. And it's a pretty good one.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: These young people are a spirited bunch, led by Daisy Ridley and John Boyega, two bright-faced newcomers who lend the proceedings the appropriate sense of grounding and awe.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Even if it isn't the greatest Star Wars film ever, it's almost certainly the most affecting of them all.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: At the risk of committing blasphemy, "The Force Awakens" is the best of the seven "Star Wars" -- followed closely, of course, by the 1977 original.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Ford especially earns his money with this one. But as fun as it is to see Han Solo back in action, the newcomers like Ridley take center stage, launching subplots that should be fun to watch in ensuing installments.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The best thing that can be said about The Force Awakens... is that it's classicist in the way of a well-executed neo-soul record, crackling with familiarity without bowing to the altar of history.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens drowns in the shadows cast by the original Star Wars films. Its stunning visuals and breakout performances from the new cast can't save the identity crisis The Force Awakens suffers from.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: If you were to make a list of the essential ingredients of a Star Wars film, you would find almost all in J.J. Abrams' wake-up call to this sleeping giant of a franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens has all of the strengths of the original trilogy and none of the weaknesses of the prequels.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is actually probably objectively the best Star Wars yet, and would be held up as untouchable had it come first.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It is precisely the Star Wars movie that you want it to be. This is the one you were waiting for. You may be waiting just as intently for the next one.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: With The Force Awakens, Abrams got to build a whole new universe on a base of returning favorites. No character is stronger, though, than Rey (Daisy Ridley), who is the central player in the new story.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens is just such an exhilarating experience, it's very nearly everything you could want from such a large-scale spectacle.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: For all of its humor and charm and thrilling dogfights and genuinely teary moments (I'm not made of stone, people), The Force Awakens revels in its derivative nature, in its open-armed embrace of warm nostalgia.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: "The Force Awakens" is satisfying on its own (no half of a "Hunger Games" movie here), but it also sets the stage for these new characters to go off on some great adventures in episodes to come.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force is still with us, my friends. 38 years later, it's hard to believe it ever left.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: "The Force Awakens" feels like a genuine "Star Wars" movie, with well-executed battle scenes, light comic touches and a warm feel for its characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Some may thrill with delighted recognition at the spectacle of yet another primal duel fought over a great void. Others, though, may know that the real test of myth-making lies in an ability not to repeat but to reinvent.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Though a definite improvement on the last three abortive "Star Wars" prequels... "The Force Awakens" is only at its best in fits and starts, its success dependent on who of its mix of franchise veterans and first-timers is on the screen.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: If Hollywood's going to extend the most famous movie myth of the past 40 years, "The Force Awakens" seems a worthwhile way to do so.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This, undoubtedly, is the movie that fans wanted, the movie that fans deserve.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: [Star Wars: The Force Awakens] returns the iconic sci-fi franchise to a glorious place that hasn't been seen since Ewoks danced off into victory in Return of the Jedi 32 years ago.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The seventh installment in the series, started by George Lucas in 1977, is the best Star Wars sequel yet and one of the best films of 2015.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens pops with memorable battle sequences, gives us chills with encore appearances by stars from the original trilogy and introduces more than a half-dozen terrific Next Generation characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: When The Force Awakens ends, it feels bittersweet simply because you so badly want to get to the next chapter. So, yes, the wait is over. But now a new waiting game begins...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens has succeeded where it counts most, in creating a cast of characters that viewers can spend the next several years rooting for, especially the spirited, resourceful heroine at its center.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A glib facsimile.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: [The film] is a state-of-the-art throwback, both retro and post-modern in its self-awareness. It doesn't just know that it's operating in the long shadow of a classic; it hardwires that understanding into its own DNA, making legacy a prevailing theme.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: You WILL like this movie. No, that's not some kind of Jedi mind trick, accompanied by a vague wave of the hand. It's a educated prediction, grounded in -- well, the Force if you must know. And don't tell me the Force doesn't work that way.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Pleasingly, this isn't a film that takes itself too seriously, with the seriously cute BB-8 supplying plenty of humour with his electronic beeps and chirps and no end of playful references to the original trilogy crammed into the 135-minute running time.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Abrams seems content to capture the spirit of the original series and simply remix the rest of it until Star Wars miraculously seems fresh again.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: JJ Abrams has perfectly captured the spirit of the original trilogy, with great characters, terrific action set-pieces, and a surprising amount of humour.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Abrams has served the fans and first-timers exceedingly well.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Ridley, Boyega and Isaac make equally charismatic heroes, and Driver is surprisingly effective as the sinister Ren. Star Wars: The Force Awakens is commercial American moviemaking at its best. May the Force be with it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The formula, more than the Force, was with Abrams. He was wise enough not to mess with it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Is The Force Awakens equal to the original trilogy? Fans will have to face facts: Such unique magic can never be recreated... The new Star Wars films must create a universe of their own -- and they're off to a promising start.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Abrams may not have taken a lot of risks - perhaps that's for a later film - but with "The Force Awakens" he's fashioned a perfect sequel that knows exactly where it stands in a galactic-sized franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is no more and no less than the movie that made us love it in the first place. In fact, it's basically the same thing. Isn't that what we all wanted anyway?

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens is a triumph of escapism and the most exhilarating film yet in this mighty franchise. It is the magnificent seventh.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Sacrosanct and on steroids ... [but] comes to life here, thanks to the magnetic performances of Ridley and Boyega.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: From the very first line of the film's opening crawl, it is apparent that JJ Abrams, Michael Arndt, and Lawrence Kasdan have pushed the series back onto the right track...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The new heroes of The Force Awakens are brightly drawn, occasionally surprising, and an endless pleasure to spend time with.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: None of its issues, big or small, prevent it from being the tremendously entertaining return to a galaxy far, far away that we've been waiting so damn long for.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The seventh film in the Star Wars saga... is still just a movie, but it's a fabulously entertaining and beautifully crafted movie nonetheless.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: They got the job done with The Force Awakens, and while Abrams pays more homage than he rightfully should, he also introduces the most exciting characters Star Wars has seen since, not going to lie, Lando Calrissian and Lobot.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It has the usual toy-store-ready gizmos and critters, but it also has appealingly imperfect men and women whose blunders and victories, decency and goofiness remind you that a pop mythology like Star Wars needs more than old gods to sustain it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This is a triumphant reboot of the biggest film franchise of our lifetimes and fully earns its place as the soon-to-be biggest film of all time.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: While The Force Awakens belongs to the younger generation, Ford dominates its throwback element like a true, ahem, force of nature.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Perfectly safe and plenty full of the Force... but leans on geek nostalgia to reboot a beloved property by hitting predictably familiar story beats.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Rest assured fans. You won't have to complain how Abrams further ruined your childhood. This is everything we initially loved about the franchise and exceeds expectations.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Just see it. You'll love it.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This film fits into the franchise's much-debated canon, and is the best installment since The Empire Strikes Back, a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Rey and Finn, though, feel fresh and new.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: From the iconic opening crawl through the wordless last frames of Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens, director J.J. Abrams steers pop-culture's most beloved sci-fi saga in an exhilarating new direction.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A fun, polished space odyssey that embraces the appeal of the originals.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is the movie it was promised to be, with great new characters, a respect for the original trilogy and a strong understanding of what makes this franchise click with fans.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It's nice to see Ford, Fisher, and Hamill, but The Force Awakens really belongs to Ridley, Boyega, Isaac, and Driver.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It's slick, it's smart and you feel like you're in safe hands the whole time. JJ Abrams should breathe a massive sigh of relief: he's done it. He's made one of the good ones.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: I've searched my heart, and I know it to be true, for me at least: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is my favorite of the franchise. Episode VII" is "Star Wars No. 1.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: When the first Star Wars film was released in 1977, nobody had seen anything like it. Almost 40 years on, the trail it blazed is now so well traveled, it's on every intergalactic tourist map.That makes Abrams' feat all the more impressive

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens might just be the best film of the last 30 years or so...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens re-awoke my love of the first movie and turned my inner fanboy into my outer fanboy. There are very few films which leave me facially exhausted after grinning for 135 minutes, but this is one.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Abrams has adopted the relatively cautious strategy of essentially remaking the original "Star Wars," which allows him to delight fans by bringing back the original players while laying down the groundwork of the new ones.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: [Star Wars: The Force Awakens] is good. Not great. But far better than "not bad." Solidly, confidently good.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Star Wars we love is back ... with humor comes heart and it's easy to forgive a couple plot points when a movie has this much heart.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Robustly entertaining while carrying the weight of impossible audience expectations, "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" is a fascinating, often satisfying mixture of rollicking mythmaking and fan service.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It'll make you cower at the site of Kylo Ren's blazing red lightsaber, it'll make you whoop with glee at the roar of Poe Dameron's X-Wing.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: For impressive stretches [Abrams] achieves the action-packed buoyancy of the old Saturday morning serials that partly inspired Star Wars in the first place.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens is a Star Wars movie through and through...and a wonderful one

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: It's an entertaining but ultimately lightweight bridge between the classic movies and Disney's apparently never-ending slate of upcoming feature films.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A remix of the original STAR WARS that is saved by wonderful new iconic characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: "Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens" is a special kind of blockbuster, wondrous and thrilling and not in the least hampered by cynicism. Don't be surprised, adults, if watching it makes you feel like a kid again.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens pumps new energy and life into a hallowed franchise in a way that both resurrects old pleasures and points in promising new directions.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is a fun return to form for the series.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens leaves us wanting more, which is exactly what it should do. Impressive Abrams, most impressive.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Star Wars movie for people who don't like Star Wars. Pure, old-school pleasure.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens steers the franchise back to its popcorn origins. It's not a Bible; it's a bantamweight blast. And that's just as it should be: a good movie, nothing more.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The best new Star Wars film in three decades and one of the most satisfying films of the year.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: A remarkable achievement that actually feels like Star Wars again, more so than any film since 1983.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: I don't love the film. I don't hate the film. But I was profoundly frustrated by the film because it kept being close to becoming something great.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Masterfully marrying new with nostalgia, this is the one we've been waiting for.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The rollicking, space-opera spirit of George Lucas's original trilogy (you can safely forget the second trio of cynical, tricked-up prequels) emanates from every frame of J.J. Abrams euphoric sequel.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Can be dimwittedly obvious and self-plagiarizing, with little of real-world consequence and less that's new to say [but it's still] a fun-filled adventure at the movies...

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: When 'The Force Awakens' is really cruising, it's a terrific piece of pulp adventure cinema, packed with memorable characters, vicious lightsaber battles, some very smart visual concepts, but its narrative shortcomings can be quite frustrating.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Force Awakens is some kind of miracle, as it works on every imaginable level.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Will satisfy most and annoy few... a sleek machining of a platonic ideal of a memory of George Lucas' original trilogy, after pleasure seeps into recollection and over generations becomes warm vapor, pop-cult hallucination.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The Force Awakens is meant to honour the past and lead us into a new narrative future. It feels like what people feel a Star Wars film is supposed to feel like. The Force is strong with this one.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: Yes, it helps that the core group of original actors has returned, but it's more the energy, humor and simplicity of direction that has been recaptured. It's the overall vibe.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: The director, J.J. Abrams, recaptures the pop lightness that made the first Star Wars seem simultaneously eternal and effervescent.

Movie: STAR WARS: EPISODE VII - THE FORCE AWAKENS
Critic Review: This seventh movie is a humongous piece of cinema -- all that a sequel should be and more: a nostalgic homage to the 1977 original, coupled with intergalactic, warp-speed, panoramic blockbuster action, and a new heroine in the form of Daisy Ridley's Rey.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Great battle scenes, heartfelt characters, and the knowledge that there can only ever be one make this a real gem amongst stones that have, at times, struggled to shine.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A surprisingly dark yet brilliantly action packed and fun anthology film

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: When the action pivots on the exciting plot point of data transfer rates ... this mundane crisis doesn't seem elevated to a planetary level of urgency.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As the Rogue One draws to its utterly stunning space-battle close, it seems to feel it needs to hold hands with A New Hope - when it really just needs to pass the baton.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Edwards has a keen sense of awe and little regard for the humans underfoot.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I wanted to feel more in the trenches with these guys...but the action that was there was really good...I liked it more than the Force Awakens, and if you are a Star Wars fan, I'd say go see this right away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It has everything hard core Star Wars fans want -- a feisty heroine, comic relief, quirky and unlikely heroes, incredible sets, and a soaring score.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There is zero depth here. You keep hoping for a transgressive moment that will make the cringe-inducing dialogue and gratuitous fan service worthwhile, but it never comes.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If you miss this point, the sacrifices of a revolution, then you will not understand the greatness of Rogue One.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is the plot-driven space opera (with delightful elements of a space western) that I wanted/needed.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is an enjoyable addition to the franchise and Jones's Jyn is a compelling lead.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is a reminder of your dreams, of the barriers you'd break to create a better world, one full of hope and liberty where the word sacrifice takes on a whole new meaning...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While we don't have the same nostalgic attachment to Cassian, Bodhi and Jyn, that's what unburdens Rogue One, giving it a freedom to tell a story on its own terms.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It was nice to see something that was set in the Star Wars universe, but had a different tone to it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: By shifting to a higher power characters actually cry out to, Edwards achieves a rousing tale of honor and sacrifice that both deepens and broadens the rest of the Star Wars world.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: When the film slows down enough for the dialogue to sink in, we realize that the story, such as it is, has been cobbled together from all previousStar Wars films combined.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ... the flaws in the film are in that first hour of build up the rest of the movie is really good if not great...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While I loved The Force Awakens, it relied a lot on the nostalgia...But this movie? It could stand on its own and still be amazing.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Can I just say that I liked Rogue One: A Star Wars Story better than the last four Star Wars stories--even The Force Awakens, which was the top grossing film of 2015?

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The action in "Rogue One" is extremely well-staged and exciting, and it's fun to see its small connections to the larger "Star Wars" universe...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ... the directing is heavy-handed and uninspired, the plot with its many turns - lots of action that includes more fight scenes than the saga's other movies - develops predictably, even if it's not always easy to follow.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [Rogue One] is thrilling, at times dark, but also extremely entertaining regardless of your Star Wars knowledge.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The ending is filled with both a bittersweet tragedy and hard-fought victory; ' a new hope' is earned, and so is this film's place in the upper echelon of Star Wars lore.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There are Suicide Squad-level moments of confusion, weak characters and regressive storytelling that left me downright angry.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ...this is a film that gives us another strong independent woman such as Jyn in the Star Wars universe and we need more of them.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It is now a great starting point for someone new to this franchise. To quote one of the familiar lines from this space opera - "the Force is strong with this one"!

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is Star Wars for adults. Well-loved characters die, the violence is gory by and large and the atmosphere is more on the lines of the French Resistance during World War II than the light-hearted thrillers that George Lucas films were.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One certainly doesn't hit all its marks. But it surely hits enough to keep holiday audiences happy, particularly as its story begins to merge with the one we discovered all those years ago.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It works more than it doesn't, and the story itself feels fresher than Force Awakens because it isn't a repeat of a previous Star Wars movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is meant to be a standalone spin-off from the Star Wars movie universe, but it feels like Episode 3.5.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ... a reason to hit theaters this holiday season.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ... the film is mostly a triumph - heavy on the action, light on the romance, and one of the best heroines to come out of the big screen in 2016.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story sets the benchmark of how a good standalone film can be made without ruining a tight story with unnecessary sequels.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While Rogue One: A Star Wars Story does not bring the excitement of the surprising, original 1977 Star Wars (almost 40 years ago!), it does offer many similar pleasures.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One captures and develops the epic yearning and philosophical difficulty of the original series' DNA.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Ultimately, Rogue One is a movie for Star Wars fans.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: What ought to be a raging call for rebellion sputters and coughs and then finally lapses into stupefied incoherence.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Luckily, this is a film so rooted in the archetypal heroic quest that everyone can enjoy in varying degrees: hardcore fans, newcomers and young children alike can appreciate the rebels and their fight against the Leviathan

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A truly stand-alone Star Wars film is worth waiting for. But a prequel this good is a first for Star Wars, too.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's a certain weight here that hasn't necessarily been present in most of the other films. And that, plus the film's talented, diverse cast, makes Rogue One a truly unique twist on the familiar format.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is not about people who get a medal and a kiss from the princess. Rogue One is a war film. And it's very, very good.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One starts wearing out its welcome at about the hour mark, and there's another 75 minutes to go; the movie, lumbering like those AT-ATs, feels like it stomps along forever.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is a slightly darker shade of Star Wars adventure, for better and for worse. But it's also a refreshingly diverse collection of heroes this time, a multi-cultural crew against a white supremacist dictatorship.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Hopping from planet to planet, battle to battle, the fast-paced narrative means there's little time to flesh out everyone involved. Yet even if their characters remain sketchy, several make vivid impressions... [Tudyk's K-2SO] is a scene-stealing delight.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It emphasizes the necessity of sacrifice for victory, and celebrates the anonymous, forgotten fighters who put it all on the line before that Skywalker kid even got up to bat.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story has gorgeous visuals, including an excellent production design and great special effects, but when it comes to the narrative, there's a lot left to be desired thanks to a screenplay that refuses to develop the characters.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: More proof that diverse casts can actually lead to big box office numbers.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Not all Star Wars fans will embrace Rogue One. In so many ways, though, it does fit the tenor of our time.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Did I love it? Not really. But I liked it just fine. It needed it to be much better than those best-forgotten Episodes I-III, and it does just that.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a movie that nails what it means to be Star Wars in seemingly every way, and it's not afraid to scare the bejeezus out of a few kids to get there.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: An origin story that stays true to its predecessors while crafting its own unique identity.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Everyone gasped, shouted, and laughed throughout the film, culminating in a well-deserved, thunderous applause to one of the best films of this franchise and 2016.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A hugely entertaining film in which all of the elements fall into place so seamlessly that it can't help but make the vast majority of recent would-be blockbusters look even lamer than they already do.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Disney brilliantly executed another film in the Star Wars franchise, easing the doubts of fans and furthering our expectations on what we can expect from the films to follow.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Edwards reminds us of the real reasons we love these movies. Rogue One gives us hope in Star Wars.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In the first 'Star Wars' film, in 1977, heroism is rewarded (literally, in the form of a medal); but here, heroism requires extreme sacrifice. That (ultimately lethal) distinction is a key to the difference between previous chapters and this sidebar...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As the lost piece of an intricate puzzle, Rogue One satisfyingly presses into its rightful place in the series' universe. Filling in that blank space might never have seemed necessary, but, once you've seen it, there's no denying the richness added.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Though it's certainly worth a look, "Rogue One" is a minor "Star Wars" story.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A deep cut for Star Wars fanatics,

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This latest "origin story" features no storytelling development but simply repeats Star Wars formulae...Rogue One, a huckster's tale, confirms the Disney Corporation's routine indoctrination of its captive audience.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Fans of the Star Wars films--and don't be ashamed to admit it if you are one-- will see a more complete expansion of the mainline story and a lot of visual excitement.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Since Rogue One slides neatly into the preexisting plot of the original Star Wars trilogy, it doesn't feel glaringly imitative of it, as The Force Awakens did.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is mostly sparing and on-the-nose, in that sense it's reliable but don't expect it to surprise you in any meaningful way.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is fine (if you're a Star Wars fan).

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Technically sophisticated and emotionally engaging.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's all action, hopping from planet to planet and blasting all the way. That makes it faster and more serious than anything in the series.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: For a sublime third act, Rogue One is a resounding success. For the perversity of slavish desire for performers to be as interchangeable as video game characters, this Star Wars dude does not abide.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is a Star Wars film for fans, not casual observers. It has plenty of nice touches that bring back fond memories of the original and may well be the best Star Wars films since the original trilogy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The first act is the frenetic embodiment of the Hollywood machine, but the final 30 minutes is a rousing climactic battle on the empire's home turf.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's already apparent that Disney's plans for Star Wars are cause for excitement.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One isn't taking any chances: It's desperate to ensure a seamless transition with Episode IV, as if this constitutes a meaningful end in itself.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Apart from Ben Mendelsohn's weaselly Orson Krennic [and perhaps Donnie Yen]... the faces are unmemorable and the characters unexceptional, their meaningful glances unearned.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's weight to this world, no longer defined by clashes between politicians and spiritual warriors; instead, there's a sense of the desperation of the people and creatures that have always existed just outside the margins of the series' frame.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Starts off slow, but boasts a fantastic third act and a very satisfying ending. A worthy addition to the Star Wars canon

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: An exciting film full of heroism and redemption, that has great action scenes and political intrigues and achieves several touching moments.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's pretty routine, but Star Wars faithful should find it plenty good enough; director Gareth Edwards keeps things moving well enough for the modest needs of the script.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: When Rogue One is good, it is VERY good. When it is bad, it is... well not prequel trilogy-bad, at least.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: An original story about "ordinary beings achieving extraordinary things" that only exists in science fiction, without jedis and Skywalker.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A film that is embedded throughout the saga as a beautiful appendix, at times awkward, but finally satisfying.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Star Wars expanded universe kicks off with this entertaining yet far from flawless prequel to A New Hope...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While there is some humor in the movie, I would have liked more of that and less of the several scenes featuring characters stoically waiting to die. I can't really blame them for their fatalistic outlook since the Empire is indestructible.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The first 'Star Wars Story' is a success.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Those with patience will find that its second half is fully rewarding, with its epic battles and grand conflicts between good and evil bearing most of the weight of the astronomical expectations that are now part and parcel of the franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Earns its intergalactic stripes as a Star Wars spin-off of visual gumption and gritty action filmmaking, securing its place as the glue between trilogies in this ever-expanding space saga.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ... makes many of the other Star Wars films feel inferior - can we postpone the numbered movies and just tell these little big stories for a while?

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Really, this is the prequel that should have been made 10 years ago instead of that dreck that George Lucas defecated into the world.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One slots satisfyingly into the canon, pushing the franchise in a slightly more edgy, contemporary direction without causing a disturbance in the Force.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While Rogue One isn't as grand or consequential as The Force Awakens, it finds space in the margins to leave a mark all its own.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A unique and superb "Star Wars" adventure...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [Rogue One] might not be as grand a space opera as its predecessors, but certainly holds its own.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A film that is only worth if you're a big fan of the universe created by George Lucas.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Jones, Mendelsohn and Forest Whitaker (as a militia leader) stand out in a strong cast.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A routine CGI extravaganza primarily interested in creating a Pavlovian response every time someone or something familiar appears.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A film that gives a new value to the term "prequel" in this universe, in addition to "fanservice", which is done in favor of a solid and exciting script.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Disney may be squeezing the franchise to the fullest, but as long as it continues to produce Star Wars movies of this quality, I doubt many people will complain.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is largely free of the weight of myth and expectation that were borne by The Force Awakens, and this turns out to be both a good and a bad thing.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: You never knew Donnie Yen whomping stormtroopers was something you needed in your life until you saw it happening.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: These Star Wars movies are pretty much the same story each time nowadays. This one has new names for basically the same characters, played by different actors...the same bad guys. How many times can they make the same movie and get people to pay?

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While Rogue One never comes close to matching the heights of the series at its most dazzling (basically, Episodes IV and V, with honorable mention to Episode VII), it's still a worthy addition to the canon.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Not just a dull but an oppressive experience, being force-fed a corporate product: a film that never comes alive, with none of the characters properly developed, none of the relationships gelling, the very adventure formulaic.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A cleverly conceived one-off that forges its own identity with a new set of characters, a contained storyline and a kind of stripped-down tone and visual approach free of the grandiosity of the series.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Edwards appears to have elevated what could have been simply a cash-in into something that feels essential, even magical. It has the distinct smell of victory.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's most distinctive as a stylistic departure from the original Star Wars template.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rousing "Rogue One" a worthy entry in the "Star Wars" saga.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A well-crafted and thoughtful story drives Rogue One - in a sandbox that provides a perfect blend of modern action and classic Star Wars style.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A shot in the arm of apathy, a timely Christmas fantasy, proof of a fully-rejuvenated franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This Star Wars film is functional, has strength and in one way or another contributes to the cause.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story meets expectations, the fears of thousands of fans can dissipate, this is a worthy product.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In addition to giving us exactly what we should expect from our blockbuster event-movies, "Rogue One" means we've only just begun to explore this galaxy far, far away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The stars are gone, much of the spirit has been lost, leaving only a lot more wars. So this is a space-faring, big-screen computer game with hoards of Stormtroopers.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Even if it's not great, it is a quality sci-fi film that won't disappoint its fan base.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a giant universe out there, but in these movies it just keeps getting smaller.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Explosive action, interesting characters and a compelling story make this stand-alone movie in the Star Wars universe a winner all the way.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Fans will be happy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is at its best when it explores the relationship between the characters at ground level. They are a scrappy lot with a lot of heart.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: These disparate elements do not come together to make a cohesive whole. At times, Rogue One feels like a rehash of previous Star Wars films, only with newer faces.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Jyn represents a new breed of (almost gender-neutral) hero: dogged, tenacious, resolute. And in a world as bleak as this one, that's what amounts to hope.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Its characters are largely new, which means the movie can do with them as it wants. It isn't hemmed in the way most prequels are.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One does a brilliant job capturing the look and feel of Star Wars, but narratively, it's a footnote, and some of the creative choices are baffling.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Much of Rogue One is a push-me pull-you with George Lucas' original films.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One feels more like a movie with Star Wars stuff in it than an actual Star Wars movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is set a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away, yet feels more immediate, even prescient, than any Hollywood film in recent memory.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue one is the Star Wars film, that as an adult (who grew up with the originals), I've always wanted to see.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is a film that remains fun thanks to its rich universe, spectacular set pieces and superb supporting cast, while still being held back from achieving the same excellence as its predecessor.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One sure pulls no punches and it is a gritty war picture that perfectly captures a galaxy ruled and impoverished by the tyranny of the cold and clinical Empire.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Let's get this out of the way -- Rogue One is the best Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: With all the aerial dogfights, armored combat vehicles, grenades, flame-throwers and snipers, Rogue One feels like a film for those who think that most Star Wars movies are insufficiently like World War II flicks.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Ben Mendelsohn is satisfyingly nasty as the film's principal villain, and while I'd like to have seen a little more of Mads Mikkelsen, an ensemble cast of proper actors gives the film authenticity, and grit.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ...an attempt to squeeze one more movie out of a used MacGuffin.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I believe devoted Star Wars fans will be thrilled with the intense Rogue One. I liked it okay.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The studios announced that Rogue One will be a stand-alone affair without any sequels or spin-offs, which is just as well. There's nothing here that's worth carrying into future movies.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It ranks among the series' best -- just below A New Hope and The Empire Strikes Back (Episodes IV and V), and just above The Force Awakens.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: From a visual standpoint it's stunning, as the production values are a real knockout. Plus the battle scenes are really well executed. That said the plot is not always that engaging.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This off-shoot is a heck of a fun science-fiction film, and the last third of the movie is a wild, epic battle.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Suffice it to say, if the filmmakers had actually put up this tangle of a screenplay to K-2SO to rate his opinion, it wouldn't have been encouraging.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As rousing as it is respectful, carving out its own path while playing within the boundaries of the previous blockbusters, this is one of the best Star Wars stories ever put to film

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Maybe its modesty is the key to the success of "Rogue One," that it doesn't seek to build on the mythology of the other seven films, but simply fill in a gap.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Epic but violent adventure offers diversity, role models.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The 2:13 length and cookie cutter characters and events suck the life out of an underwhelming story. Great effects but the Force just isn't with this one.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This standalone prequel/sequel takes a few beats to get going but once it does, Star Wars fans are taken on an intense, thrilling ride.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Trading emotion and depth for sci-fi magic and bombast, Rogue One is the start of a darker, more grown-up direction for the saga, and I applaud it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's genuine fun here, but the humor is cynical, the heroics are tinged with regret, and it's all delivered with a cold smack of - yes - political relevance.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is thrilling, harrowing, and slightly rushed, a beautifully shot film that could have given its characters more time to develop.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If you've ever wondered where Princess Leia got those Death Star plans from, well, here you go. Hope I'm not spoiling anything.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The best Star Wars movie ever by a longshot.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I had a bad feeling about this, but Rogue One proves it belongs in the Star Wars universe.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Stylistic touches and new characters make 'Rogue One' seem fresh, which also invigorates the ongoing franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: We must trust this series, a series that made us fall in love with scruffy-looking nerf herders, trigger happy fuzzballs and pessimistic droids. We must trust the Force.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: By the note-perfect closing moments, "Rogue One" has transformed into a richly rewarding experience.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As we rebels prepare to fight the empire of Trump, the film is more pertinent than ever.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force is with "Rogue One" because by looking back, it helps carry the "Star Wars" saga forward.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is technically a spin-off but it is a rip-roaring, do-or-die adventure yarn in the best tradition of the space-age saga.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Gareth Edwards has expanded his story to its maximum while keeping it lean, raw and morally murky, outdoing The Force Awakens in the most satisfying installment since The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A seriously rousing action film with a riveting cast of characters and a surprising willingness to embrace even the darkest elements of storytelling.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: With strong work from Jones, Luna, Mikkelsen and Mendelsohn, a handful of exciting set-pieces... and plenty of expensive CG (surprise, surprise), this still doesn't quite work as the epic it so wants to be.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's a sense of familiarity and a refreshing sense of being offered something we haven't quite seen before, and that Rogue One is actually entertaining about it makes the experience all the sweeter.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The film isn't as excting as Episode VII, but there are a few reasons to get excited about it: the incredible stages, Death troopers and a pair of cameos that serve as anchor to this universe.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: With amazing battles that live up to the original saga, this film is more than a close relative worthy of Star Wars.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The good news is that Edwards' effort to make a storm-the-beach war film produces a tense third act that earns most of its big moments and also justifies much of what's come before.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As a prequel, it brings depth and strength to the existing canon, and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story will probably leave fans wishing it could have spun off into a franchise of its own.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a film that should further the genuine sense of excitement surrounding this particular franchise revival, while standing as something of a classic in its own right.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force is strong in this spin-off.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A a tense, well-made spacefaring war movie about a desperate and demoralized band of insurgents standing up against a rising authoritarian regime.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue Ones establishes its own identity while fitting perfectly in the Star Wars universe.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: We're used to the characters in this series existing primarily as archetypes. The characters here, though, barely qualify as archetypes.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is the Star Wars film to be excited for since a galaxy far, far away has never looked as promising as it does now. Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is everything The Force Awakens should have been and then some.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Certainly there is pleasure in revisiting a favorite place you've been many times before. But it's not an 'event' film. For the first time, it really does just feel like an episode.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Audiences once packed theaters to gawk at the future; now, it's to soak in the past. The emphasis is on packing in as much nostalgia as possible and tersely editing it together to resemble a film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One finds a way to forge its own path.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A film with amazing performances and an absolutely memorable ending, where action, emotion, joy and sadness embrace in a totemic spectacle.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [Gareth Edwards'] technical vision shines through in the battle scenes, but his work with actors leaves something to be desired

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [A]n eye-popping heart-stopping joyride that leaves you breathless... a grand and operatic vision...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Edwards pushes the saga out of its comfort zone to offer a complex look at the universe created by George Lucas, making it truly feel diverse and complicated.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Sadly, that Felicity Jones isn't a standout as Rogue One's lead speaks to how more effort seems to have been spent on fan service than character development...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A fun ride that repeats the Star Wars legacy without really adding to it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's an enthralling go, with little pops of surprise and revelation that should please, nostalgically so.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: An energetic and very surprising film from the galactic saga with the very successful and simple resource of telling the same story.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One may be more intense than fun, but it's the best Star Wars prequel film by a long shot.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is what the fans expected and more.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A serious and occasionally spectacular addition to the Star Wars universe that only suffers in comparison to the original saga when measured by the charisma and likability of its characters.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Action-packed and glorious in its engaging and often times, exotic dimensions of storytelling is absolutely stirring.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is a movie made for fans.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Tudyk's K-2S0 has in miniature what Edwards's movie lacks overall: the soul of a new machine.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One" spins "Star Wars" into a whole new orbit.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Star Wars Wars is such an immersive world heavy in lore and esoteric facts that being able to balance fan service without scaring off the casual moviegoer is no easy feat. Rogue One: A Star Wars Story manages to do exactly that.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a real shame the character side of things is so weak, because otherwise this is a strong addition to the franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Some sci-fi/fantasy fans may wonder if every last drop has already been milked out of the Star Wars franchise. But, judging from this energetic standalone tangent/prequel, more can be exploited for many years to come.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [K-2SO] has all the good lines. I'm not sure if it's such a good thing that the best character in a sci-fi movie is a robot. But then again, the best character in 2001: A Space Odyssey was HAL, and that film wasn't half-bad.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Except for a few jocose, fan-serving moments, the movie is a dour affair, lacking the charm and chills of J.J. Abrams's spirited Star Wars: The Force Awakens, not to mention George Lucas's founding trilogy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Like an Imperial Star Destroyer, it starts off slow and somewhat clunky, but by the time the mind-blowing third act arrives, it's all a fan can do not to stand up and cheer.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Often it looks dingy and cheap. Speed of action ought to compensate. But when the action is standardised chases-through-space, turgid and repetitive, that doesn't compensate for anything.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [Rogue One] is sometimes as admirable as it is enjoyable, but it also has some glaring problems that are clearly holding the movie back from reaching its full potential.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This prequel delivers more levels than the Death Star's elevator.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: One of the most exhilarating in the series, a film with a real sense of how to tell a story - and tell it well.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Familiar Star Wars action scenarios are revisited, revamped and revitalised courtesy of bleeding edge effects and genuine love for the material.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One does a great job of walking the fine line between being a Star Wars film and not feeling like any other Star Wars film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A highly entertaining mess...the kind of loopy, stumblebum spectacle you get when state-of-the-art visual effects collide head-on with the erratic sensibilities of a resolutely mediocre director and the crushing need for a studio to meet a release date.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The rebel yell is a little croaky.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It also works as its own stand-alone film. One which, despite some lumpy pacing in its first half, turns out to be possibly the best Star Wars war film of the bunch.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One works best because its story is so narrowly focused.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is an explosive, brilliant entry into the Star Wars universe. It's a bracing slap in the face, but a bloody fun one to watch

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The good news is that it's something genuinely fresh, a Star Wars story unlike any big screen adventure yet.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In short, this movie is what the Star Wars prequels should have been, and that's meant as high praise indeed.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The resonant and entertaining Rogue One is about the persistence of hope and faith in the darkest of hours. As we stagger to the end of this epically turbulent year, the movie is all but guaranteed to strike a chord.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Efficiently made...but it comes across as an assembly-line product, an elaborate but fairly conventional action-adventure movie too dependent for its effect on references to earlier entries in the series.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: That's what people love about these Star Wars movies, right? We get older, they stay the same.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One packs an emotional punch and shows much promise for stories to come from a rich universe with an astonishing cultural impact.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Dark, gritty and heavy on the nostalgia, what Rogue One lacks in dialogue it makes up for in action.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: a boots-on-the-ground war story about flawed and forgotten heroes

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The performances in this film are among the best the franchise has seen. This isn't a film of supermen. It's one of everyday people trying to justify, morally and practically, their roles in the struggles against an overwhelming, evil adversary.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The film comes home strong, with large-scale warfare, feats of great daring and sacrifice, and acres of dead storm-troopers.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I enjoyed the film that nicely balances being its own standalone offering and one that pays homage to and serves as an important thread in the sci-fi series.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is entertaining enough, but there is not much surprise as to how things turn out.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Hemmed in by a script that assigns truly theatrical sinisterness to pre-existing creations (i.e. Darth Vader) Ben Mendelsohn doesn't get to go 'the full Mendo', filled with pure, baleful, blackhearted menace, but hot damn - it's good to have him on board.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is what the fans were waiting for. Ideal for the ones that aren't passionate about the saga because they will find reasons to fall in love with this universe.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Above all else, it is on a technical level that Rogue One truly excels, allowing Edwards to conjure a sizeable number of intergalactic spectacles that are as stirring as they are stylish.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Imitation, they say, is the highest form of flattery. If so, the makers of "Rogue One" flatter the heck out of its predecessors.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Gareth Edwards tries to generate suspense by using well-worn movie cliches that display a lack of imagination and point to the flaws of telling this tale in the first place.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is still an achievement. Every other Star Wars movie has only ever had the responsibility of telling part of a story - this manages the whole thing in one go.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A fun outing, if also a derivative one. Donnie Yen and the droid steal the film from the leads...

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's a comfort in being in the Star Wars Universe and you immediately feel a renewed affection for it upon re-entry. But a Star Wars film shouldn't rely on its Star Wars-yness.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One does not extend the Star Wars story but there are times when it deepens it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The story clicks nicely into place with the events of Star Wars but that narrative is really just a blank sky in which the film's other elements can sparkle like stars.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One might not necessarily be a film that was needed but once the credits roll, you realise how much you desperately wanted it regardless.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Nothing is exultant, dramatic, epic, heroic, complex or just entertaining to me. The film is overwhelmingly empty, and lacks minimal grace and rhythm.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is one of the best films of our favorite space saga and will undoubtedly delight the fans, even on the verge of a nostalgic and involuntary tear of emotion.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is like its heroes. It is flawed in some ways, but it's still well worth the wait.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It suffers, like many blockbusters, from too much spectacle and not enough truth, but its greatest sin is that it feels dull, insipid and underwhelming despite a plethora of loud action scenes and dazzling visual effects.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: enhances as well as annotates the Star Wars mythos, making the story we thought we knew in A NEW HOPE richer and more urgent.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In previous Star Wars movies, one side wore black hats and the other wore white...Here that's not the case. For some, this is a selling point. For me, it's close to a deal-breaker.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There's nothing to sink our teeth into, especially when we already know how it ends. There's no suspense.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is at its best when it's at war .

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Admittedly, this can be viewed as simply another rehash of old stories and themes, but hash is rarely this tasty.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A Star Wars story for the ages.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The movie the prequels should have been. Perfectly captures the spirit of the original trilogy and delivers a genuinely thrilling Star Wars film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is Star Wars for hard core fans who felt left behind by the prequels, but it's got little to offer casual viewers beyond competent, uninspired thrills.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Of space dust, Joni Mitchell and the Force: a visually splendid, dramatically stirring journey spanning both yesteryear and tomorrow.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force is not only well and truly with us again, it seems as if it's never been gone.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: An almighty triumph, the best-constructed and most fun Star Wars flick since The Empire Strikes Back. The force is truly strong with this one.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It was always one of 2016's most anticipated films and it doesn't let down the legions who have been waiting for it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Gareth Edwards has crafted the most satisfying Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The movie didn't rekindle the thrill of seeing, say, The Empire Strikes Back, but Rogue One will loom pretty large in the Star Wars galaxy - if only because there's so little competition.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: While the principal characters are new, Edwards ensures there are enough significant nods to the Star Wars universe to enchant fans.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A movie experience that is supremely captivating.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Jones' portrayal is quite different from what we have come to expect from the Oscar nominee, and she proves she can handle the role of an action heroine with surprising ferocity.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "...has the urgency and battlefield heroism that great war movies are made of. It's incredible stuff all around."

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" is a fine stand-alone film and one that will have you anticipating "Episode VIII," which is just a short 367 days away!

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ROGUE ONE begins as an inspired concept, only to conclude with a soulless stare.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Coming from someone who is not really a Star Wars freak, I have to say I was impressed. This could be the best one yet.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: There is always the danger with a film of this high profile to expect or want it to over-deliver. Sadly - though understandably - Rogue One just doesn't do that.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One accomplishes what fans have wanted to see for a few decades now: making Darth Vader scary again.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's the trio of Tudyk, Wen and especially Yen who steal the show, each bringing to life characters that will likely go down as three of the best ever to grace a story set in the Star Wars universe.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is a gorgeous and immersive film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Though not meant to be an episode in the great intergalactic narrative of the series of trilogies, Edwards' Rogue One is an enthralling companion piece that fully embodies the Star Wars spirit and delivers the rousing pleasures.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Technically brilliant, Rogue One delivers the spectacle and the aerial combat that are such signatures of the Star Wars ethos, with some eye pleasing vistas of a hectic part of the stunningly beautiful universe

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: New diverse actors from around our world breathe new life into prequel that just entertainingly barely satisfactorily, repeats the tried and true themes and expensive action.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This spin-off/prequel has the same primitive, lived-in, emotional, loopy, let's-put-on-a-show spirit that made us fall in love with the original trilogy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Of the three sidekicks, Yen's rueful but deadly martial artist leaves the best action impression.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One somehow delivers on almost all of its weighty pre-release promises whilst at the same time besting The Force Awakens for sheer spectacle.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A hugely enjoyable film, and an impressive sign of things to come. This is the perfect film for a Star Wars fan.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's an experiment that mostly works, but there are moments when it's clear that the task of finding new areas of "Star Wars" to play with is a bit too much for director Gareth Edwards to handle.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: We already knew this was going to be a thrilling epic, but I had no idea of the emotional punch it would pack.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I enjoyed this scrappy little movie, the second consecutive one to feature a female heroine.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One left me feeling giddy with joy at seeing the Star Wars franchise expanded with such a genuine sense of affection and understanding for what made us fall in love with a galaxy far, far away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It offers more details of interoffice politics among the squabbling factions of both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance than probably anyone but a mid-level manager cares for. Yet you generally feel you're in good hands.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Star Wars movies have been dazzling, infuriating, heartbreaking, silly, witty, convoluted, gripping and overblown. But until Rogue One: A Star Wars story, I don't think "dull" was the most appropriate adjective.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: [Rogue One has] well-placed humor, inside jokes, aliens, droids and creepy CGI renderings of two key Star Wars characters, all set against the backdrops of mind-bending production designs and hypnotic visual effects.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a downer. It's morally tangled. The characters are as depressed as the scenario, and Michael Giacchino's music can't make it better.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Disney refuses to waver from what makes 'Star Wars' matter - the battle between good and evil. Where can we send the 'thank you' notes?

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If you're not a fan, Rogue One may not be the revelation that The Force Awakens turned out to be. But it won't have you wishing for your own personal Death Star either.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ...while it's great to see Danish actor Mads Mikkelsen placed into Star Wars lore as a catalyst for the Rebel Alliance the British Jones lacks the fire Daisy Ridley brought to Chapter VII.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Lucasfilm has outdone themselves. They've delivered a thrilling installment that embodies the best of Star Wars. Rogue One surpasses every expectation.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The most thrilling Star Wars experience yet.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: What results is a poignant, powerful paean to the Star Wars Universe, set in a world where the best thing you can hope for is hope itself. It's a perfect and complete standalone, but it changes everything.
