Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If The Force Awakens was an exercise in giving Star Wars fans exactly what they want, Rogue One does its best to show them what else there is in the galaxy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Credit to Jones, then, for imbuing the character with a steely melancholy. Moreover, her chemistry with bad-boy Andor visibly sizzles, so that you feel genuine investment in their story.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The new characters are nicely fleshed out, particularly Jones's Jyn, whose initial cynicism gradually morphs into a steely resolve, its seed planted by the memory of her father, but watered by the idealism of the Rebellion.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A classic adventure story and worthy spin off of one of the most popular sagas of contemporary cinema.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: At its best, Rogue One is scrappy and epic in equal measure, aware of the potential to be glorified fan fiction and using exactly what it needs from the Star Wars mythology to create a vibrant, stand-alone adventure.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One" is definitive proof: "Star Wars" is back, baby.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: When you realize where it's all been heading -- ending on a moment that's as transcendent as anything in 40 years of the franchise -- you'll be so, so happy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is one of the best Star Wars flicks to date -- as well as the grittiest, darkest, and most grounded.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One features stirring action scenes, vivid characterisation and one or two truly eye-popping explosions. Nonetheless, what it lacks is any real originality.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Doesn't break the mold in terms of franchise formula, and it's an enjoyable installment in the "Star Wars" canon. However, it's not much more than that.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: 'Because it's awesome' is enough reason for Rogue One, and it is awesome. The final space battle is the best space battle of any Star Wars movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Much more than a mere sideshow in the Star Wars saga, these rebels build on a brilliant legacy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Star Wars has been filled with political commentary since the first in 1977, and this film is no different. [...] I enjoyed this more than The Force Awakens.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As the kickoff of a new phase of "Star Wars" on the big screen, "Rogue One" is a smashing success, showing there is a lot more to this galaxy than lightsabers and Skywalkers.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A perfectly satisfying summer fun film. Untidy and a little cliché at first, but eventually ends up standing out because of its humor and its subversive energy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One" is pure, unbridled "Star Wars."

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: For all that feels uninspired and unnecessary in Rogue One, it's no disaster.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Gareth Edwards' venture into a galaxy far, far away is the Star Wars film we never knew we needed. It's a triumphantly thrilling, serious-minded war movie that is incalculably stronger for the fact that it's NOT the first chapter in a new franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a bright light in the Star Wars canon.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Edwards has created the rare Star Wars property that can be appreciated as a film. And it is about as violent and downbeat as Star Wars gets on the big screen-more downbeat than The Empire Strikes Back, in fact.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Let's face it: Rogue One is the best Star Wars movie in a long, long time.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Towering like a stick-man over the rest of the cast, K-2SO provides most of the laughs in this portentous voyage into that same old galaxy far, far away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One, directed by Gareth Edwards with a sharp script by Tony Gilroy and Chris Weitz, is a bracing and dizzying marvel, propulsively pitched and even, I dare say, moving.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In the end, this hardening of the franchise seems likely to alienate both the fans and the uninitiated.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A more than worthy adventure but lacks the brilliance of the original trilogy. It makes us have a good time, but not a memorable one.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" shows that the "Star Wars" universe can produce authentic adult entertainment without losing a bit of its frenetic energy.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In between all the crash bang and wallop, there are also some truly odious villains, with Vader as sinister as he's ever been and Australia's Ben Mendelsohn clearly relishing his role as the human-cyborg's psychotic chief enforcer.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The movie works even if you only have a passing knowledge of the Star Wars universe or haven't seen the original in years. But there are several enjoyable callbacks and some eye-popping surprises for die-hard fans.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force is strong with this film -- a perfect fit as a prequel to A New Hope.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One" represents an unobjectionable exercise in franchise extension. It's fine. It'll do. For now.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Even though the film is much grungier and more realistic than all the previous chapters, this corner of the "Star Wars" universe still is a thrilling place to visit.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The movie has a completely different, more sophisticated feel than most recent special effects-driven entries, including last year's so-so "The Force Awakens."

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's too grimy and relentlessly bleak to be any fun, and lacks the substance and drama to be taken seriously.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It tries so hard to be an epic masterpiece - with self-important speeches and an insanely outsize orchestral score - that it ends up a laughable parody of itself.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story is the best Star Wars movie since 1980's The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A solid film with its own vision and tone, yet undeniably still a part of that wonderful galaxy far, far away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If the franchise can continually pull off blockbusters with the same level of creative energy and the proper amount of reverence as Rogue One does, there's every reason to expect greatness for years to come.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If only the two-hour plus runtime made time to dig into its heroes like the original trilogy or The Force Awakens did, Rogue One could have been as sensational and satisfying.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: For this lived-in universe, Rogue One features some distinctly CGI distractions: revisiting classic characters and resuscitating them 2016-style. It's crude and unnecessary in a film that's otherwise fairly sturdy, if unremarkable.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is exactly what Edwards always said he was going to make - a STAR WARS war film. People die, and tears will be shed. Anyone who thought it would be watered-down should think again.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: "Rogue One" stands on its own, an entry that is at once part of the "Star Wars" franchise (obviously) but also separate - a tougher, grittier film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Almost pedantic in its inoffensiveness

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: All the pieces are there ... like Lego figures in a box. The problem is that the filmmakers haven't really bothered to think of anything very interesting to do with them.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The action sequences, both on the ground and in space, are rousingly staged. But the losses incurred in those sequences are sobering. The stakes in the "Star Wars" rebellion are high indeed.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: When the universe "expands" in this way, it actually makes it seem so much smaller.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It is a brave attempt at making a new kind of Star Wars movie but seems all too eager to express its fealty to the source material without thinking up any ideas of its own.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Intriguing and richly diverse characters, a suspenseful plot, an amusing sidekick, and a very satisfying answer to one of the most persistent questions from "New Hope."

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story succeeds far more than it doesn't, and has some rich characters and terrific performances (specifically Tudyk and Yen) to go along with the beautiful visuals and intense action.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One isn't so much a movie as a feature-length promotional film for itself; it's a movie that is still waiting to be made.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a bold and stirring adventure film that will have both fans and casual observers spellbound.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's constant blowing stuff up. Jyn Erso is STAR WARS "Joan of Arc" without a zealot's fervor or dynamic leadership presence. She is the only female fighter and all the nomad soldiers blindly follow her. What happened to Mendelsohn's face?

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story does exactly what it is supposed to do by incrementally expanding the Star Wars universe that we already know.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Hard-core fans who thought Episode VII was a dumbed-down rehash will bask in an action-packed film that refuses to spoon-feed information. Mind you, that's the same reason why the casual fan will be disengaged.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is a whole new stable of characters operating on the fringes of the world we know by heart. When you think about it, that's pretty exciting. And it opens up a world of cinematic possibilities moving forward

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Aside from [K-2SO's] killer lines, wonderfully voiced by the indispensable Alan Tudyk, most big satisfactions in this big, big movie come from references to Star Wars adventures you've loved before.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It stands alone as the best Star Wars entry since 1980's The Empire Strikes Back. Yes, it's that good.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Just once I'd like to see a Star Wars film and be wowed by seeing something completely new and fresh. I didn't hate it, however it commits the crime of being underwhelming and unoriginal.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is groundbreaking for the Star Wars franchise, a rousing side story that blows the doors wide open for future installments of the series. That it stands on its own as a slam-bam action thrill ride is a bonus.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: As pure retcon-meets-thought experiment, Rogue One scratches an itch that has been tickling since that initial screening in '77.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is worthy of standing alongside the original trilogy. Not only in terms of quality, but in creativity, imagination, and inspiration.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story answers the question of whether that galaxy far, far away is big enough to sustain multiple offshoots with an emphatic yes.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Contained yet expansive, nostalgic yet new, Rogue One introduces striking heroes and villains and fills its two hours and 13 minutes with a narrative that fits snugly into canon

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a more-than-worthy prequel. Which is a first in the Star Wars universe

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is better than [the prequels] by a long shot, but after the high bar set by last year's Episode VII - The Force Awakens, simply being better than the prequels isn't good enough anymore.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The chaps are heroic. The villains are dastardly. All that's missing is Burton and "Broadsword calling Danny Boy".

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force Awakens may have reanimated the once-dormant franchise, but it's Rogue One that will give Star Wars fans a new hope.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: K-2S0 contributes sorely needed humor, but nowhere near enough.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The good news is that Star Wars fans will never want again... but the movies themselves may have gotten a little less special as a result.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Despite its darker tone, Rogue One feels cosily at home in the Star Wars universe, and is crowded with the kind of imagination-tickling details the franchise thrives on.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One shouldn't work - from everything from the reshoots to just the fact Star Wars is breaking from centering its story around the Skywalkers - but, yet, it does work. Mostly.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Technically deft but emotionally cold.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Even an underwhelming Star Wars is a pretty decent Star Wars, but Rogue One misses a real chance to turn the familiar into something remarkable.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Star wars, indeed: The thrilling "Rogue One" brings a gritty combat-movie aesthetic to George Lucas's beloved space opera, but not at the expense of a thoughtful, emotional story about the foot soldiers who make sacrifices in the name of a movement.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A little bit "Guardians of the Galaxy," a little bit "Dirty Dozen" in its mass wartime slaughter, and a pretty good time once it gets going.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A more-than-worthy addition to the galaxy far far away.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: ...doesn't move the bar on what it means to be a Star Wars movie in any significant way.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A much bolder addition to the franchise that makes risky deviations from the winning formula. That those bold decisions pay off is impressive, most ...well, you know the rest.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: For all its vivid visual imagination, the film left me almost totally cold. And I say that as a man who has cried actual tears at more than one Star Wars movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a movie crammed with fan service, but when fan service is done this well, there's little to complain about and much to adore.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Very good, and often great... A true cockle-tickler for fans hoping to stoke the excitement of their inner nine-year-olds.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A movie that pushes boundaries and takes the kinds of risks this series needs to take in order to evolve to a point where it can tell completely new Star Wars stories featuring characters we've never seen before.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story upends Lucas' familiar saga by zeroing in on the compelling lives outside the orbit of the Skywalkers. There's one word that accurately conveys what this movie does to the Star Wars universe: Rebellion.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A swiftly paced, rough-and-ready entertainment that, in anticipating the canonical events of "A New Hope," manages the tricky feat of seeming at once casually diverting and hugely consequential.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The ultimate Star Wars fan film, it's short on whimsy but when it gets going there's enough risk-taking and spectacle to bode well for future standalones.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: In a series of by-the-bible films, this is the iconoclastic one. And that's its charm.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One manages to succeed as both super-nerdy fan service and the first entry since the 1977 original that will satisfy people who have never seen a Star Wars film.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This story isn't going to be like any Star Wars movie you've ever seen.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: For the original generation of "Star Wars" fans who weren't sure what to make of episodes one, two, and three, "Rogue One" is the prequel they've always wanted.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: It's a flawed movie, but a good one, sometimes more interesting as a concept than a story. But, oh, what a concept!

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is the best Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One might trade heavily in nostalgia but it's bold enough to take risks, and will leave you stirred, fired up and raring for more.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a big, crazy video game movie -- but even big, crazy video game movies are allowed to say something.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This movie is about the journey, not the destination. And the journey is about as exciting as a long drive down the Florida Turnpike.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is a return to form and the Star Wars movie fans have been waiting for since the '80s.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Despite a galaxy of potential and a number of killer moments, Gareth Edwards' Star Wars spinoff feels painfully forced.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: I'm recommending it, if only as a three-star action movie. But I think it's important to consider how the original Star Wars movies transcended their pulpy influences and how Rogue One gets mired in them.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: If nothing else, Gareth Edwards' combative, hard-working installment answers why the Death Star was so easy to destroy in the first place.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Its variations on a theme are muscular and adroit. This is another really entertaining fantasy with fan-fiction energy and attack.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A punchy standalone action tale about a spunky Rebel Alliance resistance group.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This instalment isn't about looking backwards. In essence, it's a war movie and director Gareth Edwards keeps the momentum going with a string of stunning set pieces.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Still too reliant on nostalgic fan-service, but a clear step in the right direction for these newfangled 'Star Wars' movies.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Force should have been stronger with this one.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: The Star Wars franchise has built up a massive amount of cachet over the last several decades; Rogue One is going to need every bit of it.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Yes, it's part of a series that is now eight movies strong, but it also works alone as a movie about war, oppression, a dangerous heist, a daring rebellion and a spark of hope that ignites the final stages of a revolution.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Loaded with more battle action than any of its seven predecessors, Rogue One: A Star Wars Story plays like a set-up for the events in the 1977 original and, for the most part, does so quite entertainingly.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One is less the fetish object that The Force Awakens is because it at least has the ambitions to create its own character dynamics and plot routes rather than coast on existing ones.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Will give die-hard Star Wars fans multiple orgasms...runneth over with Star Wars spectacle.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A thrilling, but flawed drama that considers the cost of fighting for one's beliefs.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This is more like it...the 'Star Wars' movie J.J. Abrams SHOULD have made.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: This "Star Wars" spinoff doesn't spin very far off from the franchise, but it's a serviceable stopgap between chapters.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Seems to want nothing more than for the audience to pat itself on the back because they know what Yavin 4 is: It's a fun game to play at Comic-Con, but it doesn't make for much of a movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Boasts thin characters played by great actors scampering about far too many planets with names that sound like obscure venereal diseases. It's a "Star Wars" knockoff that happens to look a lot like a "Star Wars" movie.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One builds to one of the best third acts in the entire franchise.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: Rogue One makes up for a shaky first act by punching into overdrive for an outstanding third act battle sequence that overwhelms in scale and intensity.

Movie: ROGUE ONE: A STAR WARS STORY
Critic Review: A darker, grittier Star Wars than we've seen before that suggests, as much as one can, what it was like to discover George Lucas' space opera in the first place.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [The Last Jedi is] proof that well-made franchise stories... can deliver a new engrossing chapter that respects the much-loved past while slowly closing the lid on it, and steer the ship in exciting, mature ways that push the boundaries...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi works. It's macro and micro stories entertain, either if you're predisposed to like what it has to offer, or at least not actively resistant to it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: But on many levels, The Last Jedi is the antithesis of the virulent discourse it generates: a reminder that flaws can give way to strengths, that being willing to be wrong is a strength, and that doing the work, not getting the credit, is what matters.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Whereas the first half is a sort of a convoluted mess. "The Last Jedi" becomes a dark and exciting sequel that becomes the film you've been looking for by the 75-minute mark.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The success of The Last Jedi, like its father before it, will most likely rest on the conclusion of the trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's the one we've been waiting for.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a two-and-a-half hour movie. It needs to be good in its own right, not just setting up for the next episode. A two-and-a-half hour, $200 million set up?

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: If you're a fan, you're going to appreciate the story continuing (on and on). If you're into makeup and CGI, you'll appreciate every minute of it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It calls the very idea of solo heroism into question. There are plenty of daring heroics in The Last Jedi and no shortage of characters who want to step into Luke's or Han's shoes, but now that impulse is shown to just make things worse.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Along with non-stop action, there seems to be more wonder, whimsy and humor in The Last Jedi, some of it deliciously subtle.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: When it comes to pop cinema at this massive level, isn't it better for a movie to take Imperial-sized chances than just giving you what you want? I'll go with yes.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson takes the narrative through its paces, weaving a complicated and fascinating story. Just when you think one thing is going to happen, the story shifts.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Thoughtfully humane and visually epic.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A wonderfully directed, acted, and progressive film. Though it takes place in a galaxy far far away, the emotions and politics are very much here on earth today.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Whereas JJ Abrams's The Force Awakens delivered a nostalgic joy that focused on reigniting a legacy I grew to love and obsess over throughout the years, Rian Johnson instead creates a nostalgia towards my years of childhood imagination.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With deep reverence for what has come before, Disney has proven that they aren't afraid to move the story forward.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The best "Star Wars" film since the original trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "Star Wars" is not "Breaking Bad," and the same narrative tricks that worked for the latter feel jarringly out of place in the former.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It is overall, a good movie worth watching. And timely, as our own modern-day First Order takes roots.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi speaks for the strength of a united front against imperial aggression...The final image leaves us with the assurance that young people tired of injustice will pick up the ball their elders dropped.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: On a second pass, the questionable was extremely overpowered by the bold and the courageous, and I saw Star Wars: The Last Jedi through a different prism. I connected with it differently.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi may not be perfect, but the need to accept imperfection and keep going becomes one of the movie's themes...It's about mentorship that's invigorating rather than smothering.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The great strength of the eighth part is also how it plays with the expectations of the audience

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rian] Johnson fulfills the necessary action and emotion, but fails to make something intelligent.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Despite Disney's humorous sequences, [The Last Jedi] revives the good in the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The highs definitely outweigh the lows, and The Last Jedi is in the upper tier of films set in that far, far away galaxy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The evolution of all the new characters was really good.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a Force to be reckoned with.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Even if the stuffed-gills plot grew frustrating, I'm still looking forward to the next foray into a galaxy far, far away.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There is just enough good material embedded in the excessive padding to appeal to our cravings for more Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: When a character is in danger, you do feel that danger...there's something about the craftsmanship in this one. That feeling of security is gone, but the movie has a lot of humor too.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The new, machine-tooled The Last Jedi is sufficiently busy (action scenes occurring every ten minutes) to make you grateful that it is, at least, agreeably paced, even if it isn't really about anything.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I both loved it and strongly disliked it at the same time. I feel like there's a really great movie in there, all the pieces are there, everything is brilliant, but then there's a lot of extra fat that needed to be trimmed off or rearranged.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: At two-and-a-half hours, with about nine separate cliffhanger endings, it's a bit long, but Johnson's keen visual sense, doses of humor and a couple of cameos buoy the film

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There's a lot to like in the new Star Wars film...But it is not, as so many are saying, either the best Star Wars movie ever nor even the best since The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The music still feels fresh and Rian Johnson's film will please the fans with its wonderful visuals and abundance of action. But for me, there was something missing.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The story is compelling and there are some good characters to follow on this journey through many twists and turns. The acting is solid, and the visual effects are top notch. This is an impressive effort by writer-director Rian Johnson ('Looper').

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The mission is noble. The result, disastrous.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A red throne room evokes the Technicolor fantasies of Michael Powell and Vincente Minnelli, while the scratchy surfaces of a sand planet trace the arc of each combatant's footwork like a choreographer's notation, transforming a duel into a dance.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There is simply no joy in The Last Jedi. But all great legacies, I guess, are destined to fade.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's fun to look at.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Same effects, new cast. Some should stay and some should go.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A stellar, if slightly overlong, followup to 2015's Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Daisy Ridley is always in motion. Her role of a young warrior is intense, but her moments with Adam Driver, comparing good and evil, are good, indeed.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The thing that makes the film most interesting is its function as a bridge between two paradigms, really two distinct generations, Boomers and Millennials.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Jedi offers a rather bold reinvention and expansion of what the Star Wars universe is capable of.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: That's when the film offers moments... that go from euphoria to sadness, from fear to uncertainty, and from incredulity to the unexpected; moments that will surely be established as some of the best in the entire franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Considering that the franchise returns to Abrams in the next installment, surely the producers will ask for neatness and solemnity ... for old times sake

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I wish it were a much better movie than this one.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi has been favourably compared to The Empire Strikes Back and while there's some truth to that, they're very different films. Yes, it's dark but it's the moments of light that you'll remember.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I know I'm in the minority here, but director Rian Johnson's follow-up to The Force Awakens felt overstuffed and incredibly disjointed; a collection of uncorrelated rah-rah scenes and little else.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Writer-director Rian Johnson repeatedly shows an inability to build to moments. His screenplay's biggest beats come off as self-defeating and lifeless.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: What's most interesting to me about The Last Jedi is Luke's return as the mentor rather than the student, grappling with his failure in this new role, and later aspiring to be the wise and patient teacher.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: They ticked off all the boxes except the one marked "Jar Jar Binks." You are very old if you needed to see all these characters again.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A fantastic sequel...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With a script by director Johnson, "The Last Jedi" is a mash-up of many different stories, but all with the same main plot line; good versus evil.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: If you can accept the excess, the weird humour, the entirely inessential subplot, and the fact that it could stand to end a scene earlier, then the series will continue to thrive in a galaxy far, far away.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Where Abrams left us eager for more, Johnson leaves us sated and willing to wait a couple of years for the next episode. Still, there's plenty of fun to be had, and the series faithful won't be disappointed.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi tackles the bigger questions that the morally sure previous entries did not.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It is the best and most innovative Star Wars film to come along in a long time and you would think that this would inspire celebration in the streets among longtime fans of the franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Hamill and Fisher, who give "The Last Jedi" its emotional depth, are joined by Adam Driver, who once again shows himself to be one of the most skillful young actors of his generation.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "The Last Jedi" is not a crude predictable entry to the series; Rian Johnson has delivered a luminous spark that's left the future of the franchise looking bright.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ... the director manages to raise a moving monument to something as brilliant and even corny as the possibility of a shared dream.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Digressive rather than progressive, The Last Jedi fails to develop the new, exciting and complex characters we met in The Force Awakens.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Abrams gave us the gentle re-introduction we needed, and it paved the way for writer and director Rian Johnson to take the story in strange new directions.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Luke Skywalker rules all in this movie, but there's a lot of stuff that doesn't work.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Although not worse than the prequels for me, The Last Jedi is its own special kind of meh that demonstrates Disney doesn't have the guts to do this franchise any justice.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Over-funded, bloated, self-important and virtually immobile, The Last Jedi bears more than a passing resemblance to Jabba the Hutt.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This movie feels like a TIE fighter on the fritz, spinning in circles as it fires off one light-show after another.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Here, [Mark] Hamill turns in his best performance, giving the character a depth and complexity that wasn't as evident in the original trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With Johnson at the helm, the torch-along with the lightsaber-is safely passed to a new generation

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: the most interesting people are no longer related to Darth Vader

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While a good Star Wars film, this was not the best. With issues across the board (technical, character and plot), The Last Jedi does leave much to be desired.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Undoubtedly, Johnson is able to make some notable moments...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There's a sense of closure. Which makes The Last Jedi an incredibly cathartic experience.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's nice that the Rebellion is no longer defined by suicide attacks and The Force no longer a matter of hereditary title.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson leavens political high seriousness and fan-service tear-jerking with enough charm and humour to prevent The Last Jedi becoming the biggest downer ever delivered at Christmas by the Walt Disney Company.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: More good things and fewer bad things happen in this movie than in any of the three prequels, but the film is hellbent on presenting its good things in the worst possible light.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: What The Last Jedi does so well over its two-hour, 32-minute thrill-ride is start to escape the gravitational pull of orbiting the same Skywalker family squabbles on the big screen for 40 years.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Here's the first 'Star Wars' movie since 'Empire' that you don't have to make excuses for enjoying.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Upends expectations, demythologizes the mythos, and takes an iconic series in a bold new direction with a story full of humor, courage, and dazzling imagery.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ... The Last Jedi moves in an interesting range of grays, sacrificing part of the ingenuity and regal values ??of yesteryear for the despair and bitterness of the times.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: An excellent balance is created between telling us a new and interesting story...and having good action scenes.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The force is strong with Rian Johnson, who delivers de most exciting, risky, adult and entertaining Star Wars movie since, well, you know which one.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A thing of beauty and work of art about which the loudest grumblers likely expected the most conventional developments - lost in Reddit rabbit holes and clickbait in which creatives graciously fielded insistent questions about parents or provenances.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Each of these characters finds a surprising connection to others, derailing plans and sending each person on an unexpected journey. The way Johnson orchestrates all of this is remarkable because it's both coherent and compelling.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is a grand step forward, one that we can only hope will light the way for the franchise's future.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With Star Wars: The Last Jedi, writer-director Rian Johnson takes the Star Wars saga into uncharted territory, with exciting results.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Its scattered pacing and tangled subplots doesn't make THE LAST JEDI a failure, but neither is it a celebration - or more importantly, an elevation - of anything other than the legacies of the late Carrie Fisher, and justly revered Mark Hamill

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In The Last Jedi, movie magic has been replaced by hocus pocus. Or perhaps even mumbo jumbo -- never has the eastern-western pop psychology of the franchise rung so hollow.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is good, in parts very good but not as good as The Force Awakens. It's too long but not tedious, it's often funny and full of action.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: From the seemingly infinite number of universes in which The Last Jedi was a bad film, or even just an OK one, Johnson has found his way to the one universe in which it is a good, occasionally first-rate one

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: For those of us who were there at the start, there's one thing that makes The Last Jedi unmissable: Carrie Fisher. Go and see it for her.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This chapter relies so much on its call-backs and references that it all feels a little bit too safe. But still a damn fine movie, pushing the story forward in style.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi should be the last Jedi. My interest died along with Hans Solo who took with him that cowboys in space humor that made the franchise so special.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: As the third act approaches, the crescendo of air-punching interludes accelerates, eliciting gasps, cheers and OMG whoops from an audience whom Johnson treats with respect, affection, and evident admiration.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a bold and challenging work -- exactly what we would expect from the auteur of Brick and Looper. In the debit column, it's also a tad bloated.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson has delivered arguably the best Star Wars ever, or at least certainly the most fun.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With The Last Jedi, there's a welcome return of hope for the Sequel Trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: not the best entry in the Star Wars franchise, but parts of it rank at the very top

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson infuses the proceedings with the same sense of wisecracking fun that made the original (now known as EPISODE IV: A NEW HOPE) so irresistible, while also ambitiously expanding on the mythos.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Events fans dreamed of happening unfold differently than imagined, and that bit of reality highlights what's really going on here: Star Wars is pushing out of its comfort zone.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's spectacular expansion of George Lucas' galactic adventure franchise is everything you want it to be - and more. What a great holiday gift for moviegoers! May the Force Be With You...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: At a point where the ever-extendable Star Wars franchise looked at risk of relying too much on its own legacy and table of cliches along comes The Last Jedi to push the saga into fresh, delightfully dangerous new territory.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Its nostalgia works well. Mark Hamill returns as Luke Skywalker and the late Carrie Fisher is again in her signature role of Leia Organa.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi brings to the audience something much more complicated for a movie to cause than tears: chills.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: What serves filmmaker Johnson well is his willingness to take more risks within classic elements than Abrams may have been able to. The real measure of the success of a film in a franchise of this stature is whether or not it ignites the imagination.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While The Last Jedi may not receive top marks for originality, the eighth official entry in the Star Wars saga is still one of the most entertaining blockbusters of the year...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ... if all you want to know is can you go in expecting a good film, the answer is yes. A resounding yes!

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi successfully combines the thrill-a-minute fun that's always been part of the saga with a fresh spin on the light/dark theme embedded into the epic tale's DNA.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With every super-spoilable turn, 'The Last Jedi' anticipates backlash, and asks longtime devotees to look inward.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This delightful if overlong film has so many arcs and subplots that you'll find yourself parsing them later... not because they don't work, but because the film packs so many scenes that reward closer-than-normal observation.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a spirited continuation - sometimes spectacular, often humorous - of the never-ending space saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With The Last Jedi, Rian Johnson's done to the Star Wars franchise what Joss Whedon had done for Marvel with The Avengers. Disney and Lucasfilm have another solid franchise base in the offing now.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: These are small choices, but important ones. The kind that make us care. The kind that make us ask, Who hurt you? Kylo Ren may be a boy at heart, but he's a villain in full.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With The Last Jedi, Johnson finds that sweet spot of reverentially seeing out the old to firmly make way for a new, perhaps final, space odyssey.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Hope for generational change, the power of any single, small, nameless dreamer, who may yet know a world not manipulated by gunrunners, moneychangers, the venal and power-mad. Forces against The Force. The sky is filled with more stars than we know.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Fanatics will love it; for the rest of us, it's a tolerably good time.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There are more genuine laughs and emotional resonance here than any of the movies have managed since 'Empire' ... But does it have even a fraction of the weird cross-genre spark that animated the original trilogy? Not at all.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With deft direction by Johnson and his script that has its ominous and mythical moments but never quite feels over-the-top or silly, this features strong work from Hamill, Ridley, Driver and Boyega.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A poignant farewell to Carrie Fisher. With dynamite women leading the action on all fronts, The Last Jedi is a fitting tribute to her legacy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Even if real fanboys are not pleased with some of the revelations (and, perhaps, not all should be believed), the major impact of The Force will go a long way in keeping everyone relatively happy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: When the salt settles, we are left with neither triumph nor tragedy; instead, it's one more chapter in the continuing saga, punctuated by a few moments of genuine awe.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The battle that inaugurates The Last Jedi is now and in the eyes of a lonely child, the ray of light in the sky that awakens his imagination.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Arguably the most beautifully directed film of the series so far. About as good as it gets for four-quadrant, tent-pole film-making. Wonderful.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is awe-inspiring and poignant. Expect to be riveted, despite its runtime of two-and-a-half hours.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Overall, Star Wars: The Last Jedi is an engaging mesh of new and old threads of past and present Star Wars narratives coming together to make a cohesive and exciting film.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's all watchable to those of us in the Skeptics Tribe. I tacked on an extra half star to the star rating for this solely because of my outsized affection for a glorious section in the middle that I enjoyed as I have few other Star Wars side journeys.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Sci-fi violence, strong female characters in thrilling epic.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rian] Johnson's miscue has posed a disquieting question: Are these filmmakers authors or fans?

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a muddled movie that has some incredibly high points and beautiful scenes... [but] also contains a lot of distracting filler.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a Rian Johnson film through and through, which is why it feels like a breath of fresh air.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There are also quite a few new creatures, among them various icicle dogs, turtle-face monks, and some impossibly cute thingies called Porgs, which look as if they nest in gift shops at night.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: However, as much time and energy has been devoted to the goings on of Rey, Ren, and their various friends and enemies, try as the film might, it doesn't generate much in the way of genuine interest in these characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The film is a relentless crowd-pleaser that has as much in common with a pedigreed art film as it does a traditional action blowout.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The characters, like the movie, take what they need from the past, leave the rest behind, and forge ahead into unexpected and exciting new terrain.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a visual spectacle that expands our understanding of the Force and how it shapes a "galaxy far, far away," adding to the mythology and lore of this franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Just like The Empire Strikes Back set the benchmark for the "orig trij", The Last Jedi does the same for the sequel trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson - like George Lucas before him - has an eye for capturing epic moments that simultaneously feel effortless and throwaway.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In short it is a dynamic, action-packed addition to the 40-year-old series that no self-respecting fan will want to miss.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Remixing the structure of the originals with the aesthetics of the prequels.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's film is the real deal, a bold, risky venture unafraid to tell its own story, freed from the weight of nostalgia and formula.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A profound spiritual experience.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi represents a triumph for the series and will make you forget Jar Jar Binks ever existed

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson ends the film with the rebel forces on the defensive and with their resources mostly spent. Yet he offers a sliver of hope - there's that word again - as he assures us, when the screen fades to dark, that brighter days are ahead.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Demonstrates an understanding of the Star Wars universe and its appeal, while also taking it into wonderful new directions

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "Star Wars: The Last Jedi" reminds us all over again why this franchise is so beloved.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I can say that the film is visually spectacular, with another superb soundtrack from John Williams, and mostly well cast.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson is easily the most skilled filmmaker to helm one of these (it's not even close) and it's not just that the film has a surface beauty of its own. He's aware of what we expect narratively from a 'Star Wars' movie, and delights in subverting it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: But the biggest thing this eighth chapter does is change where things go next in a fundamental way.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Armed with intelligent dialogue, fully dimensional characters, and the requisite wowie-zowie audio-visual effects, the Rian Johnson-Walt Disney Pictures-Lucasfilm-Ram Bergman Productions of Star Wars: The Last Jedi is pretty darned good.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Star Wars franchise is in good hands with writer-director Rian Johnson, who delivers an enthralling, often funny and at times achingly beautiful galactic adventure in The Last Jedi.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: By being easily the most unconventional film in the octet, The Last Jedi underscores exactly what Star Wars was always about. Hope. We need it now more than ever.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's easy to forget the original movie was a terrifically bold, innovative, industry-realigning blockbuster. Lucas dreamed big and took massive risks. In that sense, The Last Jedi could not be more different to the Star Wars created four decades ago.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Writer and director Rian Johnson will surprise you with new story possibilities, new emotions, new visuals to feast your eyes on.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ... plenty of twists, turns and pleasant surprises to hold an audience rapt over the two-and-a-half-hour running time.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is the best Star Wars film since 1980's The Empire Strikes Back because it's so much more than stars and wars. It's those stories, joys, and pains of the heroes, villains, and nobodies who lived it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In practically every frame, writer-director Rian Johnson conveys how much fun it is to do this stuff.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: an entertaining, engaging ride, and it's all thanks to having a true filmmaker behind the lens

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson understands how to balance the strengths of the franchise, which is simultaneously a fun action-comedy for kids, and a decades-long epic with meaty philosophical themes.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Whew! ... The Last Jedi thankfully returns to the tone of fun, adventure, and especially camaraderie that J.J. Abrams established so well in The Force Awakens.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Johnson] clearly knows the material well enough to give us exactly what we expect, and he loves it enough to take it into new territory.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Moving on from previous glories to start anew furnishes greater moments for the characters than the story, but it adds to a movie that's thoughtful, emotional and contemplative.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: If the previous entry presented a respectably staid melding of old and new, this one wires everything up, cranks the juice, and lets her rip.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There is a thrilling space opera somewhere in Star Wars: The Last Jedi, if only it could rise above the echoes of its original mythology.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Epic, fun, visually sumptuous, it will tug at your heart strings because we come to know the characters across several episodes and we root for them when we recognise our own emotional responses in theirs.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is not a film for the faint of heart. But courage, a sense of wonder, a resounding faith in the strength of love, and a healthy dose of hope will take you far.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's wildly fun and thoughtful entry into the Star Wars canon finds its heroes at a precarious turning point.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The movie's richness invites more than one viewing.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi continues that transition in a way that will gratify those who were around for the beginning of the series. In other words, let the space exploration continue.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Certainly J.J. Abrams' 2015 "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" was more than satisfying, but Johnson steps it up several notches, digging deeper into characters, and even adding nuance to the "Star Wars" mythos.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Even with the warts, Star Wars: The Last Jedi feels like a big, dazzling holiday present most Star Wars fans should be able to tear into and enjoy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is built on a series of oppositions relative to one of the best known films ever made. It's the prisoner of its middle chapter predecessor.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is a sample of what Disney intends to do with this franchise, turning it into a product full of cliches, empty plots, forgettable villains, [and] one-dimensional characters.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In a world bursting with flashy popcorn movies, there's still nothing quite like a "Star Wars" flick.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi probably does the best job of any Star Wars film of capturing the allure of the Dark Side and the spiritual turmoil that would lead to-and also result from-its embrace.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Nothing less than the smartest, most nuanced, most ambitious Star Wars film ever made.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Sporadically thrilling, but overlong, exhausting, tonally uneven, and often dull.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson works in the somewhat limited palette that is Star Wars, but this middle chapter in the new trilogy also starts to break out in ways that should excite fans at the prospect of what's to come.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: With the passage of time, The Last Jedi may rise again as a necessary film, essential between one and another of the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The forceful 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi' is a cinematic triumph.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Simply put, if you love or even just enjoy the "SW" universe and its various trappings, you're going to, at a minimum, find this one to your liking.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Nothing in "The Last Jedi" is allowed to be mundane, including the places the filmmakers take the story.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: But these are minor quibbles compared to the depth, wonder, and sense of heroism that The Last Jedi brings back.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In the end, "The Last Jedi" delivers everything you would want from a "Star Wars" movie, something that's become both a blessing and a curse.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There are twists you won't see coming and just when you think you've figured everything out, Rian Johnson pulls a rabbit out of his hat.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "Star Wars: The Last Jedi" could very well be the definite evolution of the series yet.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson, writer and director of this film, took my Star Wars reveries and served them back to me with vast improvements.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Has fresh story beats and new ideas ... Yet as the complicated, messy plot unfolds, the lack of a larger vision in this new trilogy becomes more glaring.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's middle chapter in the current Star Wars trilogy is the epic you've been looking for. Capped by Mark Hamill in the performance of his career, it points the way ahead to a next generation of skywalkers - and, thrillingly, to a new hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The true star is Mark Hamill, giving the performance of his career as the anguished, isolated, tortured former Jedi Master. His scenes are worth the ticket price alone.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Muddled by bombast, but it finds significance in the art of failure as a means to an end for a new beginning (again) for Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The dialogue is peppered with droll admissions and Star Wars-savvy sarcasm, which helps to prick the heroic sweep so common to these trilogies.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Where J.J. Abrams sought to give this new trilogy a firm but predictable foundation to build upon, Rian Johnson's The Last Jedi is a risk-taker. This is to be applauded absolutely.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Unjustifiably long and with misplaced humour throughout, The Last Jedi nonetheless delivers some scintillating action, spine-tingling lore and a loving farewell to Fisher.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Goes in bold new directions while delivering familiarity. Written and directed with thoughtfulness and visual flair.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Movies should be better than those we could imagine up on our own. Rian Johnson knows what we want to see, and shows it to us in ways we couldn't have envisioned without him.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: By now, the franchise is mainly about giving the audience more of what it's already given it, and the gifted writer-director Rian Johnson (Looper) delivers just that...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ...a great Star Wars film, one that honours the traditions of the franchise but boldly pushes the envelope in terms of thematic complexity and emotional tone...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi deserves nothing but acclaim, and Johnson, an incredibly adept director, deserves to be handed as many future Star Wars films as he can manage.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Lucas Hit the Jackpot!

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A reboot of Empire Strikes Back, Star Wars: The Last Jedi is overlong, heavy-handed and fun if mostly uninspired.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Older characters pass the baton to a new, female-centric generation led by the outstanding Daisy Ridley, the new face now a confident actress with great screen charisma

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson has made a Star Wars movie that features so many great additions to canon and mythological intrigue that will have fans buzzing for years.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The perfectly paced new entry to our galaxy far, far away features so many new Star Wars moments to love...a journey full of classic hallmarks and new additions that maintains a balance of lighthearted fun, intense action and deep emotion.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is everything a Star Wars film should be, and so much more. Johnson weaves an emotionally rewarding tale while balancing all the essential sci-fi action expected.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: For Star Wars aficionados, this entry is one of the most galvanizing, from beginning to end. What an Odyssey.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: What's most thrilling about The Last Jedi is Johnson's seamless blending of old and new Star Wars lore.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars fans old and new are guaranteed to have an absolute blast.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi suffers from occasional inconsistencies in character and plot, but these quibbles are easily absorbed into the impressively vast and colorful canvas that Johnson paints with such passion and empathy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Thankfully The Last Jedi won't be the last Jedi movie, but it should be your next.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Fisher would be proud of Episode VIII, an injection of freshness into a series always only one movie away from staidness -- such is the scrutiny of something as loaded as Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The force is still strong with this one. It just takes the occasional wobble.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: For all the complexity of the sub-plots, the storyline is reassuringly familiar.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Big space battles are one thing, but there are smaller action setpieces here that can only be described as beautiful.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Carrie Fisher, in her final Star Wars performance, is the heart and soul of the film, stealing scenes with ease and on more than one occasion bringing lumps to the throat.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There's a refreshing gender balance among the key characters. Laura Dern's Vice Admiral Holdo may be dressed more for the opera but don't be fooled, kids.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Bottom line: "Star Wars: The Last Jedi" may not be the best installment in the now 40-year-old franchise, but it packs enough action and surprises to keep fans happy through the Christmas season and beyond.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Daisy] Ridley already proved herself a worthy addition to the Star Wars fold and does nothing here to convince us that we weren't right to welcome her for what evidently will be a long run.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The series feels like it is truly moving forward for the first time in decades, and that future now looks more promising.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's full of moments both thrilling and poignant, with anticipated reunions and goodbyes, and pulse-pounding action.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While The Last Jedi acknowledges the inevitable comparisons to [The Empire Strikes Back] by setting up some similar scenarios, it then does original and surprising things with those moments.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Entertains as comfort food in filmic form, but this is an altogether slighter experience than the spectacular one "The Force Awakens" provided. This is a fine film in spite of its many issues, easily recommendable to fans.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The last act overcomes a sluggish middle and is as thrilling as this franchise ever gets.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi delivers the all-too-rare thrill of a huge popcorn movie that respects the intelligence of its audience, while also serving up plenty of moments designed to make them lose their damn minds.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a compelling feature for the most part, but it's too obsessed with surprises, often sacrificing stability just to rattle fans.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Gorgeous cinematography, solid performances & one of the best scenes in Star Wars history. Though, it has issues incl. unnecessary comedy that affects tone. Liked but didn't love.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Regardless of the jokes and explicit exposition, there was enough real emotion to make me care. Given the absolute ridiculousness of what happens in this unapologetic space soap opera, making me feel anything at all is an undeniable measure of success.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ...a bit of a placeholder.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: So much movie, I think my engorged eyeballs had to stick a finger down their throats and vomit out a couple of epic battle scenes just so they could get through the finale.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is an epic to inspire, an adventure that truly carries you to a galaxy far, far away, and will hold in your heart as all the best stories do.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [The Last Jedi] features some of the best drama, comedy and action of the whole series, as well as more visual invention than ever

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi repeatedly goes against your every instinct, takes your emotions for a roller coaster, and takes the characters we know in directions that will blow your mind.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Director/screenwriter Rian Johnson has truly delivered the galaxy goods on this event-the second installment of the sequel trilogy.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Johnson] does his best work in The Last Jedi when he stops trying for narrative complexity and just stages some cool outer-space action.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It arrives at a very dark moment indeed, and yet like the movies that preceded it, it speaks very powerfully to where we're at right now.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There's a sense that Johnson is giving busy-work to certain characters while others are catching up. The Last Jedi is a great 105-minute movie stretched too thin.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rian Johnson] achieves what no one else has since The Empire Strikes Back: a fusion of junkyard genre parts and passion.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: On the whole, this is a great step forward for the franchise - it's deeper, it's darker and it has porgs.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Nothing can prepare you for what Star Wars: The Last Jedi delivers and that's exactly what makes so damn near perfect.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While I have laughed at times during previous "Star Wars" movies, I did not expect to do so as quickly as "The Last Jedi" made me.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rain] Johnson crafts an entertaining, swashbuckling flick in the series' eighth film. It possesses the whimsy, the heart and light sabers necessary for reverence in the Star Wars canon.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is a movie not only for Star Wars fans but also for fans of losing themselves in, and falling in love with, blockbuster movies. That's a feeling most Hollywood movies have forgotten-and The Last Jedi is here to make us remember it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While familiar, this is a Star Wars film that isn't overly beholden to its past, playing with the tropes, themes, and characters of its predecessors in a way that is both unsettling but necessary.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Director Rian Johnson's] movie has a sense of humor about itself and a sense of joy, but its emotional generosity, even in the midst of all the extravagant green-screen work, is its best special effect.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The spectacles in Star Wars: The Last Jedi are some of the most powerful and believable in the franchises.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Have we ever had a relaunch followed immediately by a reboot?

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi launches the franchise to another level of action and humor thanks to incoming writer-director Rian Johnson, whose imagination seems boundless as George Lucas' 40 years ago.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: You don't have to be a Star Wars fan to love this addition to the canon (heck, it works even if you haven't seen any of the other movies).

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: In short, it feels like a new hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson has delivered the goods: a film that isn't afraid to be ambitious, that delights and dazzles in equal measure, while providing a worthwhile emotional investment. It is a crowd-pleaser that will be wholeheartedly embraced by fans.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It soars and sinks, shrewdly building on franchise lore while scoring cheap shots against capitalism. Frustrating it is, hmmm?

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: As indebted to the previous installments and "Star Wars" canon as it is to classic Westerns, sword-and-sandal epics and martial arts films.... it's the blend of reverence for its roots and embrace of the new that makes "The Last Jedi" a triumph.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A stunning black, white, and red color pallette, thrilling adventure, appealing new characters, worthy developments for old friends and a cause to root for.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars fans, your sky high expectations are rewarded. Rian Johnson takes the fabled lore from a galaxy far away into uncharted territory. He will have you spellbound.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The movie comes off as a work that's ironed out, flattened down, appallingly purified.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson clearly remembers something that Lucas' most fervent followers sometimes forget: These are movies for the young, or at least the young at heart.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is that very rare thing, a brilliantly crafted, intelligent blockbuster that will deserve every penny of its doubtless immense box-office returns.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Efficiently manufactured and enjoyable enough but overloaded with action and effects, and sorely lacking the magic that marked the first movies in the franchise.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi boasts many very good performances, ones that enrich the characters and which salute writer/director Johnson's ability to find the humanity within technology, something he proved early on with his artful time-travel thriller Looper.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A blockbuster with the beating heart of its creator worn proudly on its sleeve.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [G]ets off to a bit of an uneven start, but finds its footing eventually... not the best of the series, and not the best of the new films, but it's still a worthwhile entry in the continuing saga...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A spectacular, full-throttle joyride of thrills, exhilarating, screen-filling visuals, emotional heft and humor, with familiar characters and new faces we'll almost certainly be seeing again.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi may not be a flawless film but continues to push the story forward. The film has a lot going for it and Rian Johnson seems to understand exactly what Star Wars fans are looking for.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi builds upon Star Wars history for a more expansive, high-stakes adventure with plenty of fresh - and classic - elements.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Without giving away any surprises, there will be endearing reunions, unexpected appearances and outcomes...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: There's a trick to taking something old and making it bigger and more impressive, yet familiar enough to sate our desire for the same. With Last Jedi, Johnson pulls it off assuredly enough to please nearly everybody.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi, however, opens up some new possibilities. It doesn't provide a ton of satisfying answers, but it creates some interesting questions. And it manages to make "Star Wars" feel new again.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Perhaps like no film in the franchise yet, 'The Last Jedi' seriously considers the hubris that comes with certainty, and how knots from the past that can keep you bound from moving forward.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Disney found a true "Star Wars" champion in Johnson and I'm eager to see what he does when he's able to craft the next trilogy from scratch.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "The Last Jedi" may not possess its immediate predecessors' pleasant shock of the new, nor is it a stylistic detour from what's expected. But it makes up for this with wit, spirit and one wicked saber smackdown.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's a film of genuine beauty, one where you come away as eager to talk about the set design and the choreography as you do the fate of the galaxy or what might happen next.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "The Last Jedi" is a rousing, stirring adventure that is consistently guided by the courage and fallibility of its characters, culminating in a sustained, riveting finale that overpowers any quibbles about pacing and plotting.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This film climbs well beyond nerd-approved material, carrying us into a changed future without insulting Lucasfilms' holy writ.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Johnson's]often-stirring addition to the saga finally lands on an affecting point about the importance of preserving essential cultural tradition without clinging too strictly to the dogma -- and the texts -- of the old way

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Fans can expect plenty of surprises and awe-inspiring visual wizardry.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While the central story concept of THE LAST JEDI, Luke's Dharmic apotheosis and Rey's Gnostic enlightenment, is a brilliant one, it's hounded by lopsided execution and a ham-fisted subplot...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: After this - I never thought I'd say it - I'm up for more. Bring on the next Star Wars.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The first half of the movie works in fits and starts, but Johnson makes up for it in the second, when the bundle of subplots intertwine tighter, and the narrative rockets forward, its action fleet of foot and tightly tied to its emotional highs.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Everything a fan could want from a Star Wars film and then some.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rian] Johnson's passion ends up giving wings to these last Jedi who, although wounded and disenchanted, resist stronger than ever.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: While there are elements nodding to The Empire Strikes Back, The Last Jedi is no copycat. In its most daring moments, it even tweaks a few series tropes, updating them with a decidedly populist kick.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Writer-director Rian Johnson has certainly made the busiest Star Wars film of them all, but he keeps it from becoming a slog by infusing it with humor, verve, and visual charm.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Splits its attentions between two threads, but only half delivers spectacularly with heart, thrills, and some truly beautiful story beats while the other limps through space.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Every moment where The Last Jedi almost takes a bold risk for the series, it undermines itself to maintain the status quo.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "The Last Jedi" has as much heart as it has guts and that's a stirring combination. You walk out of the cinema reminded why it's sometimes worth fighting a battle you may well lose.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's main feat is being savvy enough to know that sometimes the best thing to do is cherishing the past before burning it to the ground.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: But gradually, Johnson's many additions become too much of a good thing and The Last Jedi grows crowded, busy and long.
