Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: So many elements in Episode VIII are recycled that it could have been called Rerun of the Jedi.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Last Jedi is deep. It's also rollicking. It's right up there with the very first Star Wars in terms of its enjoyability factor. It's a triumph.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: When everything pulls in the same direction, as it does consistently in "The Last Jedi," it's like watching a mind-boggling clockwork click into a deft ballet.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: That said, I'd stop short of calling director Rian Johnson's undeniably impressive initiation into the Star Wars fold the masterpiece that some desperately want it to be. The film simply drags too much in the middle.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: You cannot kill the past. What you can do is build on it to enable an intriguing future. At the very least, The Last Jedi does that.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Carrie Fisher] is luminous here. Every time she's on screen, it's impossible to look away, and she is as tough, loving, and wily as we would ever want our Leia to be.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The emotional pay-offs are huge, the visuals are stunning, the performances are brilliant and, even as it eagerly explores the darkness, The Last Jedi never loses sight of its heart.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "The Last Jedi" is the best directed, most beautiful-looking "Star Wars" movie since "The Empire Strikes Back."

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: 'The Last Jedi' walks a fine line for fans, creating a solid standalone film that shines within the franchise canon.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It feels fresh, exciting and playful, without losing the operatic grandeur Star Wars thrives upon.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: If Star Wars: The Last Jedi isn't a complete deconstruction of the original trilogy, it's at least an acknowledgement that these archetypical characters must evolve in order to survive.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It's not a perfect movie by any means; some of the comedy is a little too silly and one or two of the plot threads feel a bit less important than the others, but these quibbles were minor when compared to the parts that work. Those REALLY work.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi at its heart is a love letter to a childhood. From Luke's sly wink to an old friend to General Leia's leadership, the familiar heroes dominate the screen, earn the biggest applause and serve as a compass to the next generation.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi opens up with one of the best space fights the series has seen, and it carries that quality throughout. It has one of the best light saber fights, one of the best endings, and some of the most fun the series has seen.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It provides top-drawer popcorn entertainment for the casual cinema goer, while hardcore fans will love it for the respect it has for the franchise history and for what it promises for the future.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: My favorite among the new castmembers is Laura Dern as Leia's Vice Admiral Amilyn Holdo, a poker player of near-Vulcan inscrutability.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is a GREAT Star Wars movie, possibly the best. It's certainly more satisfying and easily the most emotional.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Falsely epic, uselessly lyrical

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This mid-section marker in the current trilogy simply doesn't disappoint, realising the courage of its convictions with an intelligent story and a heart-swelling emotional resonance.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is a top-of-the-line, A-plus Star Wars and scifi movie -- one that we'll be watching and discussing for as long as there's a galaxy far, far away.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The movie suffers a little from uneven pacing and occasionally lost my focus here and there but it is a worthy addition to the canon.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is not just a bold, fresh and humorous new addition to the franchise -- it's the one that will change it forever.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Mark Hamill has never been better in his interpretation of Luke Skywalker

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: An excellent middle chapter bursting with wit, wisdom, emotion, shocks, old-fashioned derring-do, state-of-the-art tech, and stonking set-pieces.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: When the feelings come in The Last Jedi, and they do come, they're deep and they're real. Go ahead and try to watch the penultimate scene without crying, or pretending not to. And may the Force be with you.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It took them 40 years, but they've finally done it. The best Star Wars film of the series. There. That's it. It's that simple.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It supplies us with all the things we expect - nay, demand - in a Star Wars movie, and manages to surprise us by revealing that this fictional universe, in which we've already clocked so many hours, can still surprise us.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The future of the galaxy has never been in safer hands.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Propped up by strong material, every member of the Star Wars: The Last Jedi cast delivers performances worthy of the iconic franchise, but deserving special mention is Mark Hamill.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It certainly captures the sense of awe and imagination of what we love best about that universe. While it's not entirely without faults, it is entirely entertaining.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars has been with us for four decades now, telling that same essential story in a format that's overwhelming and engulfing. With wit, skill, and love, The Last Jedi takes up the torch and carries it for a new generation.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: By breaking down some of the old mythology, [Rian] Johnson has staked out new territory. For the first time in a long time, a "Star Wars" film feels forward-moving.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi works on several levels, but most importantly it's a rip-roaring good time. That's what Star Wars fans want the most, and that's what they get with this dynamite installment.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is the perfect antidote to the year that is 2017 and introduces the tonic for what we need to enter 2018: hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Sure, The Last Jedi can occasionally be too goofy or free-roaming for its own good, but it's an impossible film to sit in front of and not have a good time.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Time and again, [Rian] Johnson finds a cinematic grammar that feels new to Star Wars; big close-ups (tender touching hands), top shots, elegant camera tracks and pulling out in-world sound, leaving just music and image.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is funny, it's emotional, it's fast-paced and it has a good story to tell.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: ... The Last Jedi challenges itself with moments that, if mishandled, could easily have tainted beloved Star Wars moments in the same way that many people feel the prequel trilogy did. Instead, it navigates those narrative rapids with aplomb.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Rian] Johnson's ability to deliver a fresh and engaging riff on this beast of an enterprise suggests that not every free-spirited storyteller can be corrupted by Hollywood's dark side, and some may even give it a new hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Taken as a whole, this eighth episode of the franchise will be porgnip for the faithful, though the answer to one of its Big Questions seems disappointing, and generously entertaining for the rest of us.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is the best Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back, and is awful close to being its equal.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: You don't see many sci-fi action extravaganzas that are about late middle-aged disappointment, about wondering what it's all about and whether any of it was worth it. It's this element that gives "The Last Jedi" an extra something ...

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A nuanced, touching, humorous adventure, laced with thrilling space battles and some jaw-dropping visuals.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Johnson and Abrams movies live dutifully in the universe of the original George Lucas trilogy - after the Phantom Menace trilogy debacle, it's what fans claim they wanted.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi mounts some genuinely startling narrative twists and feints, while charting an onward course for the franchise that has you itching to discover what comes next.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Force is, to me, still silly Star Wars mumbo jumbo, but Johnson finds a way to underscore it with humanity, with a classical Greek rumble of true pathos

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi, unlike its predecessor, has the freedom to be daring, and perhaps the most thrilling thing about it-and there are many, many thrilling things-is how abundantly it takes advantage of that freedom.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I lost count of the jaw-dropping moments The Last Jedi presents, and it's a movie I can't wait to revisit.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi makes for an inventive nail-biter of a chapter in the franchise's long run.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Everything is respected, but nothing is sacred. It's a sweeping gut-punch. How it deals with our own hopes and dreams for these characters, and how deep it cuts into existential concerns that drive us all - its effects will run around in the mind.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A fresh visual style makes this middle "Star Wars" a welcome addition to the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: No matter how many exotic creatures & internecine struggles that galaxy far away may accommodate, it is a remarkably closed system, reechoing the same themes across the ages, & preferring regression & eternal return to anything like real progress.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Every new Star Wars movie since Disney bought Lucasfilm has been heralded as the first worthy successor to the Original Trilogy, but with The Last Jedi it's finally true.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I really enjoyed spunky, relatable Rose, and I held my breath every time she raced into danger

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi, written and directed by the gifted indie auteur Rian Johnson, nails the balance of novelty and nostalgia in much more satisfying fashion.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: No one could mistake The Last Jedi for an outstanding contribution to cinema, or even to escapism, but it has its attractions.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [Director Rian Johnson] doesn't radically reinvent Star Wars... But he does dig into the impulses behind the new trilogy's younger characters, cracking them open and examining their psychology in a way Star Wars rarely has.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is grand powerful entertainment, and one of the finest films in the Star Wars Saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is the quintessential Star Wars movie. It embraces everything in the franchise that came before while taking big risks to push the story into new and unexpected places.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is an emotional ride all right, an incident-packed epic that introduces new characters, reacquaints us with old friends, answers some questions and raises some more.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Watching The Last Jedi is a conversation with your younger self.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi is a very satisfying entry into the Star Wars Saga with some fantastic, jaw-dropping moments.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: That's not to say Star Wars: The Last Jedi will go down in history as a better movie than the franchise's gold standard, The Empire Strikes Back, but director Rian Johnson has pulled off a complete rejuvenation of the saga.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: 'The Last Jedi' is not a great movie because it's a 'Star Wars' film. It reasserts 'Star Wars' as a top-tier blockbuster franchise by being a great movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Writer/director Rian Johnson's entry into the Star Wars canon is rebelliously bold at times and full of rousing surprises, which make up for a few lulls in the lengthy two-and-a-half-hour run time.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A more complicated visit to a galaxy far far away, one that manages to be a great stand-alone adventure in its own right.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi provides a resoundingly positive answer to an old smuggler's long-ago query: "Let's see what this piece of junk can do."

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is the greatest Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: [The film] not only delivers everything fans could want from the sequel but also gives them a whole load of other stuff they never knew they wanted into the bargain.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Falls right behind Empire Strikes Back and maybe the original film in providing the thrills and the heartbreak, the heroism and villainy, and the romance and betrayal that makes these films such a treat.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Optimistically, The Last Jedi leaves plenty of intriguing possibilities for the climactic installment. But there's also the kind of room for improvement that remind us when it comes to Star Wars, such hopes -- new or otherwise -- spring eternal.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: More than anyone else on screen, Driver seems to know exactly how to pitch his character. He is magnetic in his scenes, and his sequences sing with (space) operatic melodrama that, for all its showiness, is absolutely correct for the piece.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: A stellar entry that owes much to George Lucas' original films while finding a signature vibe of its own and unleashing a few welcome twists.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: For those hoping that there may have been a substantial uptick in quality between J.J. Abrams's The Force Awakens and Rian Johnson's The Last Jedi-in much the same way that The Empire Strikes Back improved on Star Wars-you may need a new hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is striking, stunning, visually hypnotizing, thrilling - everything "epic" about the famed franchise rolled into a tremendously overcharged start to Rian Johnson's Star Wars career.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi is weird, wild, emotional, and fantastic.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson is to be lauded for not locking himself into a retelling of the same old story. While there is plenty of familiarity -- this franchise basically demands it -- he isn't afraid to go in new directions.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: One of the strongest aspects of The Last Jedi is its writing. Written and directed by Rian Johnson, he shakes the foundations of The Force and puts everything we think we know to the test.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: "I laughed. I cried. I screamed and cheered so much that my throat went raw, and I left the theater on a high of exhilaration."

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It is a satisfying, at times transporting entertainment. Remarkably, it has visual wit and a human touch, no small achievement for a seemingly indestructible machine that revved up 40 years ago and shows no signs of sputtering out (ever).

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Loaded with action and satisfying in the ways its loyal audience wants it to be ... generally pleasing even as it sometimes strains to find useful and/or interesting things for some of its characters to do.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is the first Star Wars movie made by an artist instead of a craftsman, and it leaves us on the verge of something new. I'm very, very excited to see what that might be.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Still, this is no mere placeholder of a story. Huge, important things happen to characters secondary and primary. Surprises big and small abound.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: I'm so thrilled that I'm able to say that Star Wars: The Last Jedi made my heart soar and filled me with happiness. I'm heartened to say that it did our Carrie proud.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson has crafted such a powerful, screaming geekgasm of a movie.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi gives you an explosive sugar rush of spectacle. It's a film that buzzes with belief in itself and its own mythic universe - a euphoric certainty that I think no other movie franchise has.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The most intelligent film in the franchise by several light years, The Last Jedi can be seen as the space-opera equivalent of Clint Eastwood's revisionist western, Unforgiven.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The miracle of Star Wars: The Last Jedi is its rejection of series formality. Writer/director Rian Johnson manages to honor mythology while also having fun disrupting it.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: It may sound like a backhanded compliment, but with so much on the line, Johnson deserves credit for not messing things up.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Put simply, The Last Jedi is lodged several parsecs up its own black hole.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The Last Jedi goes big on identity, confusion and loss as [Rian] Johnson puts characters through the existential wringer like no Star Wars director before him

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson's Episode VIII is a true space opera-a masterful blend of humor, fun, and pathos that bares the souls of its characters and pushes the franchise to new heights.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: The best Star Wars since The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson has made something that isn't just a worthy addition to one of the most fan obsessed franchises ever, but is also a powerful standalone story.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: No one can say that Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a previous entry in a different skin as Rian Johnson has crafted an installment that largely defies saga standard narrative structure and tone

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: No romance, little pathos and lacks a single heartfelt punch-in-the-gut moment.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson has created a movie that is both quintessentially Star Wars and richer than anything that has come before.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: For all its strengths, The Last Jedi is a very manic film, fueled by excellent ideas that could have been parsed out in smarter ways.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: This is the longest movie in the franchise. It just doesn't feel that way. I haven't been this into a Star Wars picture since the Empire struck back in The Empire Strikes Back.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rolling up with the kind of intergalactic swagger that gives us a cosmically infuriating phone prank within the first five minutes, Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a work of supreme confidence: witty, wild and free to roam unexplored territory.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson has made a film that will delight and divide fans in equal measure. It is a bold and brilliant new step for the saga, moments of inspired silliness, pure heartbreak and thrilling action.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: 'The Last Jedi' is phenomenal! Bold, compelling and unexpected, it's also the most emotional entry of the saga

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: You may or may not be surprised to learn I do not automatically swoon every time I hear the words 'Star Wars'. But, I'll be damned if I didn't feel a distinctive shiver down my spine watching The Last Jedi.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Johnson sticks with the Star Wars house style and seems pleased to have the opportunity to inspire children with this story of overcoming inner conflict to become one's best self, the key ingredient being hope.

Movie: STAR WARS: THE LAST JEDI
Critic Review: Rian Johnson has made the best directed episode in the saga, one that will have deep emotional resonances for fans of this space opera.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: There are only so many ways to photograph black starry space and the under-bellies of spaceships, and the films that got there first used them all up.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: What you see is what you respond to, and what you see is a unique cultural phenomenon, and a film that for all its visual splendors falls well short of its aspirations.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Not so much a movie as it is a sort of giant display case ...

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Merely a weak, inapt Star Trek movie, not a completely awful one.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: The Enterprise's first feature, with smarts outdoing guns.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Star Trek's freshman big screen effort was crippled by a plodding pace and a somber tone.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: More of an event than a movie...more flash than content.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Nothing but a long day's journey into ennui.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: If the endless interstellar vistas of 2001: A Space Odyssey tested your patience, Star Trek: The Motion Picture will make you cry like a little star child.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: a little too boring

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: As an exploration of the loneliness of a unique machine consciousness, great! As an exciting SF experience, maybe not.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: The expensive effects (under supervision of Douglas Trumbull) are the secret of this film, and the amazing wizardry throughout would appear to justify the whopping budget.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Director Robert Wise has no feeling for Trek's pop insouciance, and the movie unfolds ponderously.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: This 1979 movie adaptation of the cult TV series is blandness raised to an epic scale.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: For non-addicts, the smart plot and effects go some way towards compensating for the plastic characters and costumes.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: The long, majestic scene in which Scotty (James Doohan) takes Kirk in a shuttle toward the refurbished Enterprise is still breathtaking.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: [It's] like attending your high-school class's 10th reunion at Caesar's Palace. Most of the faces are familiar, but the décor has little relationship to anything you've ever seen before.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Often unfairly maligned because it's slow and contemplative, but has some real ideas behind it.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Ponderously long, yes; but it was and still is a true movie event.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Star Trek-The Motion Picture is a smart sc-fi thriller whose fascinating characters and thought-provoking plot are emphasized more than special effects.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: You've heard the about the curse of the odd-numbered Star Trek films. It REALLY applies to this one.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: The result is intriguing as far as the sci-fi genre goes, but not exactly something I'd consider to be Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: An inventive and thoughtful science fiction movie, even if it is not entirely in keeping with either the television show that preceded it or the movies that would follow it.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: The rule with Star Trek films is even-numbered films are good, odd-numbered are bad -- and the first film in the series is no exception.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Nothing in this first Trek film moves above a glacial speed.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: Star Trek - The Motion Picture: Director's Edition is no 2001 (its obvious inspiration -- a fact that is more evident here than ever before), but it represents thought-provoking, well constructed science fiction.

Movie: STAR TREK: THE MOTION PICTURE
Critic Review: So okay, perhaps the plot is somewhat substandard but the glorious special effects thrown up by director Robert Wise ... and a no doubt expert team of special effects craftsmen actually makes this one well worth seeing.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: A brisk, handsomely designed film in which its hardware, sturdy as it is, never overwhelms its humanity.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Star Trek II manages to be both pensive and action-packed.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: It was Star Trek II that put the franchise on the right track as the spirit of Gene Roddenberry's 60s television series was harnessed to spectacular effect.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: This is hands-down the best Trek flick made so far.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Leonard Nimoy has rarely been so moving.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The merely curious are warned. If Star Trek: The Motion Picture showed little of the Enterprise of the culty TV series, this sequel is at times a flat-out Khan-job.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: This isn't great "for a Star Trek movie", it's one of the best sci-fi adventure films of the post-Star Wars era.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Meyer does a superb job of bringing Montalban's sinister yet charming character back into the fold...

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: "To boldly go" never went quite so boldly as it did here.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Thrilling, philosophical installment of popular space saga.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: There is something comfortable, even old-shoeish, about the new film, a sense, appropriate to its theme of coming to terms with middle age, that all aboard are pleasurably rediscovering their best selves.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: If this is the supposed high point for the Star Trek movie series, it's still a low point for sci-fi.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: khaaaaan!

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: It's not Shakespeare, but it's certainly fun.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Star Trek II is a very satisfying space adventure, closer in spirit and format to the popular TV series than to its big-budget predecessor.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: This is one of the most popular in the series, thanks to a high action quotient (including a tensely staged space battle), a suitably campy turn by Montalban, and the shock value of Spock's 'death.'

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: If only director Nicholas Meyer had grasped the implications of his tale more fully and enthusiastically, this might have become a classic piece of cornball SF poetry, but as it stands the tepid acting and one-set claustrophobia take a heavy toll.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Keep on Trekkin' ... The Star Trek TV series boldly went where none of its movie versions have gone before or since in Meyer's exceedingly space-worthy sequel.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The net effect, between embarrassed guffaws, is incredulity: a movie at once post-TV and pre-DW Griffith.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Many fans consider this the best of the series, and I like it very much.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: There's got to be some moral in the fact that the Star Trek movie with the smallest budget (by far) and fewest resources is still the dominant favorite...

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Awesome Star Trek flick!

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: What movie would be complete without an incredible villain? In Khan, Ricardo Montalban created a villain of legendary proportions.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Still the best "Trek" film. KHAN!!!!

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Still the best of all 'Trek' flicks.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Although I liked the special effects in the first movie, they were probably not the point; fans of the TV series wanted to see their favorite characters again, and Trek II understood that desire and acted on it.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: probably the best-ever trek movie

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan works as both a science fiction adventure story and as a thematically rich drama.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Ricardo Montalban plays the badass Khan in one of the most commanding performances of his career.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Has everything you could ask for in a good sci?fi action-adventure: well-drawn heroes, a terrific villain, exciting outer-space showdowns… and a touch of reflective depth.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Here comes a sequel that's worth its salt. The second Star Trek movie is swift, droll and adventurous, not to mention appealingly gadget-happy. It's everything the first one should have been and wasn't.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Arguably the best of the Star Trek movies.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan is a movie that transcends it's genre, it's format, it's fan base to really get inside the hearts and heads of people across all barriers the world over. This is the way to make Star Trek movies RIGHT.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The best of the Star Trek film series, a gloriously operatic revenge tale full of sound and fury, violence and vengeance, humor and empathy.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Masterful... classic.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Khaaaaaaaaaaaaaan!

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: This movie feels like an extended episode of the television series, and is a success because of it.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The film plays on the TV series' perceived strengths; strong character interaction, a credible science fiction future, and intelligent plotting.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The one thing that continues to stand out is the big emotional scene that floods the waterworks of every Trek fan in the audience.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Star Trek II added hefty doses of action, adventure, and suspense, injecting life into a concept that had been left moribund by its first big-screen feature.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: Talky and sometimes tedious.

Movie: STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Critic Review: The plot is a tad stronger and the characters not overshadowed by spectacular special effects (like in the first film).

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: This "Star Trek," the liveliest and most likable of the three, will satisfy hard-core Trekkies and win more than a few new recruits to their ranks.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: "Star Trek III" has a genuine spirituality, and, at its end, you may be surprised, especially if you're not really a Trekkie, to realize how moved you've been.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: Not many Trekkies would list The Search for Spock as their first viewing choice, but it rarely lets you down.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: Almost certainly the best of the "bad" Star Trek films... and for the first 30 or 40 minutes, it's not really even bad, to speak of.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: One of the best of the series.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: 'Star Trek III' takes nearly forty minutes, much of which is filled with silly, mystical exposition about the current state of Spock's soul, before things start moving. The last twenty minutes are equally slow, but the stuff in between is quite enjoyable.

Movie: STAR TREK III - THE SEARCH FOR SPOCK
Critic Review: Familiarity breeds contempt since this is not really a notable entry in the Star Trek series.

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME
Critic Review: Allows the characters and relationships shine, but whales?

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK IV - THE VOYAGE HOME

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER

Movie: STAR TREK V - THE FINAL FRONTIER
Critic Review: I liked what it seemed to me the film had said.

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY
Critic Review: The original cast go out with a bang.

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY
Critic Review: Easily the best made, most intelligent film of the entire Trek series.

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY
Critic Review: One of the dullest films of the sextet thus far.

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY
Critic Review: Like its even-numbered predecessors, Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country is fast-paced and entertaining.

Movie: STAR TREK VI - THE UNDISCOVERED COUNTRY
Critic Review: Not the best of the series, but it is entertaining

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: The first big-screen adventure for the Star Trek: The Next Generation cast...

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: Too many senten-tious insights and lame jokes have been grafted on to the basic yarn.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: It's nice to see Kirk one last time.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: At least the special effects and outer space vistas are more handsome than usual.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: The series' dullest instalment.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Critic Review: This film is a triumph of style over substance.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS
Critic Review: This journey is one bumpy ride.

Movie: STAR TREK GENERATIONS

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It does a good job of serving up elements that will please the fans of the show, but it does not quite stand on its own as a memorable motion picture event.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT

Critic Review: This makes little concession to non-initiates.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Among the two or three best of the Star Trek films.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It robustly apes James Cameron's Aliens, even down to the head villain, played with kinky boo-hiss relish by Alice Krige, who appears to be channeling equal parts Cameron's Alien Queen and Marlene Dietrich.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: This film is going to have lots of return viewers and will be one of the more successful of the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The best of the Next Generation entries.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Compared to episodes before and those that followed, this eighth installment of the unkillable series is surprisingly watchable.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The series now lacks all of its original stars and much of its earlier determination. It has morphed into something less innocent and more derivative than it used to be, something the noncultist is ever less likely to enjoy.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: One of the better chapters in the long history of this prosperous franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: With its fascinating storyline and its adroit insights into human history, identity, and sexuality Star Trek: First Contact is a winner.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Nothing like a good villain to energize the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The excitement comes from Frakes's direction.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: A nicely constructed science-fiction film, with a simple premise, a charismatic villain and a good back-story to enhance the action.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: First Contact is often great fun and is never less than watchable; it will positively delight legions of Trek fans.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: This is one of the best Star Treks ever.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Focusing more on action sequences than characterisation, the breakneck pace gives an unsatisfying result.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Blessed with clever plot devices and a villainous horde that makes the once-dread Klingons seem like a race of Barneys, First Contact does everything you'd want a Star Trek film to do, and it does it with cheerfulness and style

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: One of the best so far in what seems to be a never-ending science fiction saga.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Following in the wake of a trio of disappointing features, First Contact proves to be the most entertaining Star Trek in more than a decade.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Star Trek: First Contact is one of the best of the eight Star Trek films: Certainly the best in its technical credits, and among the best in the ingenuity of its plot.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: A thoroughly enjoyable visit with the crew of TV's Star Trek: The Next Generation.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It will engage you.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It's a great movie, and a great story.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: One of the better entries in the Trek movie series, thanks to the most memorable villains from the Next Generation television series: the Borg

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: If you don't already know and enjoy Star Trek, this is nothing more than another passable science fiction film. If you are a fan of The Next Generation, then you'll enjoy this one.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Enough classic moments to keep fans happy.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: First Contact manages to rev some additional life into the series.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It is enjoyable. It is a must-see for Star Trek fans. But it is not cohesive enough to be a good movie.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: A good popcorn movie.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Even if you don't count yourself as trekkie you should see it.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The first stretch and the home stretch are so filled with visual interest and, more importantly, with the patented Star Trek philosophical and humorous tidbits that fans will gladly suffer the dull Borg patch for the pleasure of the rest.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The film feels soulless and hollow, despite best intentions to the contrary.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: Deftly combining parts of Alien, Moby Dick and Close Encounters of the Third Kind, First Contact starts quickly and doesn't let up.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: While First Contact espouses the usual lofty Trek ideals, it never forgets to factor in the fun. As the Borg likes to say, resistance is futile -- and also unnecessary.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: This is a film that all the millions of Star Trek fans will treasure as one of the best in the now eight-film history of this hopeful future myth.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The most exciting entry in the Trek franchise since the The Wrath Of Khan.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: For non-Trekkers, this is a great, free-standing special-effects adventure with much more fleshy characters than your average sci-fi yarn. Definitely a good ride. But there are also plenty of nods to Star Trek aficionados.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The franchise needs Patrick Stewart. Far and away the best actor ever to don a Starfleet uniform, Stewart is the standard bearer for a series which has the opportunity to thrive as long as stories can be built around Captain Jean-Luc Picard.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: It has the melodrama of other episodes of the films but fewer absurdities this time around.

Movie: STAR TREK: FIRST CONTACT
Critic Review: The story is typical sci-fi fantasy, but the conviction of the cast--most notably the always-phenomenal Stewart--makes you believe and care.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The problem with Insurrection [isn't] that it's like a two-part episode. The problem is that it's like a one-part episode that was more than doubled in length without having nearly enough drama.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Like a long episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Feels like an overly long, slightly dull episode from the series.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: ...the lightest and most traditional of the movies, for good or bad.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: It's like one of those not-quite-favorite episodes from the series that you might enjoy watching again if it happens to air during a marathon, but it comes nowhere near achieving the best that Star Trek can do..."

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: It's back to boring basics for the Gene Roddenberry franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The extravagant makeup and special effects are actually unobtrusive because they're demanded by the pleasantly formulaic story, whose conflicts--and broad, innocuous political allegory -- justify the heartwarming resolution.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: It's an interesting story, more accessible to non-Trekkers than previous entries.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Strikes a deft balance of predictable heroics and quirky humor.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Genial, well-crafted tribute to the moral values Gene Roddenberry instilled in his sci-fi series, that suffers from a recurring flaw in the franchise, a lack of real threat and danger.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Despite the usual strained stabs at topical social significance, Frakes maintains a brisk pace, staging the battle scenes with panache and undercutting the absurd techno gibberish with crass but leavening humour.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Most of the television episodes have been smarter.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: This is really just a pretty good episode of the series, which is not really a bad thing.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Not one of the most successful of the "Star Trek" films, it's always nice to see the cast reunite.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: This is a good deal more than just another sci-fi movie.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The plot feels like something dug out of an old pile of Next Generation scripts, with a fuzzy focus on the wonderment of newfound youth

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Nothing more than a glorified episode.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: There are some nice moments early on.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Stewart looks great as usual and is impeccable in his familiar role, but most of the other principals were seriously underused.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Fun for most folks, heaven for Trekkers.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: A respectable and enjoyable, though hardly ground-breaking, adventure.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: More of the the same-old -same-old.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: An admirable mix of ethics, drama, humor, and outer space dogfights.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Insurrection doesn't quite gain the mantle of 'Worst Star Trek Film' from Star Trek V -- but it gets a little too close for comfort.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: This should be review enough for most Trekkers: It's the better of the odd-numbered movies, but it is definitely an odd-numbered movie.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The latest and ninth installment in that line, Star Trek: Insurrection, lacks the adrenalized oomph of its predecessor, but no adventure of the Starship Enterprise is without its gee-whiz affability.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: One of the weaker entries in the series.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: An appealing millennial throwback to the hippie dream that is part and parcel of Star Trek's utopian ethos.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: In two outings as director, Jonathan Frakes has proven that he understands what makes Star Trek work on the big screen.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The story has enough plot switchbacks, space battles and gizmo wizardry to ensure that most viewers won't forget the film until at least the next morning.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Inert and unconvincing.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Insurrection offers endless pleasure and inside jokes for the hardcore fans, but it's less urgent than First Contact, the dynamic last installment of the series.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: An acceptable movie to Trek fans, if disappointing.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: A pretty decent movie that even non-Trekkies would probably enjoy.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Lurches clumsily between drama, hammy comedy, and moral lecturing

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Like all recipes with too much of this and too little of that, this movie isn't so much bad, as it's just weak in places.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Doesn't exactly boldly go where no one has gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: I saw more creativity and pizzazz in the two-minute Star Wars trailer than in the 103 minutes of Star Trek: Insurrection that followed.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Star Trek: Insurrection isn't painful to sit through, but it adds nothing to the Star Trek mythos, and overall is a complete waste of time.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: High-minded and shallow.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: You don't need to be a Trekkie to enjoy the trip, as long as you're young enough at heart to enjoy adventure wherever you find it.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The quirkiest Trek yet, Insurrection is breezy, low- key and often humorous.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Taken as a whole the movie is fun even if it does contain several long, dull passages.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: A mediocre entry into the series.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The only thing I hate more than a bad movie is a movie I can't follow.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The plot just leaves too many questions unanswered in the end.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: A muddled, gimpy mess, filled with the worst sort of Trek cliches and ill-timed humorous outbursts. On top of that, the film might as well have been edited by Mr. Scott in the midst of a Romulan ale bender.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: If Merchant-Ivory produced a 'Star Trek' film, this would be it.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Insurrection isn't nearly as good as First Contact. But is a far cry from the first of the Next Generation movie adventure, Generations.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: a sad passing for a once-pioneering series

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Another extended episode played out with a decided lack of conviction, with nothing ever really at stake, and lazy humor that's aimed strictly at the disciples.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: What starts out as a stroll through an idyllic Whole Earth Catalog-style communal existence resolves into a tightly knit sci-fi action adventure, packed with the verities that generations of Trekkies admire and expect.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: You can only play a piano so many times before it finally goes out of tune.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: When Star Trek starts to resemble Battlestar Galactica and Babylon 5, something is amiss.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The film lost points for executing the much-vaunted Riker manuever using a bad Microsoft force feedback joystick.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: An enjoyable movie, employing the basics that should endear it to most Trekkers.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: There are other good reasons to see this particular film, including some sharply-staged action sequences and plenty of belly laughs.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: Trekkers will eat that stuff up; others will be looking elsewhere for something engaging, which cannot be found in the by-the-numbers story or the incredibly boring villain.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: [Combines the] idealism, action-adventure, and the requisite special effects with some of the gentle humor and romance that characterized the original television series.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: They probably should have completely thrown the script out. That way, they could have come up with a story that at least had a sign of intelligence and freshness.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: It just is not sufficiently involving.

Movie: STAR TREK: INSURRECTION
Critic Review: The movie's single best feature is its villain Ru'afo, played with scornful malevolence by F. Murray Abraham; he can take his place alongside Alice Krige's Borg Queen in 'First Contact' and Ricardo Montalban's Khan as a memorably creepy nemesis.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Only the most die-hard Trekkies will like this one. The good news is the tagline for Star Trek: Nemesis -' "A Generation's Final Journey Begins." ... And ends?

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's not bad, really. It is also the tenth Star Trek movie, which means an awful lot of celluloid featuring grown men wearing children's stretchy pyjamas and standing behind plasterboard consoles looking purposeful.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Feels, unmistakably, like Paramount and everybody involved was trying to get through it as fast as possible, dumping the series in an alley to let the rats gnaw at the body.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Lots of sci-fi action mixed in with messages about peace.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: ...fun stuff, unoriginal or not.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's a shame The Next Generation crew went out on this flat note.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The geek exodus from Star Trek will continue with this middling movie, a cheapo space battle that has all the cool allure of a disco-dancing Dad.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Without an intriguing adversary for Capt. Jean-Luc Picard and crew, it's all for naught.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Even though the special effects are as well executed as ever, the story doesn't excite or even allow us to really believe the premise.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Reasonably entertaining if utterly familiar.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: A thinly plotted, anonymously directed film.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Disappointing.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The outcome is as professionally crafted as ever, but the material feels learnt by rote.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Tinkers around with an intriguing premise but with little creative facility for dialogue or structure...[splits] the difference between fans and neophytes, impressing neither.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: If you're a fan you'll be satisfied, if not ecstatic, but it's doubtful that this movie will win any new converts.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: A movie that blandly goes where too many Star Trek pictures have gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: 'Nemesis'? Try 'NUMBesis,' and fight nodding off during the first half.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: ... The science fiction franchise that has been an institution since ... the late 1960s may be starting to show its age

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: How much more of this can we take? Nemesis is a decent film, and Trek fans will love it. But enough is enough!

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Nothing new.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It doesn't deliver anything new to the series, and even fans might find parts distinctly slow, but it finally hits most of the right buttons.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Well, there goes the theory about the even-numbered ones all being good.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: There is a point in Star Trek: Nemesis that I could not help but start to think of The Muppet Movie.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Somewhere towards the end of the movie, exhaustion set in.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Light years/ several warp speeds/ levels and levels of dilithium crystals better than the pitiful Insurrection. Which isn't to say that it's the equal of some of its predecessors.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Boring, dark, gooey, with plenty of earnest, furrowed brows all around.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Directed Baird is a new to the series, and he has done a courageous job at sending this crew to their last voyage in space.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: We are strictly going through the motions here folks

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: To Blandly Go Where We Went 8 Movies Ago . . .

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: If this is The Next Generation's final voyage, then it goes somewhat gently into that good night rather than raging against the dying of the light. Should a final adventure give them the justice they deserve? Like Picard, I say 'Make it so!'

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: For me, this flight aboard the Enterprise was a bit of a letdown.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's been almost 10 years since "Star Trek: The Next Generation" ended in 1994, but you'd never know it by watching the latest film in the science fiction franchise, "Star Trek: Nemesis."

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Hardy's pout and baldie glare are high-quality stage-trained British Hollywood fiendishness and, like the Borg Queen, he seems to have taken his fashion tips from Clive Barker's Cenobites.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: ...the Federation should consider their legacy before embarking on another tired journey...Alas, it's time for the filmmakers to stay home and avoid the exhaustive trappings of being their own worse enemy...ah, in this case...nemesis!

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Instead of contriving a climactic hero's death for the beloved-major- character-who-shall- remain-nameless, why not invite some genuine spontaneity into the film by having the evil aliens' laser guns actually hit something for once?

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Experimental science bumps up against science fiction as the controversy swirling around genetic cloning is magnified in outer space.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: ... it may be time for Paramount to more on to other Star Trek movie ideas or just more on together... enjoy it for what it is: one more time to see a beloved crew defeat evil in space.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This will test fan loyalty to destruction

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: While there's nothing to fault in the performances or even the storyline, it's forgettable the moment the credits roll.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: A sci-fi snoozer.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Sorry, Captain, our dilithium crystals are run down completely. The Star Trek franchise is dead in the water!

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Feels like a cold old man going through the motions.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: 'How many more voyages can this limping but dearly-loved franchise survive?'

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: A cheapo space battle that has all the cool allure of a disco-dancing Dad.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This tenth feature is a big deal, indeed -- at least the third-best, and maybe even a notch above the previous runner-up, Nicholas Meyer's Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: 35 years of saving the universe takes its toll on the imagination, and this film, unfortunately, is stuck paying the check.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: As lo-fi as the special effects are, the folks who cobbled Nemesis together indulge the force of humanity over hardware in a way that George Lucas has long forgotten.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It simply doesn't have the sharp inventiveness and insight we usually associate with the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: definitely something different, even if it doesn't quite live up to the filmmakers' obviously grandiose ideas

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Sure, it's more of the same, but as the film proves, that's not always a bad thing.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The dialogue is inane, the plot insipid, and with the exception of some nifty special effects at the very beginning, this has nothing whatsoever to recommend it.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's not the groundbreaking movie it needed to be to infuse the series with renewed life.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Not only is it talky, but the talk is repetitious, incoherent, and spoken in a soft whisper, as if the actors feared disturbing the audience in its restful slumbers.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: If you're not a fan, what you're most likely to experience are chintzy costumes, cheesy makeup, cute jokes, pages of indigestible dialogue and tepid action scenes bolstered by a lot of shaking the camera to make it appear that the Enterprise is suffering

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: I am a Star Trek fan, it's an even-numbered film, and sadly, it blew. I am so sad.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Star Trek: Nemesis is flat and uneventful.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Everything here feels like a rehash of what this series has been doing since 1979. There's no ambition, no attempt to take the franchise in a new direction.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: John Logan clones Enterprise skipper Jean-Luc Picard (Patrick Stewart), geek-relatable android Data (Brent Spiner), and -- less successfully -- 1982's Star Trek: The Wrath of Khan.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The Enterprise is losing speed.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Whatever the weaknesses, "Nemesis" deserves some credit for its universality. It can be enjoyed by anyone, whether the biggest "Trek" nerd, or a newcomer to the series.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: A movie that blandly goes where too many Star Trek pictures have gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: An obvious attempt to mix the high-drama of The Wrath of Khan with the mainstream appeal (read: box office) of Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home, and for the most part it succeeds.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Never escapes the franchise formula enough to make Warp Factor 9, and take flight as anything more than a superior two-part 'Next Generation' episode with improved effects.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This felt like the end, but was neither the best nor worst note to end on.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: John Logan's script hasn't enough invention or suspense even for an hour-long episode of the series, Stuart Baird's direction is leaden, and the look of the film is murky and dismal.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's doubtful that Nemesis will please everyone -- particularly the hardcore fans -- but for casual Trek viewers, this is a pretty good ride.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This 10th film in the series looks and feels tired.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It's all very convoluted this time out, and awfully silly to boot.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The action sequences in the film work well enough, but the film drags for about half an hour in the first half with an overlong expository interlude.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Star Trek: Nemesis stands alone as an engaging intergalactic thriller with a lot of spirit-and some rousing action scenes.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The old crew is around and good to see.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The ease that the Next Generation actors slip into their roles gives Nemesis a comfort zone that overcomes creaky dialogue and that fact that the biggest moments have been seen in earlier Trek movies.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Boasts explosive action and a decent story, but a slow start and a badly botched ending keep it from being remarkable.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: [Reaches] depths of laughable awfulness that can be appreciated, for their veritable badness as well as their campiness, only by True Fans.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Like going out with old school buddies: at first, you're thrilled to be with old friends again, but before too long, you realize that there just isn't anything new.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Clear proof that the series has long since surpassed its days of glory.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: Pap invested in undergraduate doubling subtexts and ridiculous stabs at existentialism reminding of the discovery of the wizard of God in the fifth Trek flick.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This is supposedly, 'a generation's final journey'; too bad it didn't slow down enough to prevent it from feeling more like a generation eagerly racing to the finish line.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: The latest adventure of "The Next Generation" crew is a rip-roaring space opera that, while containing some grand set pieces, is a bit uneven, failing to realize its full potential.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: It almost plays like Solaris, but with guns and jokes.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS
Critic Review: This is the fourth film to feature the Next Generation crew, and everyone is still off-track after the ideologically unsound, sparsely entertaining Insurrection.

Movie: STAR TREK - NEMESIS

Critic Review: A new fan of the series--and there are more that I would have expected--can enjoy STAR TREK, but a veteran "Trek" devotee will get a lot more out of it.

Critic Review: Abrams' whole approach to this revamped Star Trek: Be playful, be unpredictable, and full speed ahead.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's been thirty years since I last found myself at the movies, rooting for a black hole.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It is a hi-energy, optimistic work, but it gives the impression of being afraid to alienate its audience with too much nerdy information.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This movie wins. It manages to have reverence for its source material but also uses it as a jumping off point to make a 21st Century version of the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Lost and found planet mayhem in this reconceived excursion down intergalactic memory lane, as cocky spaced out Kirk locks horns with Bana's sulking skinhead in an unresolved cosmic anger management funk.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A splendid space saga so spellbinding, I won't complain about their resurrecting that infuriating, infinitive-splitting catchphrase, 'To boldly go where no one has gone before!'

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...a full-blooded and busy adventure, a promising restart.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Is the new Star Trek movie perfect? Absolutely not. But I went in an original Trek fan ... and came out feeling oddly elated, grateful for the things that worked and secure in the belief that the rough spots will work themselves out in the a

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Full of excitement, adventure and just plain fun. Everything old is new again!

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Great characters, nice comic touches, but the plot cries out for an intervention.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Somehow pulling off the trick of appealing to the wider mass audience with one foot in Star WARS, the most startling thing about this new TREK is how it avoids being AWFUL.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Barely competent. J.J. Abrams has a TV soul.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: What Christopher Nolan did for the Batman franchise, J.J. Abrams has done for Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With great effects, a strong story and equally strong cast, "Star Trek" is a journey worth taking...

Movie: STAR TREK
