Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is the best Star Trek movie, ever. Better, even, than the classic Start Trek II: The Wrath of Khan.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: [Director J.J.] Abrams kicks his film into warp drive and boldly goes where the Star Trek actually has gone before. Only better.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Good mix of special effects, an involving story, a good script, and fine ensemble acting.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With director J.J. Abrams on board, the newest movie in the series is not only action-packed but also filled with surprises.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Yes, the genie is back out of the bottle. Well acted, expertly edited, and brilliantly watchable even if not perfect. And above all, it doesn't suck.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The unpredictability of this alternate reality gives future screenwriters a free hand to go where no one has gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: a Luddite picture wary of the future and reliant on something so simple as being human to be the salvation of the human race.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's disheartening that Deforest Kelly, James Doohan, and series creator Gene Roddenberry won't be able to see their legacy "beam" back to life and continue at warp speed.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A gigantic bore for more than half its running time, but it eventually grows surprisingly involving, thanks mostly to its great cast.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Sacrilege alert! It may even be better than The Dark Knight.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams muscles aside Trek's ponderous aspects with a rip-roaring storyline and enough action to qualify as a galactic James Bond movie

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Trek fan or not, only a person who hates action movies entirely could hate Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...Elicits laughs, adventure, and refreshing, positive energy in a way series creator Gene Roddenberry intended.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The first Star Trek movie that feels fully realized. It's smart enough to be accessible to everyone, while retaining enough respect for the franchise's legacy to please diehard fans.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Faced with the task of acclimating new audiences to this venerably corny space opera, J.J. Abrams simultaneously executes a franchise reboot and nostalgia play.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek might annoy purists, but everyone else will be glad to see Spock and co. again.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Fun, but like most of the previous movies, it doesn't approach the quality of the best episodes of the original 'Star Trek' or 'Star Trek: The Next Generation.'

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The young cast is mostly callow and TV-bland and the special effects don't quite seem worth that hefty price tag, but overall this is a presentable addition to the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams has done the impossible: not only resurrected the 'Star Trek' franchise, a concept built on space-age idealism, but also re-imagined it for cynical 21st century moviegoers.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Possibly the best modernization of the series I could have imagined... Abrams manages to walk a thin line between pandering to the fans and reaching a new, modern audience.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: We didn't exactly need another Star Trek but it finds the perfect blend of action, drama and nostalgic comedy.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: What I do have a problem with is sacrificing plot for speed, for thinking that grand spectacle and a great sense of pop culture are all that you need to make a new journey with the crew of the Enterprise work.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Don't be surprised if you feel just like me when you leave the theater. I was ready and eager to see my newfound friends in their next space adventure.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A new Star Trek film so full of life, wit, smarts, thrills and sheer gratifying entertainment that it launches the mind on a stream of merry somersaults.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams' Star Trek strikes a beautiful balance, with enough allusions to Trek mythology to please longtime fans and enough 21st century verve to wow even those viewers who know nothing of Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With Star Trek Abrams honors the show's legacy without fossilizing its best qualities. Instead, he's whisked it off to a planet where numbing nostalgia can't kill it, and where the future is still something to look forward to.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The wit and youthful energy that's been infused into the new Star Trek should enable this venerable franchise to live longer and prosper more handsomely.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: In going back to tell the Enterprise story from the beginning, Star Trek presses collective emotional buttons people didn't even know they had. At its best, the effect is like seeing life panoramically, past and future, simultaneous and magnificent.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Just because a film is noisy, colorful and fast does not ipso facto mean that it is also a rollicking entertainment.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek goes back to the legend's roots with a boldness that brings a fatigued franchise back to life.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams has approached the source material with the right spirit of loving irreverence, and set the stage for what hopefully will be a rebirth of an enduring franchise. A five-year mission doesn't feel nearly long enough.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: You needn't know the secret handshakes or utter the Vulcan blessing "live long and prosper" to gain admission to, and enjoy, summer's first thrill ride.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Trust me when I say Star Trek is easily one of the best science fiction films of this decade

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The time-travel plotline not only fuels this exciting movie, but jump-starts the old franchise into new directions. ... It allows this Enterprise crew to boldly go where not even Star Trek has gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The greatest prequel ever told.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: In his daft, dizzy reinvention of a moribund franchise, Abrams has found a way to be referential without being reverential, to conjure nostalgia without being constrained by it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The movie has an easy-going, unlabored charm. Unlike the dreadful latter-day "Star Wars" pictures, this one honors the unflagging devotion of millions of fans.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This isn't just the most playful, surprising action movie in years. It's also the funniest. They're not going where no man has gone before. But the way they go there ... wow.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With a warp-speed 'Wow!', Abrams&Co. has taken a spent franchise and, unlike a heavy-handed plastic surgeon, has reinvigorated it without destroying the original look. Leonard Nimoy might want to see what they can do for him.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's this Star Trek's greatest stroke of genius to conceive of Kirk and Spock as two rebels looking for a cause...

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The overall impression is one of unbridled enthusiasm on the part of the film's makers, both for its predecessors and for the brave new universe Abrams and his crew are exploring.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Should please a wide cross-section of viewers.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Not Trek? The movie has gaping plotholes, a skirt-chasing Kirk, time travel, and a BS pseudo-scientific resolution to a life-threatening situation...it's totally Trek!

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's Star Trek, Jim, but not as we have known it. A masterclass in how to rebrand and relaunch a franchise. Sign us up for more alien girls, punch-ups, phasers, photons and misbehaving black holes.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J. J. Abrams's thriller Star Trek is the first tent-pole film that has made me sob with pure pleasure.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Fast-moving, funny, exciting warp-speed entertainment and, heaven help me, even quite moving - the kind of film that shows that, like it or not, commercial cinema can still deliver a sledgehammer punch. It sure didn't feel like a trek to me.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is a truly good, dare I say great movie. But I don't think it has a lot of re-watchabilty and not in the league of The Dark Knight".

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Don't worry this time around, our pop culture is in good hands.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is a grand success - perhaps a new populist benchmark in what to do with a flagging franchise, and a witty, light-on-its-feet prequel which makes instant toast of X-Men Origins: Wolverine. May it live long and prosper, by which we mean, sequels, soon

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek used to be smarter. But it was never this fast, fresh and exciting.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Funny, moving and fine escapist entertainment, the magnificent Star Trek is cranked up to Warp Factor 11 by the cast and crew. May the franchise live long and prosper under the guidance of J.J. Abrams.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is fresh, funny, exciting and - biggest surprise of all - emotionally engaging.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is impressive stuff. Abrams moves the plot at breathtaking speed, yet still has time to feature heroic acts from all the original show's key players.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A revamp everyone can get on board with, from die-hards to those who wouldn't be seen dead at a sci-fi convention. Buoyant, buffed and with the promise of even better to come, this is the freshest Trek in decades.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek bristles with energy and excitement, and you can practically sense the enthusiasm with which this film has been approached by everyone involved

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is such a rollicking adventure, it's truly enjoyable.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is the first great blockbuster of the year and is undoubtedly a bona fide masterpiece in the family genre.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is everything a summer blockbuster should be. Star Trek is a film that will delight fans and impress people who have usually steered clear of the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It must rank as the outstanding prequel of all time.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Overall, it makes for an entertaining, if uneven, couple of hours, although non-Trekkies may not find it the intergalactic go-see they'd hoped for.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek pulsates with adventure and thrills, infectious with its boyish enthusiasm to entertain and respectful enough to pay tribute to the cult series that came before it. See it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams has achieved what previous Star Trek directors and George Lucas's prequels failed to create - a gripping, action-packed, humorous slice of escapism.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek comes out with its high beams on, its pacing hyper, and its phasers set to "stoked." And it never hits the brakes.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: But idolaters need fear no iconoclasm and newcomers no exclusion. The start of a presumably new chapter in the franchise is marked by affectionate respect tempered with an eye for modern visual tastes.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: There will be plenty of takers for this Enterprise, I think, but they shouldn't count on seeing much that's new in the course of it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is everything that fans could have hoped for. It throbs with a dynamism that we haven't seen in the series for a very long time and creates a slice of expertly crafted science-fiction escapism.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...captures the spirit of the original series and makes watching these characters fun again.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Given Bana's baddie is about as threatening as a scatter cushion and the plot is arm-chewingly repetitive, what will appeal most to bemused non-fans is that while the Star Wars prequels disappeared up their own mythologies, Star Trek is a right giggle.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: You do get a sense, despite all the other attempts to re-do Star Trek, that this lot boldly go where no man has gone before, and that Abrams has reinvented the series without murdering everything that has gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: If you realise that it has one aim - to introduce an entirely new audience to the franchise - and go into the cinema knowing that, then you'll have a good time. Unlike like me: I sat there with my arms folded, tutting a lot.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Hugely enjoyable, wonderfully cast and genuinely thrilling blockbuster that, incredibly, gets everything right and will please both die-hard Trekkies and newcomers alike.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Fully inhabits the Trek universe while pushing well-known characters into all-new directions

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is the most enjoyable, spectacular, smart and yet brilliantly simple summer movie for an absolute age.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Set your phasers to stunning because Star Trek is every bit as thrilling as the hype would have you believe.

Movie: STAR TREK

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's like what Alan Moore said about Frank Miller's The Dark Knight Returns: 'Everything is exactly the same, except for the fact that it's all completely different.'

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Hell, you could know nothing about the words "Star Trek" and still find a lot to enjoy here

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Boldly go and revel in the awesomeness and nostalgia this action-packed prequel will elicit.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Here is the highest compliment Abrams and company could have hoped for: They leave Star Trek better than they found it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: What Abrams ... has done is pay tribute to the legacy of "Star Trek," while taking it in a direction that will surely re-energize and resurrect a moribund property

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Spectacularly entertaining -- fast-paced, glib, thrilling, and slickly produced. It's better than most summertime action romps even bother trying to be.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: All in all, the material is strong enough and exciting enough that not even Abrams' fumbling can entirely ruin it, and it's certainly better than the last two series entries.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is a different Star Trek. It's hipper. It's hotter. It's going to be the biggest movie of the summer, and no corny little one-liners will do it justice.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: For those who want a thrilling ride, Star Trek should do the trick. It has just enough old-school stuff to keep longtime fans intrigued, even if a bit disappointed.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Fascinating.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A meticulously calibrated blending of old and new.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Director J.J. Abrams reaches for the stars...and mostly succeeds in getting there

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: While it might be a little long and while Spock is disappointing, this is still an entertaining movie with fine performances by Pine, Pegg, Greenwood, and Urban.

Movie: STAR TREK

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Highly illogical but entertaining as hell.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: I loved the second and fourth Trek films, but this cosmically entertaining movie is the best the franchise has ever produced. Can't wait to see what Abrams does next with his new crew.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is premier summer entertainment.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The result is not a great film, but it is great fun.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Bravely vindicates its source material's essential underpinnings of friendship and honor. 'Get a life?' This is the redemption Trekkies have been living for.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams has raised the craft of rejuvenating a movie franchise to something like a fine art.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek does a remarkable job hitting all the right notes with die-hard Trekkies and engaging those who've never heard of a tribble. The bar for summer 2009 blockbusters is set very high.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Let's hope hardcore Trekkers can suck it up and embrace this new vision, because there's no doubt everyone else will.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This Trek is an exciting, constantly entertaining feature that helps kick off this year's summer movie season in spectacular fantasy.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Everything from the score, the slow motion effects to Abrams' ability to instantly draw you into this new universe quickly sets the tone for an engaging two-hour thrill ride.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Exciting, captivating and thrilling with eye-popping special effects. It's an exhilarating rush of adrenaline that will please Star Trek fans old and new.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: I can name exactly three and a half things "Star Trek" gets wrong -- and I can name about a thousand that Abrams and his cast and crew get absolutely, pitch-perfect, elegantly right.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's the kind of franchise opener that leaves you giddy for a sequel, stuffed with ideas about where to go from here. It's the kind of blockbuster that makes you happy movies exist.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams found the perfect, and perfectly science-fictional way, to do a reboot that no one can honestly bitch about, the perfect way to have his geek and his 'Bite me,' too.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Quinto is the one person here who may leave teen-aged viewers more perplexed than puffed up; he somehow rebukes the movie's whole obsession with backstory and immaturity by seeming riper and wiser than the charmless folly that is spun around him.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It is pleasant to report that though it's not perfect, the reconstituted Star Trek is successful enough for everyone to breathe a sigh of relief.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The new Star Trek arouses an instant affection that sometimes rises to ecstasy and never entirely wears out.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It boldly goes somewhere different and makes it hard to leave the film not hoping for a return voyage soon.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: And just think, they haven't gotten to the Klingons yet...

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The effects, direction and film score were so beautiful and mind blowing that it made a grown man cry. That grown man would be me.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Is this where the future of Trek lies, in exciting action scenes and fun comic relief supporting underwhelming stories and stale ideas?

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Even by the standards of its own predecessors, this Trek feels like it was made by a committee of logic-minded Vulcans (or franchise-protective studio executives) rather than a filmmaker with the singular personality of Nicholas Meyer.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With one film, J.J. Abrams has made Star Trek younger, flashier, sexier, funnier, and less intelligent, but more exhilarating than it has been in decades.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: JJ Abrams is a miracle worker. He has taken a script that is so bad and so dumb as to be almost a disaster and made a movie that's a lot of fun and actually quite good from it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A bright, shiny blast from a newly imagined past.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The aim here is to court a new generation of fans without alienating the true believers speaking Klingon in the box-office lines.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Take note, George Lucas: This is how it's done.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is really the story of how the Enterprise crew meets, hammers out its differences and becomes a team, and the telling is pure bliss.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: There are many satisfyingly sly flourishes in Roberto Orci and Alex Kurtzman's script.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: You couldn't ask for a less ponderous, more rollicking time.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams' cannily constructed prequel respects (for the most part) the rules of that world and, more importantly, retains the original Star Trek's spirit of optimism, curiosity, and humor.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This non-Trekkie thinks you'd have to look back almost as far as Raiders of the Lost Ark to find an adventure this consistently, thrillingly, joyfully fun.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Phasers set on "stunning."

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: When it comes to sheer spectacle, Star Trek, as re-imagined by J.J. Abrams, delivers.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A movie that, against all odds, has miraculously resurrected a wheezing but beloved franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Under the swoons of the orchestral dirge, you can hear J.J. Abrams stride onto the deck of the Enterprise and shout, "Welcome to my galaxy!"

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This, indeed, may not be your father's Star Trek, but I hope it won't kill the buzz if he likes it anyway.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The film is just another noisy space opera in which the humanity takes a back seat to the hardware, something that the real "Star Trek" managed to avoid at its peak moments.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams' redo isn't just a blast from the past. It's a blast.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's also a pleasure to report that, not only have Gene Roddenberry's ideas stood up pretty well over the decades, so have Spock's ears.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A film that should appeal to longtime Trekkies, sci-fi neophytes and pretty much anybody who likes a good action flick.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is a raft, a map and a reinvented story with a great deal of spunk

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: An enjoyably mindless thrill ride.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The summer movie season has barely begun, but already one thing is certain: It will have at least one indisputably great movie.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: An immensely satisfying origin story that, narratively, goes all the way back to James Tiberius Kirk's corn-fed and hotheaded Iowa youth before introducing, one by one, the characters we know -- before we knew them.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Abrams and crew have gone where no man has gone before: boldly creating a crowd friendly sensation that, even in this market of a-blockbuster-a-week, should live long enough and boy, will it prosper.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: In order to become a new Star Trek, facets of its old personality must inevitably be sacrificed, while modern flavor -- faster pace and a little sass -- is infused.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Perfectly paced, wonderfully cast, cleverly written, and masterfully designed -- summer movies don't get much better than Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The new Star Trek motion picture seeks to extend a lucrative brand with a young demographic. But it's a real movie -- breathlessly paced bordering on manic, but propulsively entertaining.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The much-anticipated movie reintroduces all the characters from the franchise's first iteration, but its most intense and rewarding focus is friendship between Kirk and Spock.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: For nearly its first hour, I felt I was witnessing Abrams hitting every beat just right, only to see him and his writers spend the final hour getting just about everything wrong.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...not only a fantastic summer tentpole film, it just happens to be better than each and every one of the most recent Best Picture Oscar nominees.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: I loved it so much I wanted to Vulcan mind meld with it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It aspires to be everything to everyone and it's as good as can be expected given those directives, but its prime directive is simple: have fun. It does and I did.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Unless you live in the weeds like me, obsessing over minutia that others never even see, Star Trek is going to be a jaw-dropping experience. The rest of us will just have to get over ourselves.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The story is constructed so we don't need to know what has come before. At the same time, the filmmakers don't want to alienate the long-termers, so they had to add something new to the canon of Trek lore.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Pulsates with a life and fire that the former series entries never quite equaled. So much is going on in each frame that one sits smiling for the duration, drinking in the images while yearning for a repeat viewing.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...even if you've NEVER seen "Star Trek" you'll be hooked

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams boldly takes the "Trek" franchise where it hasn't gone in a long time: to box office gold.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: An epic adventure that deftly captures the spirit of the original series, while succeeding utterly in charting a new course.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Sunny hothead cadet meets his Vulcan soulmate. Wisely, no bloated, buffoon pitchman has a cameo. J.J. Abrams put the budget on the screen.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's an exciting, stellar-yet-earthy blast that successfully blends the hip and the classic.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: With a crew like this, you can welcome the future.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The happy result is action-friendly, nerd-friendly, and fundamentally optimistic.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The Gene Roddenberry years, when stories might play with questions of science, ideals or philosophy, have been replaced by stories reduced to loud and colorful action.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Amazing sound, a ton of fury, signifying nothing... So densely orchestrated that the film never gives the audience a moment to breath it all in.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Fans will be thrilled, though not nearly as much as Paramount Pictures shareholders.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: As rousing as a Klingon war chant and more fun than an engine room full of tribbles.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Trek almost never stops being good, kinetic fun.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Writers Robert Orci and Alex Kurtzman manage to morph the new actors into the general outlines of the original crew, but even as they slip into the old character molds, they immediately start to break out of them.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The other summer tent poles have to stretch mighty high to reach the benchmark set by this soaring and explosive blockbuster. The action never tires in the amped-up Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Somehow this movie manages the delicate balancing act of incorporating both the humor and action of the original series, while simultaneously satiating hard-core geeks and fans who thought the original crew could never be succeeded.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: That jolt of energy may resuscitate the franchise; its breathing, however, feels shallow.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: For the first time in 15 years, Star Trek actually matters.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Summer officially hits warp speed.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Smart, epic and eye-popping.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is the perfect summer movie.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The naturalistic asides slung among our heroes are more than compensatory, establishing both a believable, well-oiled discipline and a collegial camaraderie.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It took decades of increasingly mediocre TV series and Data-dull movies to beat Star Trek to death. But J.J. Abrams brings it all back to basics.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A new creation, one that serves as a self-contained film and a launching pad for a continuation of the franchise, one that should live long and prosper.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This Star Trek sells cuteness, sentimentality and explosive F/X as if Starship Troopers, Minority Report, Mission to Mars or even Blade Runner or The Matrix (all visionary standard-setters) never happened.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Yes, it's a popcorn flick--and a first-rate one at that--but it also grants these figures a freshness they haven't possessed in a long time.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Trading on affections sustained over 40 years of popular culture, Star Trek does what a franchise reboot rarely does. It reminds us why we loved these characters in the first place.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Outrageously, unbelievably entertaining, and the most fun anyone has had at a movie in a long, long time.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The final frontier of space is once again the place to be.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A fast-paced, witty prequel, a top-flight modern adventure...that's not only an affectionate tribute to the original but a successful rebooting of the whole franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: As unlikely as it once seemed, it looks like the ol' Enterprise has a few more light-years left in it after all.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: While hard core Trekkies may have some problems with it, this long time classic Star Trek fan found this reboot fun, fresh & exciting.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A largely thrilling surprise, its blend of humor, romance and action so kinetically orchestrated that calling out its shortcomings feels like excessive carping.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's not perfect but it is great fun ... It's hard to imagine anyone resisting this new cast.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek should quench all your Trekker geek desires, but make no mistake, this is still very much the same Star Trek, just with a younger cast and a lot more money thrown at it.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This brilliant reninvention of the beloved sci-fi franchise boldly (and smartly) goes where no 'Star Trek' has ever gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: More than any Trek project in decades, this one conjures the camaraderie, the easy humor and most important the swagger we associate with headstrong Jim Kirk and his logical, pointy-eared pal.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's enough to move even a Star Wars fan to tears.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Thankfully, both diehard and casual observers of Gene Roddenberry's original 60's televised blueprint will be zapped with stimulating giddiness more effectively than an errant phaser gun gone wild.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's exciting, moving, hilarious, action-packed, sexy and suspenseful -- in short, exactly what big, fun summer popcorn movies are supposed to be and yet so rarely are.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A near-perfect template for what a summer thrill ride should be, Star Trek is great fun that doesn't forget its brain, heart or sense of humor.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Either you'll go with it or you won't. Regardless, based on Abrams' ambition and scope in rejuvenating the franchise, it's clear it still has plenty of room to live long and prosper.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The four-decade-old sci-fi franchise boldly goes back onto the big screen as a muscular, action-packed summer blockbuster.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The setup is complete; now it's time to see whether the implied potential of this first entry into a new series can be realized in its sequel.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Star Trek is destined to be remembered as one of 2009's biggest and best surprises, a gamble that beat both the house and those holding the cards to turn everyone into a winner.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A sublime space adventure that flies as confidently and triumphantly as Trek ever has before. It's not only a victorious series highlight, but perhaps one of the best pictures of the year...120 minutes of unrelenting goose bumps.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is a totally character driven film with five exceptionally-cast people.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: I think JJ Abrams walks the line gracefully between honoring the original series and introducing the pop culture movie masses to these characters.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: If you care about this universe (and I do, damn it), you won't sit passively through J.J. Abrams's restart Trek. You'll marvel at the smarts and wince at the senselessness. You'll nitpick it to death and thrill to it anyway.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It is fun, exciting and exuberantly entertaining.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The average Star Trek fan is fatter than a Mugatu. And I mean the kind of Mugatu that just ate a family of Mugatus. Hey, fella, is that your mouth or the Doomsday Machine?

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: ...director J.J. Abrams successfully establishes a new beginning for the Star Trek franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: You can feel the legacy in every scene. It just rocks.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: There is a good blend of character development and action in Star Trek which is why it will resonate so well with audiences.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: This is Star Trek designed for people who don't actually like Star Trek . . .

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A new mission worth taking, a spirited, energetic new beginning to a series long assumed dead.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's guaranteed to start a box office stampede.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Blasting onto the screen at warp speed and remaining there for two hours, the new and improved Star Trek will transport fans to sci-fi nirvana.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: JJ Abrams injects a gigantic dose of energy into this long-running franchise and brings it roaring back to life.

Movie: STAR TREK

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Whether you have seen every Star Trek episode and film, or none at all, you should get out and see this, because it isn't just a great Star Trek movie: it's a great movie full stop.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Revitalizing the stagnant franchise, the gifted, visionary Abrams has performed a magical act, a movie that stands on its own merits and will recruit new fans, a work that will please the old trekkies and one that points to potent direction in the future.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams gives Kirk and Spock a new lease of life, but the plot is a mess.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Reintroduces critical elements the franchise has not seen in years - cultural relevance, suspense, and a fresh sense of wonder

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: It's been a long time since the hope and optimism of Gene Roddenberry's vision have seemed this bright, this alive. This is exactly the Star Trek movie this fading franchise needed.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The most exhilarating Trek to date marks a new future for Kirk and co. If this can boldly go on to seek out ideas to match its speed and style, a franchise is reborn.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: The result is a triumph, certain to be regarded as not just one Trek's better moments, but one of the finest films made in the sci-fi genre.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: A stupendous production, Star Trek goes where no movie sequel or prequel has gone before in bringing intelligence and invention to a peak in cinematic storytelling.

Movie: STAR TREK
Critic Review: Script: tick. Casting: tick. Direction: tick. Special effects: tick. It's an extraordinary achievement and great entertainment for all as we partake in an edge-of-seat thrill-ride.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: There's a mundane theme running under the adventures of alien exploration and a villain who will not be named: styles of contemporary office management.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This is a film that's simultaneously trying too hard and aiming too low.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This movie is action PACKED.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness finally gives the talented Cumberbatch the chance to show Hollywood what he can do on the big screen, and, boy, does he seize it with both hands.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Darkness never really works as anything because it doesn't have any purpose.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Even with his superior technology and an established commitment to innovative storytelling, Abrams might have been overly ambitious when deciding to halfway alter a classic.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The socio-political commentary of 'Star Trek Into Darkness' is about as sophisticated as you'd expect from scribes Roberto Orci and Alex Kurtman, who also wrote the first two 'Transformers' movies.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The film is pretty spectacular, with enthralling action sequences and stellar special effects (when you can make them out through director J.J. Abrams' omnipresent lens flares).

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A well-made, somewhat serious-minded adventure flick is a rare thing, even one that does not seem quite as deliciously new as J.J. Abrams's 2009 reinvention -- which is merely to say that it is not my new favourite popcorn flick of all time.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: At the core of Abrams' brilliant rebranding, beyond the astute and well-measured use of high-powered special FX, is the inspired casting of Chris Pine and Zachary Quinto as the younger Kirk and Spock.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: An exhilarating and often moving addition to the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Its greatest embarrassment is in trying to steal classic Star Trek moments without having a clue as to why those moments had meaning.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The film will grab you from the opening shot and not let go.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: What Abrams has given us is the gravy without the meat and potatoes.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's an agreeable ride and the fact that it treads so little new ground doesn't much detract from its pleasures.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The poor movie. It just wears itself right out.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This sorry sequel feels rote and hopelessly derivative, timidly going where we all have already gone before.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness still manages to be an even more enjoyable film than its precursor.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: In terms of sheer spectacle, there's no denying that it delivers. For all the build-up, hype, and hope leading up to the film, it's just a shame there isn't a whole lot more.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Set phasers for fun with this blockbuster.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Sets its phasers on fun

Critic Review: One of the attributes this sequel to the prequel has going for it is a villain whose threat to mankind requires no prosthetics and/or makeup to freeze you in your seat.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The sequel lacks the consistent creative vision of the 2009 outing. Nevertheless, Star Trek Into Darkness should satisfy the hardcore Trekkers while reaching out to audiences unfamiliar with the [ series'] mythology.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Action set pieces interrupt with sonic booms, like clockwork, whenever the character development lasts more than a few minutes.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: You don't have to be totally immersed in Trekkie lore to follow "Into Darkness," but a bit of basic Trek 101 would at least shed a little guiding light.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's definitely a fun action movie, but I'm ready for these films to boldly go in their own direction, instead of hanging on to the originals.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Most of the logic has leached away from this movie, and with it half of the fun.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Critic Review: At its best, Star Trek Into Darkness is Cumberbatch; at its worst, it's cumbersome.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Critic Review: Like the Vulcan IDIC, it is infinite diversity in infinite combinations, allowing for surprise as tropes regroup and characters react in accordance with what we've come to expect from them, but with refreshing twists.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Happily, there's a good deal of fun if you like things crashing violently into each other and out of warp-drive at regular intervals.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Pine and Quinto have grown into their roles and seem much more assured than four years ago. Quinto is especially impressive. This could be the best Star Trek movie of them all.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: While it doesn't quite reach the giddy heights of its 2009 predecessor, this new picture is terrific popcorn entertainment, the sort of bright, brawny blockbuster that used to define the summer movie season.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: For the most part, the film is a carbon copy of the last one, in both its strengths and weaknesses.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The set up for future sequels is not done subtly but with an assurance that this puppy is going to be around for a long while.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The new Star Trek film by wunderkind director JJ Abrams is much, much better than his much-lauded 2009 Trek reboot. It had to be...Abrams has packed together a ripping, morally complex, highly intelligent story with some truly awe-striking visuals.

Critic Review: The best tear-pumpers are the simplest: the passing mention of a starship called the USS Bradbury, or Kirk helplessly extending his arm to a crewman falling past him to his death.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: More business than artful execution. Director J.J. Abrams just isn't a natural born storyteller, all high notes and no rhythm.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It is a fine movie, but I couldn't help but be a little disappointed. There was something missing that didn't make this film bad but also didn't make the film great.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: For all its chasing and falling and fighting-and the movie supplies a great deal of each-Star Trek Into Darkness is at its best when the Enterprise crew are merely bickering and bantering among themselves: less space opera than soap opera.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Let the summer movie sweepstakes begin! Funny, reverent, suspenseful, heartfelt, chock-full of dazzling effects. Easily one of the best in the durable franchise!

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: There's a palpable new comfort level among the performers in their iconic roles for the second time and working from a script that has moved beyond introductions and reacquaintances for audiences.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The humor in the dialogue, always droll and sometimes laugh-out-loud funny, relies mostly on Quinto's ability to give deadpan line readings.

Critic Review: For Trekkies, Abrams' film is part two of an extended, mostly pleasurable exercise in alternate reality resonance -- it's like film fan fiction, minus the slash-fic component.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A popcorn sci-fi movie.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Entertaining, smartly written, and well-paced, Star Trek Into Darkness is actually a better film overall than 2009's Star Trek.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: t may have taken me two films, but I'm finally on board with this Star Trek reboot.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams isn't only resuscitating the franchise. He's improved it.

Critic Review: an amazing experience, both giddy in its dedication to the beginnings and arrogant in its desire to mess with everything the previous franchise worshiped

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Loaded with wall-to-wall action, STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS is a blast of summer movie fun. While it's probably geared to a more mainstream audience, if Trekkies go in with an open mind, they'll probably love it.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: For two movies in a row now -- and possibly even more in the second than the first -- [Abrams has] caught some of the spark of the first Star Trek without either mimicking or desecrating the original.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The real revelation is Cumberbatch, who steals the show as the film's alluring yet evil antagonist.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Yes, this one is even better: funnier, brawnier and ingeniously constructed for appeal to both devoted fans and reluctant converts.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Overall, it's fun popcorn entertainment, but nowhere as enjoyable and/or brilliant as the 2009 reboot of the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Through Abrams' beautiful use of Giacchino's epic film score, 35mm anamorphic lens flares, and his incredible detail in character, I found myself weeping nerd tears! See it in IMAX!

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The result is a wild piece of entertainment that manages to be about something. Beam yourself up for this one.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams's Star Trek Into Darkness, the sequel to his prequel, delivers the goods, even if some of the goods are less than fresh.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Rip-roaring set-pieces aside, the biggest pleasure here is still the yin-yang chemistry between Kirk and Spock, even as the writers sand down the barbed edges of the characters' interactions.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: If anything, Into Darkness shoves a Klingon dagger right between hard-core Trekkers shoulder blades. But those folks were never Abrams' target market, obviously. Everyone else may very well have a warp-speed blast.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams' space isn't the final frontier: The landscape reads more like, "Haven't we been here before?" Well, yes, but a whirligig doesn't go anywhere, either, and it's still fun to watch it spin.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek: Into Darkness does not quite reach the heights of the first film, but it does pass muster as a terrific summer popcorn movie.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams proves he can more than back up the smack, so series fans just need to cower as he backhands them upside the head.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Star Trek Into Darkness" is one of the most aggressively self-conscious summer blockbusters ever made.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The weaknesses covered up by the fan-boy thoroughness of the last Enterprise outing are more glaring this time. It's not enough to present caricatures of the original cast

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams boldly goes into Star Trek Into Darkness, and crushes it again. It's more fun and more intense, without giving less to the characters.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The qualitative gap between narrative mechanics and character work is about as stark as it could be, but the latter is so effective, and the cast so tremendously effective in their roles, that Star Trek Into Darkness works well, all things considered.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It leaves fans wondering what's next in the franchise, which will surely make Paramount happy, but doesn't stand on its own like the truly great part twos.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Nearly as exciting and engaging as its predecessor, and just as supremely well crafted.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Action, action and more action defines J.J. Abrams' latest Star Trek. Benedict Cumberbatch makes an excellent bad guy. Did I mention the action?

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I couldn't help feeling let down. Not because J.J. Abrams and his writers have ignored what "Star Trek" fans want. It's that they've pandered to it to such a degree that it feels less like fan appreciation and more like base-covering pragmatism.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: While not marking as significant a step to boldly go where few science fiction sequels have gone before, Abrams makes a very entertaining one.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Into Darkness repeatedly and unapologetically sacrifices science-fiction thoughtfulness on the altar of blockbuster "Wow."

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This story is in the most literal sense, close to home.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: ...this is one voyage that Enterprise fans will be happy to take.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A spirited and ripping sci-fi yarn that works every bit as well as that first one -- and, at least on one level, even better.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The day may come when they stumble as their predecessors did. That day is not today.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This is sufficiently rousing and entertaining that it should please a majority of movie-goers whether they're confessed Trek fans or not.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: By film's end it's clear that Abrams really needed two films to fully complete his reboot

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This is an exciting entry -- one of the best entries, really -- in the series.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams and his team have shown tremendous care for [the franchise] and have discovered exactly what it is that makes the fans love it as much as they do.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Giving all impending summer 2013 tentpoles a reason to be intimidated, "Star Trek Into Darkness" should safely reintroduce audiences to just how much fun moviegoing can be.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I thought it was really fun, an inventive, surprising rethinking of some of "Star Trek's" most hallowed inventions, but I'm not wedded to the source material as gospel. Trekkies will think it's a desecration. So, pick your side

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness offers [a] qualified satisfaction, which, especially after the second half, is akin to the relief of surviving a long beating.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Into Darkness is a sleek, thrilling epic that's also a triumphantly witty popcorn morality play. It's everything you could want in a Star Trek movie.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I'd say it's a good thing I went into Star Trek Into Darkness with lowered expectations, because I ended up liked it way more than I expected to.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Instead of reminding us why we love the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Into Darkness floods the screen with spectacle and relies on memories of the past to fill in the blanks.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Without missing a beat, Abrams continues with his reimagined Star Trek universe, offering satisfying nods to the past and a fresh surge forward.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: What this movie does with a not-unfamiliar-to-some story is pretty clever, and the incarnation of a classic villain by British cheekbone virtuoso Benedict Cumberbatch is vivid and engaging.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's a great deal of brash fun, and it should satisfy all those basic Trekkie cravings.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: If the action scenes aren't up to par, and the passion isn't in evidence, then what is there? This movie is fine, and dull.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: For all its reckoning with mass destruction, this franchise's vision of a future Earth remains optimistic. The film mixes the iconically familiar with the futuristic.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness still has the explosive power of high-end entertainment. And it features some crafty allusions to other movies in the genre, but it's as artful as a shotgun blast. It hits the mark, but shreds the entire target.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness banishes, at least for the moment, the lugubrious mood and sepulchral look that too many comic-book movies mistake for sophistication. All hail an action film that isn't ashamed to have fun and to be seen doing it.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Like its entertaining predecessor, "Star Trek Into Darkness" offers much of what the fans expect and not much of what they don't. This character-driven vehicle is a supercharged example of cinematic craftsmanship.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's hyper-competent and technically slick, yet made with affection, and emotional and textual understanding of the old TV show.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Trek lite. Perhaps in the next film Abrams and company may set their sights on something more ambitious: finding consequential new stories to tell in their rebooted universe.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: There's absolutely nothing wrong with "Star Trek Into Darkness" -- once you understand it as a generic comic-book-style summer flick faintly inspired by some half-forgotten boomer culture thing.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams' second Star Trek movie is chock-full of goodies, but by the last quarter the action is so inflated and relentless that it's like an anvil chorus played on your head.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams stays true to the main virtues of the series: The camaraderie of the Enterprise crew, the bond of friendship among Kirk, Spock and Dr. McCoy, and the way the old series created science-fiction allegories to explore current dilemmas.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Into darkness it should go, where no one can see it

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Maybe it is too late to lament the militarization of Star Trek, but in his pursuit of blockbuster currency, Mr. Abrams has sacrificed a lot of its idiosyncrasy and, worse, the large-spirited humanism that sustained it.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This is the same Enterprise crew we've known for 40-plus years, but they're just different enough to pop a few surprises on you.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: An immensely engaging sci-fi thriller about friendship, leadership, and loss in a tense and war-mongering intergalactic world.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This latest movie has a formula that's rare for summer blockbusters: smart and engrossing plot + a barrage of big-budget special effects = an overwhelmingly good time.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: You barely get a chance to catch a breath as this saga takes off like a starship and just keeps going, from its Indiana Jones-style opening to its cosmos-rattling finale. And all in 3D, no less.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Even more entertaining than Abrams' first one...the first real blockbuster hit of the summer.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness is a first class ticket into outer space. If you feel the urge, rocket yourself into blockbuster happiness.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams' sophomore effort picks its references well, builds on the relationships established in the original series (and tweaked in the last movie) and keeps the quips and battles coming. Warp speed, Captain.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Star Trek Into Darkness" is ridiculously exciting. Which is to say it's so exciting it's ridiculous. But in a good way.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Smart or...dumb? Yes, and...fun to hang around with for a couple of hours.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Convoluted, sure. But compare it to "The Great Gatsby" for a quick (or not) lesson in the difference between exhilarating and exhausting.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This ill-named sequel plays more like a transitional story than its own film.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Star Trek" is still boldly going...But somewhere along the way, Abrams got lost in the Galaxy of Not Much Fun.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's fantastic to watch the Enterprise rev up to light speed, leaving twin trails behind its nacelles, like an intergalactic hotrod burning celestial rubber. But as with the film's predecessor, simple emotion is what grounds the story.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Jettisoning the franchise's optimistic, socially aware sci-fi, not to mention character development or a logical plot, Darkness turns out to be any Vulcan's worst nightmare: Team America: World Police with Tribbles.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Darkness is a cheery combo of classic catchphrases and young Hollywood heat ...

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It isn't as effective as the first overall, but there are so many exceptional set pieces that it packs more than enough momentum to pull through and deliver a riveting experience.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness may not go boldly back to the archives, but it serves up an exhilarating spectacle, with noteworthy moments of intimacy.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: As long as Abrams is in charge, the new Star Trek movies will live long and prosper.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams gets considerable help from a cast who go after their roles with great zest.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The new film works. It's rousing. The human element, and the Vulcan element, to say nothing of various other species, are present, accounted for and taken seriously enough to matter.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A solid but unspectacular effort that sets the stage for the next chapters.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The movie delivers the goods on both narrative and razzle-dazzle action levels.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's not the knockout the last "Star Trek" movie was, but it moves things along efficiently.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: There's something especially disconcerting about Into Darkness's hollowness, given the visibly provocative content that, in true Trek fashion, is meant to put us in mind of our precarious present.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: An excessively derivative what-if rehash of themes and interactions that came before, most of the characters lesser copies and even caricatures of the originals.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The movie presses forward with a high-spirited wit and sense of purpose that makes other action extravaganzas look backward.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Adrenaline-fueled and highly entertaining, filled with feverish, fast-paced excitement and suspense. Live long and prosper!

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A note-perfect blend of escapist fun and thought-provoking commentary, ensemble drama, comic relief, daredevil action and senses-shattering spectacle.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The action is exhilarating, the visual effects spectacular - and spectacularly realized.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: And down goes Iron Man 3. ... Every blockbuster should be this hefty, with the fleetness of warp.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Cast has chemistry and sparkle, but 'Star Trek Into Darkness' just okay.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Into Darkness" is a warp-speed ride of intense suspense, lens flares, mystery and thrills, dipping in and out of "Star Trek" lore and ultimately creating a fresh new direction.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: One of the general strengths of Star Trek Into Darkness, in fact, is the feeling of high stakes and genuine threat, which is exceedingly hard to pull off in any long-running franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Into Darkness" is fast and fun, zipping along on all thrusters while everyone on the bridge settles comfortably into an agreeably lighthearted vibe (and into ever-slimmer outfits).

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The film is densely plotted, occasionally bordering on the convoluted, but the clarity and inventiveness of the direction keeps the drama and the action constantly percolating.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: [Provides] bustling fun equal to its modest ambitions ...

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A stunningly nervy sequel that vaporizes any worries that Abrams' terrific 2009 reboot was a fluke.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The only darkness here - besides the dingy-looking images dimmed by 3-D glasses - is the murky plot, which is as silly as it is arbitrary.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: You could spend the rest of the summer waiting for a better popcorn movie. But that would be highly illogical.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A totally stupid movie, STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS falls apart as it goes, raining debris as it implodes like a building being demolished

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A glorious nostalgia trip, continuing the Star Trek reboot in style through a cunning meld of the best of 1980s action sci-fi with high-end 2013 glossiness.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Remember, this is the summer movie season, where spectacle trumps all, and boy does this movie know how to show off its more spectacular moments. Trust me, you'll have a good time.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The "Star Trek" franchise has its weaknesses, but it's still the best thing going in the sci-fi genre.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams has a gift for making us feel as if Star Trek Into Darkness vaulted from our own Trek-ish daydreams.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Massive in scale yet also capable of intimacy, JJ Abrams' latest movie is another blockbuster hit.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Handsomely directed, often beautiful, full of impressive action, what it is in desperate search of is a good story - something it never finds.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A straightforward, blessedly unencumbered popcorn flick brimming with excitement and slickly rendered spectacle.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A brilliant, bromantic blockbuster.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams might not have improved on his original. But he leaves Star Trek in shape to warrant a 50th anniversary blockbuster... in 2016!

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness gets the job done without ever threatening to raise one's pulse. It's a thoroughly professional entertainment.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: In short, it's utterly familiar and absolutely original. We couldn't have asked for more.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: J.J Abrams keeps the engaging human drama bubbling along nicely, aided by his outstanding cast, and he maintains a fierce pace. He ensures that both Trekkies and newcomers to the Star Trek universe should be boldly entertained.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: JJ Abrams hits warp speed right from the start of Star Trek Into Darkness, kicking off the movie with a breathtaking sequence that combines breakneck thrills, deadpan comedy and deft use of Star Trek lore.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The screen explodes with all the colours of the universe in Star Trek Into Darkness.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: In its quieter moments, between the frustrating amount of lens flares and deliberate CG camera wobbles, there is a graceful intelligence to the film.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A bad cover of your favourite song.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: No shortage of large scale action on offer both on land and in space.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Star Trek Into Darkness" kind of slumps back into the franchise's own canon, which is why it feels a bit less fun, fresh and funky than its predecessor; It's still a good time.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Like its predecessor, it's not just a great Star Trek movie; it's a great movie, period.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Entertaining, flashy, and action-packed, if rather lacking in substance, Into Darkness represents a continuing improvement on the franchise, with interesting implications as to the direction of future films.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A solid but infrequently spectacular addition to a rejuvenated franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Above all, Quinto is enduringly great: his Spock is vulnerable, sensitive, emotionally constricted, but idealistic and heroic as well. The franchise will always have life with him on board.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness is the most visually spectacular film in the franchise...Narratively, however, it's more problematic - its incessant references and cribs from predecessors are a disappointment.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: As in the first film, Chris Pine and Zachary Quinto are an inspired pairing as Kirk and Spock, and their squabbling bromance provides Into Darkness's breathlessly-paced adventure with a heart.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The spectacle remains in this sequel but the IQ of the franchise takes a massive nose dive

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: English actor Cumberbatch is strikingly malevolent as the villain here, but he's matched by Quinto (who again almost out-Spocks Spock), Zoë Saldana's Uhura, Simon Pegg's near-OTT Scotty and even Pine, whose Kirk is tougher here than in the first flick.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Set your phaser to awesome. Star Trek Into Darkness is a thrilling, joyride of a film that will have diehard trekkies and neophytes alike beaming.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Manages to appease lifelong Star Trek fans without alienating newcomers.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: J.J. Abrams' ability to smash set pieces and whip together high octane action sequences is up there with the best of them.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Into Darkness is in large part designed to make Trek fans nudge one another in the ribs and emit excited fanboy yelps of recognition. How much you enjoy the film will depend on your appetite for homage.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The Force is strong with this one.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Some of the Kirk vs. Spock scenes I felt were a retread of the first film, but it's a minor bone to pick with an otherwise tremendous sci-fi movie.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I'd say it ranks slightly below the 2009 reboot - it's good, not great.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I enjoyed Into Darkness immensely, and I can't wait to see it again... but I'm not sure I could call this a summery popcorny sort of film. It's too grim for that.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Hugely enjoyable, pacily directed sequel with a witty script, superb special effects and terrific performances, though some of the nods to the previous films and TV shows badly backfire.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness is bolted together with clinical precision by Abrams, who orchestrates each daredevil chase and skirmish with breathless abandon.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Abrams approaches the subject-matter with the zest, imagination and humour of Steven Spielberg on top form.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This is a pleasingly constructed story and any telegraphed plot points only add to the anticipation of some big moments.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Take-flight moments of blockbuster bliss are frequent and consistently spectacular, as Abrams continues to prove his rare gift of combining character, plot, comedy and action into setpiece after setpiece

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: While there's plenty of nods to the series keep Star Trek fans happy, Abrams has once again managed to make the franchise accessible for those new to the series.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Except for the occasional 3D indulgence of things flying at your face, making you wince and duck, Star Trek Into Darkness is, for me, a pleasant surprise; thrilling and engaging, sometimes harrowing and always cinematically satisfying

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It is with grand scale, good storytelling & a real spirit of adventure that J.J. Abrams' second film torpedoes onto the screen in 3D, bringing the kind of special effects fantasies are made of.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: As brash, spectacular and energetic as its immediate predecessor, but without novelty on its side

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: I had begun to wonder if any of these big budget monstrosities could deliver something special; something that didn't feel like a facsimile of previous successes, totally devoid of heart and humanity. Star Trek Into Darkness is... almost that.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness remains great fun for non-fans, but especially the faithful, with nods to some of their favourite tropes ...

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: In some sense, the title is misleading. Into Darkness is a blast, fun, funny, spectacular and exhilarating.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A perfectly functional sequel that nevertheless falls rather short of 2009?s water-tight reboot.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It goes quickly, it goes loudly and it goes spectacularly. The only problem is that it never seems to live up to the franchise's original mission statement and go boldly

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness is a long, long way from a disaster, but it's hard not to feel that Abrams' mystery box turned out to be a bit empty this time out

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: "Into Darkness" may not boldly go where no "Trek" adventure has gone before, but getting there is such a well-crafted, immensely pleasurable ride that it would be positively Vulcan to nitpick.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The production gives the impression of a massive machine cranked up for two hours of full output; it efficiently delivers what it's built to do, but without style or personality.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A pretty relentless piece of summer entertainment, anchored by what I consider one of the most exciting movie star performances in recent memory.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Open yourself up to the Star Trek universe and enjoy the thrill of the ride.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It still has that urgency that made the first film so appealing, those big, optimistic messages of right vs wrong in a world at war.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: The Enterprise and all the people on it are gorgeous. It's just that by front-loading so much on the visceral thrills and our affection for these characters, there's just no room for the rather tangled storyline.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: This latest Star Trek wavers entertainingly between the silly and the Shakespearean. After a shaky, old-school start, the comedy comes at warp speed.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: That pioneer spirit? It's gone.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness is a big film, building on the foundations of its predecessor and holding true to the nature of the franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: People are unlikely to charge out of the cinema with quite the same level of glee as they did in 2009; but this is certainly an astute, exhilarating concoction.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: An exhilarating, emotionally rich and utterly pleasurable journey that wears its love for Trek fans old and new on its sleeve.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: Star Trek Into Darkness will send Trekkers into paroxysms of delight.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: A stop-gap tale that's modest, fun and briefly amusing rather than one that breaks new ground or offers hugely memorable set pieces.

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS

Movie: STAR TREK INTO DARKNESS
Critic Review: It's a rousing adventure and Abrams has laid the platform for a healthy and long lasting franchise.

Movie: STAR TREK BEYOND
Critic Review: Familial relationships, nail-biting escapes, and a well-rounded villain bring back elements life-long fans complained were missing from Executive Producer, J.J. Abram's time captaining the ship.

Movie: STAR TREK BEYOND
Critic Review: "Star Trek Beyond" is a perfect combo of blockbuster Summer movie and a tribute to fans of the source material that will live long and prosper.

Movie: STAR TREK BEYOND

Critic Review: It trades a nice line in the 'big dumb fun' brand of stupidity, instead of the 'hound Damon Lindelof off Twitter' variety.

Movie: STAR TREK BEYOND
